loans.name: Koreti Sofia

texts.en: Koreti Sofia I., 50, is married with 6 children.  She sells food to the general public 6 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Koreti expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Koreti’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase banana, taros, oil, stove frying pan.

loans.name: Jopeth Jay

texts.en:
Jopeth Jay L. raises pigs. He started his business with only one piglet, followed by two, and now he has many pigs in his backyard. He is 20 years old and still single. While thinking of having his own family someday, he prefers to save first before he gets married.

He is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy pig feed. The loan will really help in growing his business and income as well. 

CEVI supports Jopeth in his business. Now, he enjoys having CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
The young man in the photograph is Nak S., age 27, who lives in the province of Pursat, which is the best territory for farming. Nak S. is a married man who is devoted to his two young children who attend school and depend on his care. 

Nak S. owns a big farm that he inherited from his grandmother. He grows a various crops on it. He currently plants a peanut crop and he estimates that he will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. He will use the income from selling his mature produce to better meet his family’s needs during the financial crisis. His wife helps him to grow crops. 

Nak S. has another farm that he owns, but he is still not planting crops on it. He hopes to use his Kiva loan to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn T. is from the village of Colupan Bajo,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Genelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Genelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Genelyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In March 2008, Genelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Genelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Genelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Amelia Esther

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=108857&_tpos=f&_tpg=h.  
Amelia is a member of The Orchids village bank. 
She is married, 45 years-old, and has three sons who are 24, 18 and 13 years old. For several years, Amelia has been selling breakfasts at the cafeteria of a company. She gets up at 4 am to prepare the breakfasts, sandwiches, and quinoa. On the weekends, she makes purchases with the help of her son and husband. 
Amelia needs a new loan of 1000 soles to buy sugar, boxes of milk, cheese, and eggs for making breakfasts. Her dream is that her business will grow and that her children will become professionals.

loans.use: buy sugar, boxes of milk, cheese, and eggs for making breakfasts

loans.name: Irene Rose Nyambura

texts.en:
Irene N. is married to Onesmas and they have two children namely Antony and Edwin who are 15 and 5 years old respectively.

Irene has been been hawking items which include African lessos and ladies innerwear for four years.
She practices this business in areas within the low class estate where the population is large and thus a higher market.

She was introduced to KADET by existing clients. She has applied for a loan which she intends to use to add stock and venture into selling of jewellerly too. With the extra profit she plans to pay school fees, her future hopes and dreams are to own a boutique.

Irene believes that she is hardworking.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Add stock for her business

loans.name: Munkhdorj

texts.en:
Munkhdorj E. is 48 years old and lives with her son and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house in the city. Her son currently attends college and her mother is retired. E. manages a clothing and consumer goods trading business from a stall at a local market. She sells a variety of clothing items and her business is most profitable during the cold winter and spring months.

After graduating college, E. worked as a cook for ten years before starting her own business selling consumer goods in 1990. At this time, Mongolia was making a major transition to a democratic government and free market economy. In 2008, after several years of stable earnings, she used her savings to expand her business and began selling clothes in addition to consumer goods. She also moved to her current location at the market.

E. is a very hardworking and decent person. She is very focused on making her business successful as it is the only source of income for her family. She says, "My only wish is to provide for my son's education and help him to be a better person." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase different clothes to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase different clothes to expand her product line

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married and has one child. She owns a small store where she sells various cosmetics products. She has been in this business for twelve years. This experience helps her to choose the right products and to make good sales. Oksana has special prices for certain types of clients, for example older people, and this helps them manage their lives better.

Oksana's business goal is to develop her business further and increase her sales. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. Oksana would use the additional income to remodel her apartment and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César es un joven soltero y muy sereno de 24 años, vive en la casa de su hermano. Tiempo atrás trabajaba para los cultivos de su hermano, a quien le tiene mucha gratitud, pero también piensa que ya es hora de independizarse, por lo cual su hermano mayor está muy contento de tal decisión. Por tal motivo le prestó su chacra, donde César ha sembrado plátanos.  Él tiene mucha confianza de que le irá bien, pero mientras tanto seguirá apoyando a su hermano hasta que obtenga mayor capital. Logrado este objetivo piensa sembrar café por ser un producto más rentable. De salirle todo como él piensa, con las ganancias va a comprar sus propias tierras, donde pueda sembrar tranquilamente todas las plantas que desea.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, donde se ha comprometido en pagar todas sus cuotas en los días señalados. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de plantitas de café y fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
César is a young, calm, 24-year-old bachelor. He lives in his brother's house. He used to work farming his brother's land, and he is very grateful to him. But he also thinks that it is time to become independent, and his older brother is very happy with his decision. For this reason, he loaned a plot of land to him, where César has grown plantains. He has a lot of confidence that this will go very will for him, but meanwhile, he will continue helping his brother until he receives more capital. To acheive this objective, he plans to grow coffee because it is a more profitable crop. If this goes as planned, he will buy his own land with his profits where he can peacefully grow all of the plants that he wants. This is his first credit with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has promised to make all of his payments on their appointed days. He will use the money he is requesting to buy coffee plants and chemical fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee plants and fertilizers

loans.name: Kara Group

texts.en:
Here are Aminata K. and Fatmata K.. These are small scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 to enable them to add more goods to their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profits. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing, and in their academic pursuits. 

Aminata K. (left) is the leader of this group. Aminata is approximately forty-five years of age. She was born in Mashinra, an outskirt of Makeni. Aminata is married with three children. Her husband is an electrician and her children are attending school – two are in junior secondary school and one is in senior secondary school. Aminata sells gara lappers (locally dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs) and sometimes she also sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). Aminata has been selling gara lappers for nearly twenty years now. She will use this loan to buy ten pieces of “brillians” (thirty yards of white cotton makes one brillian). She will also use part of the loan to buy different colors of ink, soda, powder and pay experts who make the designs on the cottons (brillian).

loans.use: To buy white cotton, inks, soda, and powder, and pay designers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is from the town of Carosucan Sta Barbara, Pangasinan. She is 57 years old. Teresita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda M., 58, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Faustino Iglesia, a carpenter, they are blessed with two children who are now working. She makes sure that she helps her husband by managing their own variety store. Aside from managing a store, Yolanda also has a food stand where she sells breakfast and other food viands. She has been in the variety store business for 16 years.

Yolanda has been a member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than five years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow ten times in CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason why she has been consistent in paying her dues is because she used almost all the money she borrowed as added capital for business purposes.  Her business now lets her earn a profit of PHP 5,200 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more food and basic commodities like assorted snacks and beverages for her store.

She dreams that she can save enough money so that she can fix her house and finance her grandchildren's college education someday. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more food and basic commodities like assorted snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Donato Mareano

texts.es: El Sr. C. G. Donato Mareano de 42 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 9 años. Vive al lado de su conviviente, cuenta con  casa propia de material noble recien construida en  el Distritito de San Antonio. Ambos trabajan como obreros de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 10 años de experiencia. Es una persona luchadora, responzable. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que esta en plena contrucción que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007 pero gracias a su esfuerzo lograron reconstruir parte de su vivienda como también comprar sus artefactos. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Donato Mareano C. G. is 42 years old and has a nine year old child. He and his common law wife live in a well-constructed house in the District of San Antonio. They both have been working as farm laborers for an agricultural business for the past ten years. Donato is a strong-willed, responsible person. He is requesting a loan to finish building his house since it was in the middle of construction when the earthquake of 2007 occurred. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to rebuild part of his home and purchase a few appliances. He dreams of having his entire house built so that he can have a better quality of life. He is grateful for the support being provided through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of his house

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 38 years of age, married, and has five children aged between six and eighteen years, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. The family owns a five-roomed house where Cissy lives with eight people. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees, medication, and feeding the family.
Cissy operates a bar in Nabweru Bwaise selling all types of drinks, such as soda water and passion fruit, and beer. She sells both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week and serves an average of 40 customers a day. She has been in this business for over ten years. Her main challenges are seasonal changes and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.
Cissy has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for four years and is now on her seventh loan. She has always worked with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and beer, boxes of mineral water, passion fruits and sugar. She hopes to see her business grow, own a fully stocked bar, and open up another branch in Kawempe.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, beer, and boxes of mineral water

loans.name: Melia's Group

texts.en:
Melia D. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 46 years old. Melia is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI/Kiva. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Melia D. group.

Melia is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melia has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Melia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Melia is requesting a second loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena A. is a married woman who supports her family with her bakery, rolling store selling dried fish, and her hog raising. She lives in Brgy Man-uling Cuayan, Negros Occidental with her 47-year-old husband, Benigno, who also manages the rolling store for dried fish and with their 6 children who are all school-age.

Elena has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1990 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her bakery, rolling dried fish store, and hog-raising businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 9,000.

Elena is now borrowing Php 25,000 so that she can expand her bakery, rolling dried fish store, and hog raising businesses. This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 25,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elena aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock and sell manioc flour

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew N. M. is fifty-six years old. He is married and his wife takes care of the daily household chores.

Mathew's business is located at Landless Estate, a residential area in Thika, and it is well-known by the name “Blessed One”. He owns a general store which sells such items as detergents, soft drinks, loaves of bread, and even vegetables. He serves the residents of Landless Estate and the local construction workers.

Mathew has been in this business for the last three years and he says that, although this business is good, there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so his customers are spoilt for choice. However he works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that his business is doing well.

Mathew is using his loan of 50,000 KES to restock his general store and hopes that his business will grow into a wholesale business some day. He also hopes to educate all his children to university level. He is a very hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: To buy detergent, soft drinks, etc., to restock his store

loans.name: Padumawathi

texts.en:
Padumawathi is a 62-year-old married woman living with her husband and two sons aged 40 and 38 years. They live in the southern coastal town of Hikkaduwa.  All of them work together to provide help in the business and they work well as a team.  The family has a carpet weaving business, which they started after the devastating tsunami in 2004.

Padumawathi is seeking a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to buy more raw materials to process and sell to her expanding base of customers. She thinks the reason for her success is due to her hard working nature and enthusiasm.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To expand her carpet business

loans.name: Sanya

texts.en: Sanya O. sells gas to make a living. Sanya has been in this business for long and he hopes to lift his business and family above poverty. Sanya is a hard working man. He is 42 years old, married with 4 children. He is requesting for a loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more gas to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gas to sell

loans.name: Majida's Group

texts.en:
Majida, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines), Pakistan, owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over twenty-five years. Her husband's name is G. F. and he is a salesman by profession. He sells bakery items such as biscuits, chips and bread to different shops and generates income. He has been doing this work for over three years. 

To support her husband financially, the very caring and talented Majida runs a decorative embroidery business. She makes embroidered dresses on order and earns income. She earns PKR500 from each embroidered dress, which helps her to meet the urgent needs of her family. They both are very hardworking and utilize their income for the betterment of their family. 

Majida is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her own business so she can purchase embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk. This will allow her to increase her profit by completing more dresses.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material in bulk to make embroidered dresses.

loans.name: Ka

texts.en: Mrs. N., age 34, is a married woman and the mother of four school-aged children who are dependent on her. To earn a living, she sells fish that she buys in bulk and normally earns $3.50 per day. N. and her husband always wake up early in the morning to go where there are many fishermen working. They buy fish and then bring them to sell at retail prices at the market. N. has a small size vehicle which is able to carry a little fish. She hopes to replace it by requesting a loan on Kiva. N. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle with an attached trailer to transport more fish.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and trailer to transport her fish

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo S. is from the town of Guitas. He is 59 years old and married, and he has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilfredo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Wilfredo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Wilfredo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Wilfredo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying goods, stock, and merchandise

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean damascene is 39 years old and married.  Jean damascene sells a variety of foodstuffs such as sorghum, beans, peas, maize, etc.  He has been in this business for about 10 years and the hours of his business are from 7 am to 8 pm every day.

Jean damascene needs to shift his business from his residential area to the main market.  To end this, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. This loan will allow him to purchase more foodstuffs for sale.  Jean damascene hopes that with the use of this loan, if he manages to go and operate his business in the main market, his profits will increase to the extent that the living style of his family will also improve.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice, maize, beans, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 2 doors and 1 window

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajado Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Mujeres trabajando", las integrantes de este grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, por que dicen es como se consideran ellas, mujeres muy trabajadoras con ganas de superarse y salir adelante, luchar para conseguir un mejor futuro para sus familias.
Esta historia es sobre la señora Francisca Felisa N. G., ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras con ganas de superarse, ella tiene 61 años es viuda desde hace 40 años y tiene 2 hijos Miguel de 27 años que trabaja para apoyar a su mamá con los gastos de la casa y Jesús de 23 el esta estudiando la carrera en Derecho, su hermano y su mamá lo están apoyando, ella se dedica a el bordado de blusas y batas también elabora velas, el crédito que recibirá lo va a invertir en compra de mas mantas, hilos y demás material que necesita para seguir elaborando estos trajes típicos.
 
Doña francisca dice que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, por que la aprendió desde que tenia 11 años ya que su mamá le enseño, lleva mas de 30 años dedicándose a realizar esta actividad, pues desde que su esposo falleció tuvo que buscar la manera de  como sacar a sus hijos adelante.
 
Ella esta muy satisfecha con los resultados que esta obteniendo de su negocio, ya que esta teniendo mucho éxito por que el numero de clientes que tiene esta creciendo bastante, tanto que ahora tiene que viajar a los diferentes estados de la republica, para vender sus trajes típicos y los de sus compañeras.
 
La señora Felisa me dice que en ningún momento ha fallado con los pagos de su préstamo, ni ella ni sus compañeras de grupo, puesto que son mujeres muy trabajadora responsables y puntuales en las cuales se puede confiar, ya que tiene tiempo de conocerlas puesto que son de la misma comunidad y este no es su primer préstamo con FRAC, llevan varios y en ninguno han quedado mal.
 
Esta muy agradecida con el apoyo y confianza que fundación realidad y los donadores de kiva , les están dando tanto a ella como a sus compañeras, ya que gracias a esto han podido salir adelante con su negocio, y ayudar a sus familias para mejorar su calidad de vida.
 
El sueño que tiene doña francisca es el de poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos a sus hijos, a uno con sus estudios para que termine su carrera y tenga un buen trabajo y no tenga que sufrir tanto como su hermano, y al otro con sus gastos ya que como trabaja en el campo, a veces no tiene trabajo y aparte de eso lo que le pagan es muy poco, también quiere construir o comprar un local para poner su tienda de ropa típica, para así no tener que andar viajando y obtener mejores ganancias.
 
Las integrantes de este grupo y las actividades a las que se dedican son las siguientes:
Sofía G. M.-venta de ropa típica 
Francisca Felisa N. G.-venta de ropa típica
Cecilia G. S.-venta de ropa típica
Sebastiana H. L. G.-venta de ropa típica
Honoria N. G.-venta de dulce
Victoria María L. M.-venta de ropa típica
Gabriela Delfina L. S.-venta de ropa típica
Emelia G. N.- venta de ropa típica
Virginia G. N.- venta de ropa típica                                                                   
Virginia G. G.- venta de ropa típica
Clemencia G. S.- venta de ropa típica
Sofía Honoria G. G.- venta de ropa típica
Eloina G. N.- venta de ropa típica
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Trabajando” (Working Women). The members of the group selected this name because they consider themselves to be extremely hardworking women who want to succeed and move forward so that they can provide a better future for their families.

The description will focus on Sra. Francisca Felisa N. G., one of the members of this group of women entrepreneurs who want to excel. She is 61 years old and has been a widow since she was 40. Francisca has two children. Miguel is 27 years old and works to help his mother with the household expenses. Jesús is 23 years old and studying for a law degree while his brother and mother support him. Francisca earns a living by making embroidered blouses and gowns, as well as candles. The loan she will receive will be used to buy more fabric, thread, and other materials needed to continue making these traditional garments.

Doña Francisca says she decided to pursue this business activity because she learned the skills from her mother when she was eleven years old. She started this business 30 years ago. Since the death of her husband, she needed to find a way for her children to get ahead. Francisca is very pleased with the results of her business. She has had great success with the number of customers she has gained and it continue to grow since she travels to different states in the republic, where she sells traditional clothing along with her fellow group members.

Sra. Francisca says that neither she nor the other members have failed to make their loan payments. These women are hardworking, responsible, prompt, and trustworthy. Over time they have gotten to know one another since are from the same community. This is not their first loan with FRAC. In fact, they have taken several of them and have not had any problems.

Francisca is extremely grateful for the support and the trust that Fundación Realidad and Kiva lenders have given to her and her fellow group members. She is thankful that they will be able to get ahead in their businesses and help their families improve their quality of life.

Doña Francisca dreams of being able to support her children. She wants to help her younger son finish his degree so that he can find a good job and not have to suffer like his brother by having to work in the fields, work at jobs with low pay, or go through stretches of time when no work is available. She also wants to either build or buy a store where she can sell traditional clothing so that she does not have to travel in order to generate better income.

The members of this group and their business activities are as follows: Sofía G. M. – sells traditional clothing Francisca Felisa N. G. - sells traditional clothing Cecilia G. S. - sells traditional clothing Sebastiana H. L. G. - sells traditional clothing Honoria N. G. – sells candy Victoria María L. M.- sells traditional clothing Gabriela Delfina L. S. - sells traditional clothing Emelia G. N. - sells traditional clothing Virginia G. N. - sells traditional clothing Virginia G. G. - sells traditional clothing Clemencia G. S. - sells traditional clothing Sofía Honoria G. G. - sells traditional clothing Eloina G. N. - sells traditional clothing

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, and other materials for making embroidered clothing

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La Sra. Reina Nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, vive en el barrio el Bajio km 6 de la ciudad, su actividad principal es atención de una discoteca, también se dedica a la venta de producto de primera necesidad,  su esposo con el cual tienen dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar  es técnico de computadoras, el cual le ayuda en la economía del hogar, el destino del créditos es para comprar muebles para su negocio, ya que la discoteca de la Sra. Es muy conocida por la zona y tiene mucha clientela, es un apersona responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Reina, from the city of Santa Cruz, lives in the barrio of Bajio, 6 kilometers from the city. Her principal activity is managing a discotheque and, also, she sells products of prime necessity. Her husband, with whom she has 2 children of school age, is a computer technician, and she helps him with household expenses. The loan will be used to buy furniture for her business, since the discotheque is well-known in the district and has a lot of clientèle. Reina is a responsible and hard-working person, and is very grateful to the institution for the offered help.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FURNITURE FOR HER DISCOTHEQUE

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Ester L. G., tiene la edad de 62 años  madre soltera, de 3 hijos mayores de edad con sus familias habitan de forma independiente en el exterior, ella se dedica a al comercio, y recibe un apoyo económico de sus hijos, su vivienda necesita de algunas remodelaciones y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la edificación y compuesta de la parte trasera de su patio, con el objetivo de tener mejores comodidades con la intención que cuando sus hijos le visiten con su familia y brindarles optimas condiciones y comodidades que hagan sentirle bien a la señora G.. 

Espera le apoyen económicamente pues este es uno de sus mayores anhelos y por las condiciones actuales del país se le ha obstaculizado la realización de este sueño.
texts.en:
Maria Ester L. G. is 62 years old.  She is the single mother of three adult children who are all married and on their own.  She is a merchant who also receives some financial assistance from her children.

Her home needs a few improvements and so she is requesting a loan for construction and repair of the rear part of her patio.  This will provide Mrs. G. with more comfortable conditions and she will be able to provide better conditions for when her children visit with their families.

She hopes that they will be able to continue to provide some financial support, but the country’s current condition has interfered with this dream.

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Patrick Musyoki

texts.en:
Patrick is married.  He and his wife have three children whom they support.  Patrick describes himself as hardworking, honest and trustworthy.

Patrick has been in the clothes-selling business for two years.  With this loan, he plans to add more to the stock of clothes that he has for sale so that he can satisfy his customers with a variety of choices.  Part of his additional stock will includes baby clothes, as these are greatly in demand.   Patrick's business is located in an open air market, thus he has access to many customers.

With his extra profits, he desires to be able to provide for basic needs for the family.  In the future, Patrick hopes to grow his business and build rental houses and own a matatu.

He was introduced to KADET by group members, and he is acquiring his first loan.  He has never borowed from any other MFI.

loans.use: To add to the stock of clothes he has for sale

loans.name: Luceros En La Manana Group

texts.es: El grupo “Luceros  en la mañana”  se encuentra ubicado en Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 15  integrantes.La Señora. Juana P. S. Es tesorera del grupo. Tiene 43 años, estudió la primaria y  el oficio de estilista. Tiene un hijo que depende económicamente de ella.  En la foto se puede apreciar que tiene una estética y el poco material con el que cuenta, lleva 5 años dedicándose a este oficio. Ella comenta que va invertir en materiales,  como los  tintes que es lo que más utiliza, la señora Juana tiene la seguridad de atraer mas clientes contando con el material suficientes, además con sus ganancias pretende volverlo a invertir para que en un futuro su estética sea una de las mas modernas y equipadas que tenga su comunidad.
texts.en: The “Luceros en la mañana” ("Stars of the Future") group is located in Puebla, Mexico.  The group has 15 members. Juana P. S. is the group's treasurer. She is 43 years old, has a primary school education, and is a hair stylist.  She has one son, who depends on her economically. In the photo, you can see that she has a salon, but little material to work with.  She has been doing this job for five years.  She would like to invest in stock, such as the dyes she uses most.  Juana knows she can attract more clients, if she were to have sufficient stock, and she wants to invest her earnings in her business so that her salon can be one of the most modern and well-equipped in her community.

loans.use: To invest in stock so as to improve their business.

loans.name: Yanina Marleni

texts.es:
Yanina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito de Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la señora  estudió educación secundaria.

Yanina viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, el primer préstamo solicitado fue S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio venta de abarrotes.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Yanina is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Triunfadoras” located in the Cabanilla district in Lampa province in the department of Puno.  She is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Yanina has a high school education.

Yanina has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for a year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she used the loan to increase her working capital in her business selling groceries.

Now she will request a new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business.

Her dream is to grow her business.  What she like most about her communal bank are the chats she has with the members and the interest that she earns on her savings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business selling groceries

loans.name: Santos Gabriela

texts.es: Santos Gabriela de 56 años, se dedica a la venta de envases y cuajada por libra, ella vive en el reparto Carlos Fonseca. Su negocio consiste en comercializar los envases vacios de cervezas, salsa de tomates, de mayonesa, salsa inglesa, envases de shampoo ella los limpia y los vende a una empresa que se encarga de comprárselo también vende las cuajadas de manera ambulante pues las consigue por medio de una amiga que se las proporciona a un precio accesible para que ella puede venderlas.  Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de cuajada y de algunos envases. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos Gabriela, 56, sells containers and curd by the pound.  She lives in the Carlos Fonseca district.

Her business is to sell empty containers of beer, tomato sauce, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce and shampoo.  She cleans and sells them to a company that is committed to buying from her.

She also itinerantly sells the curd, wich she gets from a friend that sells to her at an affordable price.

She is asking for this loan to purchase curd and some containers.  In the future, she wants to finish building her home.

loans.use: Working capital for business selling curd/recycled containers.

loans.name: Tomasa Yamilet

texts.es: Tomasa Yamilet tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa nueva. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable que busca la forma de generar ingresos a su hogar. Ella recorre diferentes lugares en donde obtiene nuevos clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos entre otras cosas. Se acerca una buena temporada y ya tiene ciertos pedidos pendientes. Sueña con surtir su negocio e incrementar cada día más su actividad.
texts.en: Tomasa Yamilet is 38 years old, and earns her living by selling new clothes. She has been running this business for more than 11 years. She is a very responsible person who is seeking a way of generating income for her household. She visits different places to look for new customers. She is requesting the loan in order to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses, among other items. A busy period is approaching and she already has a few orders pending. Her dream is to stock her business and expand it day by day.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y la última de sus cinco hijos en el sector Las Dunas, una zona marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona comercial que se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta desde hace más de dos años con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja eventualmente como albañil, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Teodolinda desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Teodolinda ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad también compró mas productos y pudo ampliar su bodega. Actualmente ella se encuentra bastante contenta y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Teodolinda is a mother, is 50 years old, and lives with her husband and the youngest of her five children in Las Dunas, a area outside the district of Lambayeque. This is in a commercial area located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

She has had a small store in her home, where she offers her clients diverse products including general goods and groceries. With the income from this activity, she helps her husband, who works as a bricklayer, with the family’s expenses.

Teodolinda wants to grow her business by acquiring more merchandise so that she can satisfy her clients’ demands. To increase her sales and earn more income, she has come to Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 1500 nuevos soles. 

Teodolina has already had a loan from Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa. At that time, she also bought more products and was able to grow her store. At present, she is very happy and thankful for Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To grow her business by acquiring more merchandise to satisfy her clients' demands

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandra; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta y preparación de pan, ella prepara diferentes tipos de pan y luego lo vende en la plaza de armas de Oropesa, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar el pan.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department

Alejandra is 54 years old, widowed, and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She makes different types of bread which she sells in the main square in Oropesa.  She would like to expand and improve her bread-selling business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread.

Alejandra is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen K. is 29 years old, married to Farefax, and they have two children aged 11 and two years old. 

Maureen has a beauty salon that she is running and also has a boutique within the salon. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by another client. She is in need of hair extensions and materials to add to her stock. Her monthly income is Kes 10,000.

Her desire is to open up another business in another town.

loans.use: Buy materials to add to her stock such as hair extensions

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline T. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 47 years old. Evangeline is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Evangeline is just starting this business.

In 2011, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman who lives in Rizal, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and a fish vending business.  Her husband Fausto, who is 56 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 10 and 31 years old. Rosalia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,500 uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000 to buy more goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Rosalia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
Mashhura M. is married and has 4 children. Together with her husband, she sells women's clothing in the central market. Mashhura has been in this business for 10 years. Mashhura's business is constantly growing. Two of the advantages she has in the competitive market are affordable prices and regular additions to her inventory. Her little vending kiosks are very popular in the marketplace where she works. Mashhura realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business, as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business. She would like to make it easier for women to find comfortable and good quality clothing, which is why she is requesting a loan of 9,500 Somoni. One of Mashhura's further plans is to continue expanding her trade and eventually generate enough profit to finish remodeling her house and improve her family's living standards. 
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Lomie

texts.en:
Lomie P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 50 years old. Lomie is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lomie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Lomie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lomie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lomie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Lomie is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lomie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is married and she works hard to support her family. Gladys has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for 3 years. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase chicken, hotdogs, pork, etc. for her food vending business. In the future, Gladys would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat for her food vending business

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice M. is 30 years old. She is married to a farmer, and they have five children, who are all in school.

She's currently in the business of selling fish and has taken out a loan to stock more fish to sell. Her future goal is to stock more goods to sell.

loans.use: to stock more fish

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is a 39-year-old married lady. She is blessed with two children. Jordan is 8 years old and is in the second grade of elementary school, and Erly is 4 years old and not yet  at school. Kristina also adopted a young girl, Marlince, who is 16 years old and in the first grade of senior high school. 

Kristina and her children are living in Belo Village. She is married to Pelipus, a 40-year-old taxi driver who is living in Irian Jaya, one of the provinces in Indonesia.

Pelipus usually sends money to Kristina, but it is not sufficient to fully cover their living. Moreover, Pelipus also needs money to live in Irian Jaya. 

Kristina has been running a kiosk business for eight years with her own capital, but the business is not developed well due to the limited capital that she has. 

Kristina intends to add stock for daily needs in her kiosk such as instant noodles, snacks, coffees, sugar, etc. Kristina is hoping that TLM is willing to help her by providing a loan. She is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000 to purchase more stock for the continuation of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as instant noodles, snacks, coffees, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 68 years old and single.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 11 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Paz is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Lucero De La Mañana Group

texts.es:
Doña Federica, es una señora casada, tiene 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos, 3 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la venta de ropa típica y como también a la confección de delantales, inició pensando en su superación familiar y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la confección de pantalones y delantales. 

Organiza un grupo con el objetivo de solicitar un préstamo que servirá para ampliar su capital de produccion, en esta ocasión para la compra de telas típicas para seguir produciendo mas delantales y poder comercializarlos; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades económicas: venta de ropa, alimentos, atención a tienda en general, confección de delantales y pantalones, confección de blusas y a la cianza de aniamales. En el futuro creen que su negocio sera grande y con diferente productos.
texts.en:
Ms. Federica is a 45 year-old married woman. She did not have the opportunity to study at all. She has four children, three of whom are in school. She sells typical clothing and also sews aprons. She started off with her family's betterment in mind, and at this point she has eight years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband, who makes pants and aprons.

She has organized a group [named "Lucero de la Mañana" or "Morning Star" Group] with the goal of requesting a loan to increase her working capital. At this time, she would like to buy typical fabrics in order to continue producing more aprons to sell. The rest of the group members are engaged in various economic activities: clothing sales, food sales, a general store, sewing aprons and pants, sewing blouses, and animal husbandry.

In the future, Federica thinks that her business will be large and will include different products.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing aprons

loans.name: Madiwna

texts.fr: Epouse d’un cuisinier, Madiwna est revendeuse ambulante de mèches et pagnes. Depuis 2004. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé .Elle veut assurer son avenir à son enfant et avoir sa propre boutique pour étaler ses marchandises et faire du commerce IMPORT- EXPORT.
texts.en: Madiwna is the wife of a chef and she sells hair extensions and "pagnes" (pieces of colourful West African fabric) on a door-to-door basis. She gets her supplies at the market in Lomé. She wants to provide for her child's future and have her own shop in order to display her goods as well as doing import and export trading.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and "pagnes" (pieces of colourful West African fabric)

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is married and a mother of two school-age dependents. She is 35 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Amalia is a farmer. She grows pineapples to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year she earns PHP 48,000 in this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay labor cost for soil plowing and to purchase fertilizers. Amalia has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Amalia hopes to gain more profit and expand her pineapple farming.

loans.use: To pay the labor cost for plowing and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Parsokote

texts.en:
Parsokote is 33 years old. He is married and has three children who are attending school. For the past three years, Parsokote has been a farmer. His farm produces wheat and maize that he sells through middlemen. 

Parsokote is requesting his first loan through KADET to cultivate maize. He will use the extra income from his loan to help pay school fees for his children and improve his family’s standard of living. Parsokote’s major business challenges have been unpredictable weather conditions and the pests and diseases that affect his production. 

In the future, Parsokote plans to acquire more acres of land to expand his farm.

loans.use: to grow corn

loans.name: Jenny Ines

texts.es:
Ines tiene 32 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus dos menores hijos . Ines es una madre trabajadora y sacrificada, con deseos de superación. Ella vive en una comunidad urbana en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Chiclayo.

Ines se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina, de manera ambulatoria, desde hace 8 años .  Todos los domingos Ines va al exterior de un mercado popular , ubicado a media hora de su casa, donde realiza la mayor parte de sus ventas y ha podido ganar clientela fija que le compra al contado.

Ines solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en su negocio. Ella desea aprovechar el cambio de estación y las fiestas patrias para aumentar sus ventas, con la renovación de prendas. Este crédito le sería de gran utilidad.

Ines es una clienta fidelizada de nuestra entidad y cuenta con un excelente historial crediticio, siempre ha cancelado puntualmente sus pagos.
texts.en:
Inés, 32, lives in her own house with her two minor children.  Inés is a hard working, selfless mother with a strong desire to get ahead.  She lives in an urban, developing community belonging to Chiclayo District.

Inés has been a street vendor of women’s clothing for the last 8 years.  Every Sunday she heads out to the outside of a popular market located half an hour from her house where most of her sales take place.  She’s managed to win over a base of regular customers that pay her cash.

Inés is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to invest in her business. She wants to take advantage of the change in season and of the national holidays to increase sales and to renew her stock merchandise.  This loan will be of great use to her.

Inés is one of this institution’s most faithful clients and she has an excellent credit history; she’s always repaid her loans punctually.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 28 years old, single and supports his parents. He has been practicing farming for seven years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer and hire temporary field workers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 41 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arnaldo, con quien convive desde hace 11 años, cuidando a 4 de sus 5 hijos en la comunidad nativa de Alianza (selva central peruana). Los días de Teresa se centran en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años y esfuerzo a logrado comprarse sus propios terrenos de cultivo y ahora es una de las principales productoras de plátano, café, palta, maíz y achiote de la provincia de Chanchamayo, lugar hasta donde llegan sus compradores para obtener sus cultivos, pues son muy buenos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar con peón en diferentes terrenos de cultivo, pues necesita adquirir dinero para poder mejorar sus cultivos. Ahora con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción, sabe que lo logrará, pues es una mujer trabajadora y hábil. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde está segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que los integrantes de su banco comunal le enseñaron a ser responsable. Teresa de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos, además de 2 mil plantitas de café.
texts.en:
Teresa is 41 years old.  She is a simple, hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Arnaldo with whom she has been living for the last 11  years.  They are still caring for 4 of their 5 children in the indigenous community of Alianza (central Peruvian jungle).  Teresa's days are focused on cultivating her land.    She was able to buy this land with years of hard work and now she is one of the main producers of bananas, coffee, avocado, corn, and achiote [annatto] in the province of Chanchamayo.  Buyers come to her to buy because her crops are very good.   What she likes most about her job is caring for her plants which she does with great affection.  She has been doing this for 21 years and she considers the most difficult thing about her job  to be working with laborers in different fields with different crops.  For this reason she needs money so she can improve her crops.  Now, over time, she wants to buy new land so she can increase her production.  She knows that she will be able to achieve this as she is a hard-working, capable woman.  

She belongs to the communal bank "Alianza al progreso" and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is certain that she will be able to make all of her payments on time since the members of her communal bank have taught her to be responsible.  Upon receiving her support Teresa will buy natural fertilizers to spread on her crops as well as 2 thousand coffee seedlings.

loans.use: purchase natural fertilizers and 2 thousand coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 57-year-old business woman. She is married with six children. For the last 19 years she has been farming to make a living. She has been able to retain her business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer, manure, and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, manure, and pesticide.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
La formación de comité Kuña Guapa lo inicio la Señora Aida. Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el primer ciclo con 9 integrantes. Son mujeres muy activas con el compromiso que a través del esfuerzo laboral logran el sostenimiento de la familia y generar sus propios ingresos.
La Señora Rosa se dedica como comerciante, es decir a la venta de todo tipo de artículos, como ser ropas, artículos de cotillón y demás. Comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, brindándoles lo esencial para tener una vida digna y decorosa. Desea poder seguir con su emprendimiento, y es por eso que solicita el préstamo.
Pide el crédito para la compra de ropas, artículos de cotillón, bazar y demás para abastecer su negocio y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece desde ya a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Señora Aida is the person who founded the Kuña Guapa committee.  Currently the committee is in its first lending cycle, with nine members.  They are very active women with the commitment to sustain their families and generate their own incomes through their hard work.

Señora Rosa works as a retailer, that is to say she sells all different kinds of things such as clothes, party favors, and other things.  She comments that thanks to her efforts, she has been able to move her family ahead in life, providing them with a decent and dignified life. She wants to be able to continue with her venture, as this is why she is requesting the loan.

She is asking for the loan for the purchase of clothing, party favors, variety items and other things to stock up her store and so be able to meet her customers' demands.

She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that is being provided to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing, party favors, variety items, and other things.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 48 years old and married with three children, ages 17 to 31. Zainab runs a drinks and provision shop in Goderich, Sierra Leone. She has been in this business for 7 years and sells cold drinks, mayonnaise, milk and sugar. She also earns income from renting a room in her house and running a second shop in Lumley. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation, as the location of her store is far from her house. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cold drinks, chocolate drinks, sugar, milk, and batteries. Zainab says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s welfare. In the future, she would like to open more branches in different locations.

loans.use: to purchase more cold drinks, batteries, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Irma Rosa

texts.es: Doña Irma de 52 años, es casada, viajando diario a su trabajo de promotora.  Irma tiene 4 hijos, las  dos hijas mayores en la actualidad laboran como docentes de Educación Primaria, solamente tiene a cargo a los pequeños, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que asume los gastos del hogar. Esta solitando su 5to crédito el que invertirá en compra de materiales para mejoras de su vivienda, pues quiere acondicionarla ya que es la herencia que le dejara a sus hijos cuando ella les falte. En su comunidad es conocida por ser muy responsable  y trabajadora.Su mayor sueño  es dejar a sus hijos una casa con buenas condiciones de infraestructura.
texts.en:
Irma, 52, is married and travels daily to work as a promoter.  Irma has four children.  Her two older daughters work as elementary school teachers.  Only the youngest two are still in her care.  Her husband helps her out taking care of household expenses.

She’s asking for her fifth loan to buy building materials to do some home improvements because she wants to fix it up since it’s the only inheritance she has to leave her children when she’s no longer here.  She is well known in her community for being very responsible and hardworking.  Her greatest wish is to leave a well-built house to her children.

loans.use: to do home improvements.

loans.name: 06.07.08 Đông Vệ Tp Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Điệp operates a food stall selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to process and sell. She is 29 years old and married with 2 children. Điệp is the group leader of the 08 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Điệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Điệp hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motobike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to process andsell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet spends most of her time managing her small store in front of her house. She has been patiently involved in this business for almost two years. She sells sugar, coffee, milk, biscuits, shampoo, eggs and other basic kitchen ingredients. Juliet earns PHP 3,000 monthly. 

She is now 51 years old and has two children attending tertiary education. 

Juliet needs to buy more groceries to increase her sales capacity but she has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, sardines, and detergents to sell in her store.  

In the future, Juliet wants to keep growing as an entrepreneur and continuously provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, sardines, and detergents to sell in her store.

loans.name: Toloso S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Toloso S.H.G Group in Western Kenya! Ceciliah is the facilitator of Toloso S.H.G group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ceciliah takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ceciliah had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Ceciliah was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ceceliah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Ceciliah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Toloso S.H.G group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is a 41-year-old farmer in a rural area of Thmor Koul district, where the typical business is rice farming. She has two children and her oldest daughter works at the rice field while her youngest son is still in school. She has been farming on her farmland for almost 20 years to make a living. She now earns $5 per day to feed her family, and she has less than $1.50 for her savings.

Srey leads a group of two female members. She and her group member have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely repaid the last loan with VisionFund. After her first loan, she can afford enough food for her family and send her son to school. She is now requesting another loan. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use some to renovate her house.

With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield and sell for a good price so as to set aside some savings for future needs and keep her son in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Tiomai

texts.en:
Tiomai is 37 years old and married with six children.

Tiomai owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has many years of experience in this business.    Tiomai needs a loan of WST 2,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Tiomai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tiomai's fourth loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Devota

texts.en: Devota is 47 years old and widowed with 2 children aged 17 and 29 years old. One of her children goes to school. She has been running a business of selling foodstuffs for 7 years. With the loans she will buy more rice, beans, cooking oil, and peanuts. She plans to use the profits from her business for savings. She would like to see her business expand.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, 27 yaers old and single, operates a service transporting people. In business for five years, he works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. everyday. Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase spare motorcycle parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) to help him in the business. With the profits, he will be able to save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (tire, mirror, and engine) for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, polos, blusas y casacas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, polos, blusas y chompas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The borrower is 34 years old and belongs to the “San Valentín” communal bank which is located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.  She is single.  She alternates her daily chores with a clothing sales business; she sells pants, polo-type shirts, blouses and jackets in an itinerant manner from 8am until 6pm.  She wants to get ahead by means of this business.  Her dream is to expand the clothing sales business.  She is asking for the loan to buy pants, polo-type shirts, blouses and jackets at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Assurance Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ASSURANCE est composé de huit personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mariame (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 53 ans. Mariame n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Mariame Claudine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Djawara. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Mariame et son mari. Pour cette raison, Mariame vend des cartes de recharge téléphoniques et de l'eau à son domicile de puis trente ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Mariame s’approvisionne chez les grossistes de sa région.
