Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mariame sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe ASSURANCE, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des cartes de recharges téléphoniques.

loans.name: Phanice's Group

texts.en:
Phanice is a 37-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Phanice has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Phanice described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Phanice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan started her business in 1986 by selling cosmetics in Nairobi Gikomba Market. She is 34years old, married with 4 children. She is a member of Wamama Development a church founded group which mobilizes Women to startup economic activities. She has a good clientele base that gives her courage to keep moving forward. Her customers include Salons, Small retail shops and to a small extent Individuals. Her monthly gross sales rage from USD735-880. Her target is to increase her sales to at least USD 1000 per month and this can only be done if she gets extra funding.

loans.use: Susan wants to buy cosmetics in large quantities to enjoy economies of scale and have a constant supply to her clients.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida sells general goods. She has participated in three TEACH programs of the Kraban Support Foundation over the last five years. She now keeps simple records of her business. She needs a loan amount of $900 from Kiva. She has promised to pay promptly as she has done in previous years.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima is a Displaced Person from the Armenian occupied Fizuli region of Azerbaijan. Now she lives in the town of Beylagan with her family. When they were relocated to Beylagan she decided to contribute to the family income. She rented a place in Beylagan market in 2000 and started to sell textile goods and curtains. Having little funds of her own, in 2004 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $300 to buy new textile goods for her shop to develop the business. Later she borrowed two more loans. Now she needs another loan to buy a good counter table.

loans.use: To buy a new counter table

loans.name: Verónica Guadalupe

texts.es:
Verónica is a single mother and has a 7 year old daughter and a 10 year old son. She does not receive financial help from anyone for her children’s education and needs and she has therefore had to work very hard. Although she works in a cafeteria in a school she also started to help a friend sell cosmetics to earn some more money. As she found a lot of clients she decided to sell by herself three years ago and fortunately her business has gone very well.

In order for her business to grow she needs a loan of $200 with which she will buy more merchandise to increase the variety of her products and to give the customers what they want. She will pay back the loan over a period of 3 months. She really needs your help to improve her children’s quality of life and you can be a part of that. Don’t think twice. They all thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica es madre soltera de una pequeña de 7 años y un niño de 10 años de edad. No cuenta con el apoyo de nadie para el sostén y educación de sus hijos, por lo que ha trabajado mucho, aunque tiene un empleo atendiendo un snack en una escuela, para obtener un ingreso extra Verónica empezó a ayudarle a una amiga con las ventas de cosméticos y calzado, al haber conseguido muchos clientes decidió vender por su cuenta desde hace tres años, afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien con su negocio.

Para poder hacer creer su negocio requiere de un crédito de $ 200 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de sus productos y cubrir a demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar este préstamo en 3 meses. Ella necesita mucho de tu ayuda, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, tú puedes ser parte importante en sus logros, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón F. is 37 years old, and he is married to Liz Balbina, who is 23. They are the parents of a little boy three years old who is their happiness. They live in their own home at a company called Ycua Ti-i, located 5 km from the city of Santaní. It is a 20-hectare property of very good pasture.

Ramón works in agriculture, especially cattle ranching. He has 12 Dutch cows who produce 120 liters of milk daily, which are sold in the mornings at the markets in the city center. He also works buying and selling cattle. He started in this line of work over ten years ago and has given work to many young men in the area.

Because the work of raising and selling cattle generates good earnings, Ramón wishes to increase the quantity of animals. For this he is requesting a loan of $1000, which they will invest in the purchase of bull calves for fattening and later sale.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ramón F. tiene 37 años, está casado con la señora Liz Balbina que tiene 23 años, ellos son padres de un pequeño niño de tres años que es la alegría de ambos. Ellos viven en una casa propia en una compañía llamada Ycua Tu-i ubicado a 5 km de la ciudad de Santaní. Es una propiedad de 20 hectáreas con muy buena pastura.

Ramón se dedica a la agricultura y especialmente a la ganadería, tiene 12 vacas holandesas que producen 120 litros de leche diariamente que son vendidas en su totalidad por las mañanas en los comercios del centro de la ciudad. También se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno. Comenzó a trabajar en este rubro hace más de diez años y ha dado trabajo a muchos jóvenes de la zona.

Como el rubro de cría y venta de animales vacunos genera una buena ganancia, Ramón desea aumentar la cantidad de animales; para ello solicita un crédito de $ 1000 que los invertirá en la compra de terneros para el engorde y posterior venta de los mismos.

loans.use: to buy bull calves

loans.name: Carlos Wilder

texts.es:
Carlos, 35, works daily in a small eatery that he set up in his mother's home. Everyday, he passes many happy moments with his adoring mother. He has worked to support his family's needs and provide for his young daughter's medical costs, for she suffered a terrible illness a little while ago. Now, she is fully recovered. In spite of struggling against difficult circumstances at home, he does not let hardships prevent him from continuing his work. Instead, he keeps on going, so he can eventually buy his own home and provide a decent education for his daughters, who are his inspiration for life. Without a doubt, his aspirations are possible with your help. Carlos' ray of hope is to enlarge his business. His wish is at your disposal, for he seeks a loan of $200 to buy more merchandise and invest in enlarging the space of his small modest eatery. Let us grant his wish so he can realize his hope as quickly as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos es un hombre de 35 años y día a día trabaja en la pequeña fuente de soda que acondicionó en casa de su adorada madre, con la que comparte a diario momentos de mucha felicidad. Su desempeño en este espacio de ventas le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su familia y también a aliviar el dolor de su pequeña niña que hace poco sufrió una terrible enfermedad y de la cual ahora viene recuperándose satisfactoriamente. A pesar de lidiar con muchas circunstancias difíciles en su hogar, no deja de mantener ese ímpetu de seguir trabajando y luchar para que dentro de poco pueda ofrecer a su familia una casa propia y una educación adecuada a sus reinas quienes se han convertido en su adoración y motor de su vida. Sin duda estos sueños pueden ser factibles con tu ayuda y ese rayito de esperanza que posee Carlos para acrecentar su negocio. Sus anhelos están depositados en usted y pide le ayude con la suma de 200 dólares para poder comprar más artículos e invertir en la implementación de los espacios y en las cosas que le hacen falta en su pequeña y humilde fuente de soda. Hagamos posible que este anhelo se haga realidad en corto tiempo.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and to enlarge his business for more space and comfort

loans.name: Milagritos

texts.es:
The inventiveness of Milagritos doesn't have any limits. She is always searching for the way to take care of her family's expenses. This energy let her start her own business five years ago, and she was always encouraged by her mother to learn the advantages and responsibilities of administering a business. Thanks to her effort, Milagritos and her small grocery store have been growing, and she keeps pushing forward because she wants to make it bigger and improve the store, with the objective of bettering the quality of life in her home. Because of these big dreams, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to improve her small grocery store. Let's show our support for this woman with unlimited strength so she can grow and make a good future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El ingenio de Milagritos no tiene limites, con su ayuda siempre está buscando la manera de solventar los gastos de su familia. Ese ímpetu la ha llevado a inaugurar su propio negocio hace cinco años ya que siempre fue animada por su mamá a aprender las ventajas y responsabilidades de la administración de un negocio. Gracias a su esfuerzo, Milagritos y su pequeña bodega han ido creciendo y sigue adelante porque quiere convertirla en la más grande y mejor implementada de su localidad, todo este esfuerzo lo hace por el bien y superación de sus dos hijos que la animan a seguir adelante con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar.Por estos enormes deseos solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mercadería a fin de implementar su pequeña bodega. Solidaricémonos con una mujer de ilimitada fortaleza para crecer y forjar un buen futuro para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger variety and quantity of essential items to improve her small grocery store

loans.name: Fakhraddin

texts.en: Fakhraddin N. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children. Fakhraddin has been driving a taxi for a few years. He needs a loan in the amount of $700 in order to purchase new tires for this taxi, as well as some minor repairs for his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Castro Francisco

texts.pt:
Castro Francisco C., ID number 110042523N, is single and just joined the credit program. He is requesting a loan of 7000MT to be repaid in 6 months. Castro will invest the funds on the construction of his house. He is a teacher

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Castro Francisco C., portador do BI nº 110042523N, solteiro esta a entrar no programa vai levar o valor de 7000 a pagar em 6 meses o valor e para investir na construção é trabalhador , é professor.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Nor Agha

texts.en: Nor Agha lives with his family in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has a small gas and fuel shop. He started this business last year. It is still doing well, and he wants to enlarge has shop, so he has requested an individual loan to buy more fuel and gas for his shop. He hopes to attract good numbers of clients and make good income to help his family. He is happy about the AFSG small group loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more fuel and gas

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia Q. is a hairdresser. She is a divorcee with one child. Her customers are increasing but she lacks enough funds to buy more creams and other items she needs to keep the business running smoothly.

She is asking for $325 as an additional capital to buy more creams, artificial hair, TCP, and other items for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more creams, artificial hair, TCP, and other items for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. sells used clothing. She is married and has three children. Business is doing well and she wants to increase sales.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the stock of his dressmaking materials and his shop.

loans.name: Paddy Paddy Ll Group

texts.en: Rugiatu K. is the group leader of the Paddy Paddy II group. She sells dried fish in the market of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. Rugiatu is 40 years old and married with three children, and she has been running her business for eight years. With her previous small loans from SMT she increased her stock and income, and thus built some capital. She is happy that she can take care of her family with the income from her business. Ibrahim S. and Rosaline K. also sell dried fish. The group is requesting a loan of $600 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase their stock of fish and generate more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing and silver jewely for a small business.

loans.name: Aybeniz

texts.en: Aybeniz Q. is 50 years old and has run her store in her home town, Imishli, since 1997. She is married and has 2 children. This shop is her only source of income. She applied for 1200 USD to expand her business. This is Aybeniz’s second loan from AqroInvest (Kiva’s Field Partner). She used the first loan to purchase goods, and she repaid it successfully.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Djémilath

texts.fr: Dame SAÏBOU Djémilath est née le 31/03/1956 à Cotonou. Elle abandonna volontairement les classes au cours élémentaire première année pour aider sa maman à vendre car elle a trouvé sa vocation dans le commerce. Puis, elle fit l'apprentissage en layette. Finalement, elle a préféré le commerce. Elle a commencé par vendre alors les foulards, tissus, pagnes et aussi la layette. Mais, il y a 16 ans, elle changea d'activité et se mit à vendre les petites pièces de rechange pour moto ainsi que d'huile moteur. Pour renforcer la vente d'huile moteur et aussi vendre  des cadenas, elle a sollicité ce troisième crédit. Dame SAÏBOU Djémilath est mariée à CHANOU Ahmed, un revendeur de disque audio. Elle a 6 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djémilath S. was born on March 31, 1956 in Cotonou. She freely left off her schooling after her early primary years to help her mother with sales because she had found her vocation in commerce. Then, she undertook an apprenticeship in making babywear. In the end, she found that she preferred selling.

She began by selling scarves, cloth, "pagnes" (lengths of colorful traditional African prints) and also babywear. However, 16 years ago, she changed businesses and began selling small spare parts for motorcycles as well as motor oil. To bolster her business selling motor oil and also to be able to sell padlocks, she is requesting this third loan. Mrs. Djémilath S. is married to Ahmed Chanou, who sells audio disks. She has 6 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 50 liters of motor oil, a case of brake oil, and 30 padlocks

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery, mujer muy activa, tiene 22 años de edad, convive con su pareja y padre de su hijo  de 3 años, que es la razón de su esfuerzo.  Se dedica a su casa en horas de la mañana, pero a eso de las 10 tiene que ir a pastar sus toros, que le sirven para el arado, o de lo contrario apoya en la chacra a su esposo;  ella proviene de una familia campesina, es por ello que siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura.  Lo que más le agrada es de criar sus animales como vacas y toros, porque le son de gran utilidad para la siembra y así mismo, cuando los vende cuestas una suma considerable.  Lo que le dificulta es que el abono se ha disparado en los precios, años atrás no costaba mucho y podía sembrar sin dificultad. Ahora cuesta 215 soles el saco y antes 85, la diferencia es grande. Por ello que a veces ya no quiere sembrar, pero si no siembra, no tiene de qué vivir.  El motivo de su esfuerzo es para ir adquiriendo implementos para su hogar y posteriormente adquieran su casa propia.  El dinero que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la siembra de papa y arvejas, y si le alcanza, también cebada en la chacra de sus padres. Si cosecha para enero y febrero el  precio estará muy bien, es por ello que quiere invertir en la comprar de semillas y para el fumigado contra los insectos.
texts.en:
Rosmery, a very active woman, is 22 years old, lives with her partner and the father of her three-year-old son, who is reason for her effort. In the morning, she is at home, but at 10:00 she has to graze her bulls, which serve to plow the land, or to help her husband on the farm. She comes from a farming family. Because of this, she has always worked on agriculture. What she likes most is to raise animals, like cows and bulls, because they are very useful for sowing and when she sells her products, they carry a considerable amount of weight. It is difficult that the price of fertilizer has increased. In earlier years, it didn’t cost very much and she could sow without difficulty. Now, it costs 215 soles per sack, while it was 85 soles before; it is large difference. Because of this, sometimes she doesn’t want to sow, but if she doesn’t sow, she won’t have the means to live. The goal of her effort is to continue acquiring tools for her home and later, to have her own house. The money that she is requesting will be invested in sowing of potatoes and peas, and if she is able to, she will also sow barley on her parents’ farm. If she harvests from January and February, the price will be very good. Because of this, she wants to invest in the purchase of seeds and to spray against the insects.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in sowing her land, spraying, and buying more seeds

loans.name: Doris Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del g/s  DORIS viven en el barrio magdalena uno de los barrios mas populosos de la ciudad de Masaya tuvieron la oportunidad de aprobar la primaria lo que les permite ser unas  personas bien comunicativas y accesibles en la sociedad. Iniciaron sus negocios ambulantes, comprando cosechas y vendiendo en el mercado, actualmente comparten un tramo para almacenar sus productos y que el costo del alquiler salga mas barato.
 Doris pertenece al g/s DORIS y  siente que el aprendizaje mas importante que ha obtenido al trabajar con ADIM ha sido reconocer cuanto vale ella como mujer honrada y trabajadora. Hace 1 años obtuvo su primer crédito con ADIM por un monto mucho menor que el que tiene ahora.  Hoy es una vendedora de frutas por mayor con lo que obtiene más ganancias y sufre menos pérdidas.
Sus créditos lo utilizan en la compra de frutas por cosecha para obtener precios más bajos y poder aumentar sus ganancias.
El g/s esta motivo a trabajar con adim, esperan en un futuro obtener créditos de vivienda para mejorar y ampliar su casa. También espera poder participar en las capacitaciones de desarrollo empresarial. Quiere además seguir siendo cumplida en sus pagos como hasta ahora lo ha sido.
texts.en:
The members of the group named Doris live in the region of Magdalena, one of the most populous regions of the city of Masay. They had the opportunity to finish primary school which grants them the ability to be individuals who are communicative and successful members of society. They started their door-to-door business, purchasing harvests and reselling them in the markets. Currently they share a stand to display their products and so that their rental costs would be cheaper.

Doris belongs to the group Doris and she says that her greatest learing experience while working with Adim has been that she now recognizes how valuable she is as an honest and hard working woman. It has been one year since her first loan with Adim, a loan that is substantially smaller than the one she has now. Currently she is sells fruits wholesale, generating a greater income and permitting fewer losses.

The loan is used to purchase harvests of fruit at better prices augmenting the earnings. The group is motivated to continue working with Adim and hope to obtain future home improvement loans to improve and expand their homes. They also hope to be able to contribute towards the growth of their business. They want to keep up with their regular scheduled repayments as they have been up to date.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: Purchase of harvests to cover client demands.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of goods to sell

loans.name: Seidu

texts.en: Seidu M., 45, is the father of two children who are currently in school. He is a trader who has sold lace and cloth for the past 15 years. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations and most men use the cloth to sew trousers.  For lack of adequate working capital, Seidu buys small stocks of lace materials and cloth and then sells them in the marketplace of Babiani. He believes the loan will enable him to increase his business. With the loan, he wants to purchase lace materials and cloth in bulk. He hopes to use part of his profit to provide his children with a quality education. Seidu belongs to the community called Adehye Trust group. He is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase lace and cloth in bulk

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica B. is a 35 year old local restaurant operator. She is widowed and has three kids who attend school in the community. Monica lives at Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region. And she has been there since she started her local restaurant. Monica's husband died painfully after a short illness. And now the burden of the family rest on her shoulders.

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared by pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. She cooks only on Thursdays because that is their market day where people come to trade. With her tasty meals she has attracted a lot of customers in the area where she serves. Therefore it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her with the food delivering service. She also sells raw food stuff like plantain at the market.

Monica says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance. Monica belongs to a village bank called Fear Not. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to increase her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more and support her kids in school, as single parent.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Yeom

texts.en: Yeom S. was born in 1974 and lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are students in the primary school. Yeom's husband drives a motorbike taxi. Since 2000, Yeom S. has been selling fish in the local Toulkok Market, and she currently earns an average of $6 each day. Beside this business, she rents rooms to garment workers. Renting rooms is a profitable investment for the family. She is requesting a loan of $500 to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi D. est propriétaire d’un bar à Atakpamé, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de la capitale togolaise. Agée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle désire avec ce crédit améliorer le cadre de son bar et approvisionner sa boutique pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi D. is the owner of a bar in Atakpamé, a city located about 150 km from the capital of Togo. She is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three. With this loan, she would like to enhance her bar and to supply her shop, so as to respond to the demands of her customers. This opportunity will enable her to do better in meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up her bar and to stock her shop

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a single mother with two children. She hails from Marapong, Sibutad, ZDN.  Judith is involved in baking cakes and pastries. She's been in this business since she was still single. She raises her children using the income from her baking business. In addition to baking, she is also selling ready-to-wear items.

Currently she is asking for her third loan, amounting to $150, for the purchase of additional baking materials, such as flour, baking soda, yeast and shortening. Judith is hoping that her business will grow big and hopes that she can retire someday with enough savings. She is thankful to Kiva and PMPC for this credit opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients

loans.name: Assanatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Assanatou    D.  est âgée de 42 ans,  mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygamique avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants au quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle a très vite abandonné l’école pour mener le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait de l’arachide. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière elle a pu maîtriser le commerce et finit par évoluer seule. Elle commença  par la vente de produits de beauté mais décida finalement de s’installer dans la fabrication et vente de savon local. Cette activité elle la pratique depuis 3 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et réputation qui dépasse le cadre de son quartier de résidence.
Pour faire du savon, elle a besoin de 10 kg de soude caustique + 5 kg de sel iodé, ensuite  elle mélange ses éléments à l’aide d’une grande louche pendant une heure jusqu'à avoir la pâte savonneuse, qui une fois refroidit et asséchée (pendant des heures) sera mis en boule pour être vendu.
Dans l’intention de pérenniser son activité  elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 42 mois. Après 5 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel pour un montant de 400 000 FCFA.
 Elle compte l’utiliser pour avoir une barrique vide, 2 baignoires et 40 kg de soude caustique. Elle s’approvisionne sur place en matières premières et effectue ses ventes  au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de prendre certaines charges familiales surtout les dépenses des enfants. 
Son ambition de vendre des chaussures parallèlement à son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Assanatou D., age 42, is married and the mother of seven. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wives, and their children in the Darsalam district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). She very quickly dropped out of school to work in commerce with her mother, who used to sell peanuts. After several years at her mother’s side, she was able to master commerce and eventually advance on her own. She started by selling beauty products but decided in the end to get situated in the making and selling of local soaps. This has been her work for three years, and she enjoys a large customer base and a reputation surpassing the confines of her district where she lives.

To make soap, she needs 10 kg of caustic soda plus 5 kg of iodized salt. Then she mixes the elements with the aid of a large ladle for an hour until a soapy paste is obtained. Once it is cooled and dried (over a few hours), it is formed into balls to be sold.

Wanting to perpetuate her business, she has turned towards Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 42 months. After five solidarity loans and one individual loan, she is now on her second individual loan in the amount of 400,000 francs CFA. She intends to use it to obtain an empty barrel, two bath tubs, and 40 kg of caustic soda. Supplies of raw materials are gotten locally, and sales are made at the retail level to customers composed primarily of women, cash or credit accepted.

She intends to realize a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will enable her to cover certain family expenses, especially those of the children. Her ambition is to sell shoes concurrently.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making local soaps

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane is married to Dominador from Aguinaldo Cordon, Isabela. The couple is thankful because they are blessed with two children. Mey-Ann is 6 years old and Shikinah is 2 years old.

She is hoping for a loan for PHP 4,000 for the improvement of her hog raising business. She hopes that through the assistance of lenders, she will be able to develop her small business. She also wants to venture into another business to have an alternative source of income. Since her children are still young, Baby Jane and her husband are starting to save something for their education and hope that they will attend through college.

loans.use: To improve her hog raising business.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth has been running her tailoring business in the Sakina neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to the Juhud group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Every day, she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy a sewing machine for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Magreth is 31 years old and married, and she has an 11-year-old child. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
V. Lê Thị generates revenue primarily from raising cattle for sale. She is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three adult children. V. has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2003, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. She is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

No. 1410030299.

loans.use: Livestock business investment

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia se dedica a la atención de su restaurant, que está ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi, es un restaurant muy conocido por la zona, ella vive en un pequeño departamento con su esposo y su pequeña hijita, su esposo también le ayuda en la atención, y él también tiene su salon de billar que atiende por las tardes, ambos son personas muy trabajadoras y  se apoyan mutuamente ya que es un matrimonio relativamente joven. El crédito será invertido en la cancelación de un saldo en la compra de una movilidad.Son clientes muy puntuales y responsables.
texts.en:
Ms. Virginia C. runs a restaurant that is located in the Pampahasi zone. It is a very well-known restaurant in the area. She lives in a small apartment with her husband and young daughter. Her husband helps her out with the restaurant, but he also runs his own billiards hall in the evening. They are both very hardworking people who mutually support each other because they are a young couple. The loan will be invested in paying off the remainder of a balance for a vehicle they purchased. They are very punctual and responsible clients

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish paying for a vehicle

loans.name: Pheta

texts.en:
Pheta is now 45 years old and living in Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband is Herald and they are gifted with two children: Rodelyn and Narlyn. The eldest is now in third year college while the youngest is now in fourth year high school. Pheta and her husband are doing their best to overcome the difficulties of life and send their children to school.

Pheta and her husband manage a welding and repair shop. Aside from this, they are also engaged in farming. She is now requesting PHP 10,000 from Kiva for the maintenance of their business. She also dreams of developing their welding and repair shop into a success so that they will further sustain their family’s daily living.

loans.use: To use as business capital

location.town: Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya`

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 25 years old and livies a simple life with her family in Barangay Parabba, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She and her husband are blessed with three children, Rizalyn Joy, 7 years old and in grade III; Rose Caryl, 3 years old; and Rizamae, 1 year old. 

Josie is a hardworking mother who manages a junk shop. This is her way of helping her husband to provide for the financial needs of their family and save for the education of their three children.  She collects and buys scrap materials like old newspapers, used/empty bottles, boxes, plastic, etc., and generates income by selling them in junk shops. She is happy that her chosen business provides her family with a daily income at low capital investment and implements solid waste management in their town and nearby villages. 

To further sustain the business, Josie is asking for the support of Kiva lenders to keep her business growing and help her community and the environment. She hopes to borrow PHP 10,000 for additional business capital.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
66-year-old Estelita and her husband were left alone in their house after their children had their own family and lives away from their village. Aside from having an access to business capital through loan, Estelita joined ASHI in 2008 to be able to be with other women in their village and to make herself more friends. Loan she requested then was used as an additional capital to her variety store which was put up in 2007. Out of her profit from the store, she was able to buy piglet for her hog fattening (pig raising) business which profits twice as much as the capital after four months. Estelita has able to repaid her first loan. Now, she is applying for a much bigger loan intended for growing her variety store and buying another piglet for hog fattening business.
When Estelita's business would grow big the same as its profit, she would ask her children to come home and live with them and help her run their business because she wants her children living with her.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her variety store business and small portion of her loan will be used as an additional capital for her hog fattening (pig raising) business.

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
O. is the mother of two children. She attended school until the death of her father, who was the bread winner in the family, made her stop her education. With the frustration in her life, she became pregnant and was rejected from her family. She has been a very hard-working woman. With no husband, she was unable to cater for the children and had to relinquish her children to the care of her parents.

With her hard working spirit, she was introduced to GHAPE by one of her friends. She is gifted in planting and her very first loan was used to buy mesh for planting and seedlings for farming. She wants to use this loan to continue planting, and to buy seedlings and feed. With the profit from the loan, she plans to educate her children, buy a plot of land, and provide basics needs for the family.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings, piglets, poultry, feed, medication and mesh

loans.name: Teoipsta

texts.en: Teopista is a 59 year married with five children aged between 8 and 25 years. Three of her children go to school. Teopista resides and owns a four roomed house where she staying with eight people. There is electricity and piped water at home.  Teopista takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 20 customers a day. Teopista sells charcoal.  She doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping..  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, thieves, feeding the family and increasing prices of clothes. Besides this charcoal business she also sells bananas. Teopista has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for six years servicing her tenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this twelfth  loan She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal Teopista is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permant business structure.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda has been involved in the livestock business for ten years. Raising hogs is what she does to help her husband bring in income for their family. She aspires to be more productive in her business to help sustain the educational needs of her children.

For the second time, Gilda would like to ask for a PHP 20,000 loan from Kiva lenders to have additional capital for purchasing piglets and a sufficient supply of feed. She hopes that she will again be granted her request because it will be a big help in the maintenance and development of her livestock business.

“Love is the greatest gift of God”. This is what Gilda believes in life, and the reason why she is fond of helping others, because she shares the love God has given us. She is married to Pedro V. and is blessed with three children. They are currently studying and are in different school levels. She hopes that they will all finish their studies, including college. She believes that her diligence in working and her husband’s patience in farming will help them achieve their dreams.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed

texts.es: Maria Teresa Y. tiene 51 años de edad inicio su negocio hace 15 años vendiento cosas de consumo en menor cantidad hoy en dia su tienda ha crecido y cuenta con clientes que la conocen, además tiene una venta de frutas fuera de su tienda, también se dedica a la siembra de verduras, ella dice que es una buena época para invertir y que los créditos le han ayudado para levantar su negocio asi que ella hace planes de cómo invertir mejor el dinero y poder aprovechar bien la oportunidad que se le da . ella  desea siempre seguir mejorando ya que apoya a sus hijos que son 6 y también es un apoyo para su esposo, ya que siempre esta dispuesta a trabajar duro para que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa Y. is 51 years old and started her business selling food 15 years ago. Today, her store has expanded and she has many customers who are familiar with her, in addition to having a fruit stand apart from her store, and growing vegetables. She says now is a good time to invest and that the loans she’s received so far have helped her improve her store. She has plans to better invest the money and to be able to take advantage of the opportunities with which the loans provide her. Her wish is to always strive for improvement, as she supports her 6 children and her husband. She is willing to always work hard so that her family may enjoy better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals, palm nuts, fruits, and food condiments

loans.name: G. Améline

texts.fr: G. G. Améline est née en 1979 et est mariée à KPADONOU Zachée un hôtelier. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant, mais a un enfant à charge. Il y a près de deux ans que Améline vit au quartier Atropocodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec son mari et l’enfant à sa charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Améline n’a fait que le cours primaire à l’école. C’est depuis une douzaine d’année que Améline vend des produits de toilette et de beauté, ainsi que des mèches de façon ambulante. Améline s’approvisionne à Cotonou. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé  ayant déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Afin d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Améline sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Améline souhaite satisfaire les besoins de son ménage à partir des revenus de son activité.
texts.en:
Améline G. G. was born in 1979 and is married to Zachée KPADONOU, an innkeeper. The couple does not yet have any children, but are supporting one child. For almost two years, Améline has been living with her husband and the child in their care in Atropocodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple together provides for the family’s expenses.

Améline only attended elementary school. For close to twelve years, Améline has been selling toiletries and beauty products door-to –door, as well as hair extensions. She has already received two loans from the institution; those loans have been fully repaid.

In order to increase her stock of goods and to satisfy her customers, Améline is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Améline wishes to meet her household needs with the income from her activity.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions, hair straightener products, oil and ointments for hair and other beauty products.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah C. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes at a market and is requesting a loan to stock groundnuts for making phaste to sell.  Florah is 21 years old and is single. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock groundnuts for making phaste to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: 43-year-old Alicia has been married to her husband, Vicente, for twenty-one years. She has four children with him. Her oldest child is now 20.  Alicia engaged in rice farming sixteen years ago. She went through difficulties, but she feels blessed that her farm still exists and provides income for her family. She works hard to keep the farm healthy and productive. She also joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, a micro-finance institution, to gain access to its financial services. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase the necessary farm supplies for her farm. This loan will help Alicia sustain her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi owns a greenhouse and grows different vegetables, e.g., tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes, etc. He is married with two grown children. His family lives in Kamenka. His house is located right next to a big highway which makes it a favorable location for wholesale trade. Vitalyi started his venture 26 years ago. Currently, he has about 10,000 grivnyas invested in his business. He spends over 5,000 grivnyas on seeds and clear polyethylene film every year. 

Vitalyi is seeking a 10,000 grivnya loan to construct a new arch greenhouse to grow more vegetables. Vitalyi is very hardworking. He is anticipating further growth of his venture and is willing to invest in its development. This business has good prospects in his region and Vitalyi is hoping to keep it running and growing into the future.

loans.use: To construct a new greenhouse

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 50 years of age and a single mother of five children aged between 10 and 20 years. All her children go to school. The family resides and rents a one roomed house where she stays with eight people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses includes paying utility bills, school fees for children and medication and feeding the family. 

Joyce sells milk in the Mulago market. She works seven days a week. Joyce receives an average of 40 customers a day. She has done this business for over twelve years She incurs transport costs to and from buying milk from Katwe. Her main challenge is the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.  She sells on retail basis only. 

Joyce has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her tenth loan with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of milk . She aspires to her business grow bigger and someday start selling wholesale only
.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 48-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. He has been working as a blacksmith, producing metal pistons and cold cutters for over 30 years. When he first started his business, he didn’t have difficulties because there is a high demand for his work in the region. He decided on this business because he took over his father’s business. This is the first loan he has requested from Al Majmoua, and he wants to purchase pressure piston pipes for his work. His clients are traders. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase pressure piston pipes for his work.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin is a hardworking businesswoman. She sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business, because she does not sell on credit. Thus, she does not incur debt in her business. She hopes to own a drink company in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN in order to purchase more drinks to sell. She is a friendly and happy woman. She uses her friendly nature to attract and retain more customers to her business. She is married with four children, and she is 48 years old. Her children are excelling in school and business.

Toyin has a good relationship with the Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Toyin says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Tusiimye Development Group

texts.en:
John L. is a friendly 42-year-old married man. He has nine children who are between the ages of 6 and 18, and he also cares for a few orphans. He hopes that his family will always stay in good health.

John is a mechanic in Mantabulirwa. He is successful in his business because he makes a strong effort to have good customer care. He has been in this business for ten years now.

John dreams of expanding his business to make it larger. Today he is taking his 2nd loan with Pearl for 600,000 UGX to buy a tool box, spanners (wrenches), a pair of pliers, hammers and nails.
 
John's picture appears in the top left corner and he also appears in the group photo.

loans.use: To buy a tool box, spanners, a pair of pliers, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. N. is fifty years old. She is married and has two children aged twenty-five and twenty-three years old.

Rose’s business is located at Katito in Kisumu. Kisumu is known as the Lake Region in Kenya and there is a lot of fish that comes from that area for local consumption and even export. Her business is well known by the name Rozy Hotel. Although it is called a hotel, it is a restaurant and it serves the local people.

Rose has been running this business for the last eleven years and she says that, although the business is good and profitable, there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers that her customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice.

Rose is using her loan of Kes 60,000 to buy cooking flour, cooking oil, rice, baking flour and beans to make food to sell. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more cooking flour, cooking oil, rice, baking flour and beans

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma B. is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in Prk Banaba, Brgy Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling food and herbal products.

Wilma’s 45-year-old husband, Ronnie, is a farmer. They have 10 children who are between 5 and 22 years old. Four of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. The other six children work to help the family.

Wilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of their family's life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by selling food and herbal products. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000 from her business activities.

Wilma is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 was used to fund operations of her business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her twentieth cycle loan, PHP 15,000, which she intends to use for her business of selling food and herbal products. Wilma is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her business selling food and herbal products

loans.name: Viviana Margarita

texts.es:
En el Puerto de Manta en la costa del Ecuador específicamente en la provincia de Manabí visitamos el banco comunal Umiña en un sector del mismo nombre, es ahí donde es socia la señora Viviana de 27 años está casada tiene dos niños, ella junto al esposo  tenían una vida hecha en la capital Quito donde trabajaba en un local de comida, pero una vez que se les termino el contrato de trabajo se quedaron sin hacer nada y deciden regresar a su tierra natal Manta para ver que podrían hacer y seguir trabajando.

En una seria conversación la señora Viviana con su esposo decidieron ponerse un negocio de comida, con un pequeño capital que habían ahorrado, invierte nuestra socia en  una carreta que la mandaron hacer bien elaborada para ahí empezar su propio negocio, como la señora Viviana conocía algo de cocina lo puso en práctica, pidieron permiso al municipio de la ciudad para poder trabajar en la carreta  de esta pareja de esposos y lo vienen haciendo desde hace 2 años.

Tienen que trasladar todos los días su carreta desde su casa hasta el lugar que es un parqueadero donde tiene su negocio, en esta carreta se ofrece comida tipa de la región, ella tiene 27 años y el esposo 28 el trabaja en albañeria, ella en la mañana se queda con sus hijos en casa, el negocio lo estaciona en un parqueadero de un sector bastante concurrido de la ciudad.

El crédito invertirá en comprar los alimentos y comprase una carpa para pretejerse  de la lluvia, las ventas ayudan a pagar puntualmente las cuotas del credito.
Ella nos cuenta que  empezó con 70 dólares en su negocio y ahora ya tiene que invertir cada vez mas, se arriesgaron al poner este negocio y no se arrepienten.
texts.en:
In Manabi province in Puerto de Manta (Manta Port) on the Ecuadorean coast, lies the community bank, Umiña, in an area of the same name. A member of the community bank, Viviana, 27 years old, lives here with her husband, 28 years, and two children. The couple has been married for 11 years. They had made their lives originally in the capital of Quito where they worked in a food outlet. However, once their work contract expired, they were left with nothing, and decided to return to their native town of Manta to see what work they could find. After a serious discussion with her husband, Viviana and her husband decided to set up their own food stand using their modest savings to invest in the business. Viviana’s husband bought a cart and elaborately adapted it to suit the needs of the business. Viviana put her cooking skills into practice. The couple sought permission from the council in order to station their cart in an area three houses away from where they both lived, and once permission had been granted, Viviana and her husband began working and have continued to do so for the past two years. Each day, the couple has to move their cart from their house to a car park (parking lot), where the council has granted them permission to run their business and which is three blocks away in a busy area of the city. The food cart offers typical regional fare. The loan will be used to buy food and a tent to protect them from the rain. Their strong sales will help them repay their loan installments on time. Viviana tells us that she started her business with just $70 and now she continues investing more and more. Though they took an initial risk in setting up the business, they have never regretted the decision.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions and an awning for their business.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat, a resident of the mid-sized city Vehari, Pakistan, is the wife of M. M. and the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. She owns a house of three rooms and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. 

A very hard working lady, Nusrat owns & operates a sewing-clothes business. She loves this work because this gives her a lot. She renovated her living room from the earnings and purchased dinner sets and glasses and other utensils to give shape to her house.  

Her husand is involved in a food selling business. He operates a food stand in the community where he sells specifically Dahi bhalas (lentil dumplings in yogurt). His food is famous among his customers and he earns well from it. He has been doing this work for over five years. 

Nusrat is applying for a loan from Asasah, to invest the capital in her husband’s food stand so that he can purchase the required items such as cooking oil, spices, yogurt, and potatoes and give expansion to his food stand business.

loans.use: To purchase required material for food stand.

loans.name: Top

texts.en: Top S. is a 60-year-old married woman. She has four children who no longer attend school and currently work in different jobs. She is a homemaker who stays at home to do the daily housework. Top S. relies on the income from her husband’s job. He owns a rental workshop where he operates a service cutting hair for a fee. He finds it hard commuting to his work location or to anywhere else because he doesn’t own a vehicle for his travelling needs. This is the reason that Top S. has requested a loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband's use.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.ru: Латипов Шарафчон проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает арбуз и дыню. Его бизнес является сезонным. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
L. Sharifjon lives in Dushanbe City. He's twenty-five years old, married and has no children. For more than five years he has been in the seasonal business of selling melons and watermelons. He's requesting a loan to increase his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena M.  Q., tiene 42 años y vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, acompañada por su pareja de vida el cual labora como albañil, tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian la escuela secundaria, tienen un negocio de venta de comida típica del país, y fue con su esfuerzo propio, que logró  instalar este negocio que ha sido el sustento de vida para toda su familia estos últimos 8 años.

Inicialmente vendía enchiladas, pero gracias a la buena demanda su oferta ha crecido y ahora ofrece variedad de platillos que tienen buenas aceptación entre sus clientes, a futuro espera tener los recursos económicos para la compra de mesas y sillas, y remodelar la infraestructura de su comidería a un local más amplio, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos que permitan aumentar los índices en las ventas y que traigan mejores ingresos económicos, que favorezcan a la economía del hogar en la incursión de nuevas fuentes de ingresos o proyectos para el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Elena M. Q. is 42 years and lives in the neighborhood of Laurles Norte, accompanied by her life partner who works as a mason. They have three dependent children who are high school students. Rosa has a business selling traditional Nicaraguan food and through her own efforts, she has been able to provide for her family for the past eight years.

At first she sold enchiladas, but thanks to high demand her menu has expanded and now she offers a variety of dishes that have been well-received by her customers. In the future she hopes to have the financial resources to buy tables and chairs and remodel the infrastructure of her eatery in order to make it larger. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a large inventory of products that will allow her to increase her sales and generate better earnings. She is always in favor of improving her household finances through new sources of income and business projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora L. is from the town of Banga. She is 31 years old. Leonora is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She hopes to have good health for her so she could keep up with the hard work required at maintaining their farm. She says she only wants the best for her family.

Leonora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonora from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Daisy Xioamara

texts.es:
la señora Daisy Xiomara I. tiene 37 años de edad,  es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella,  uno de sus hijos esta en los estados unidos y le ayuda economicamente.
su actividad actual es la compra y venta de productos de consumo popular y granos basicos, tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad.
 
las ventas las realiza de lunes a domingo al por mayor y al detalle, sus clientes son las personas que visitan el mercado, Daisy a tenido mucho éxito en sus ventas por su atencion a sus clientes.
 
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en la compra de granos basicos y abarroteria para surtir un poco mas su negocio.
 
su mayor sueño tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Daisy Xiomara I. is 37 years old, she is a single mother and has three children who depend on her. One of her children is in the United States and helps her financially. Her current business is buying and selling popular consumer products and basic grains, and she has been doing this for three years. She sells Monday to Sunday wholesale and retail, her customers are people who visit the market. Daisy has had a lot of success in her sales because of her attention to her customers. The loan will be used to invest in basic grains and groceries to supply her business a little more. Her greatest dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase batteries, cold drinks, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, toothpaste, toilet paper, soup, pasta, beans, rice, butter, oil, bread, cookies, confectionary, churros, juice, chilli.

loans.name: Acevedo Haroldo

texts.es: Haroldo tiene 39 años, el se dedica a la venta de Ropa, hace mas de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, el tiene 1 hijos de 10 años, el inicio como vender ambulante, con el paso del tiempo fue que logro tener su propio. Pues siempre ha luchado por mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y su familia. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza pues será para la compra de materia prima. Este es el motivo del financiamiento que es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. El sueño de este hombre es mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Haroldo, 39, has been a clothing merchant for over 21 years. He has a 10-year-old son. He started out as an itinerant merchant but in time managed to acquire his own locale. He has always striven to improve his wife and family’s quality of life. This isn’t his first loan and it will be used to acquire raw materials. He will buy pants, shirts, skirts and suits. This man’s dream is to improve his home and enlarge his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Cristhian John

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y es empleado en una imprenta, subsiste con los ingresos que obtiene. El crédito será destinado al pago de pensiones de la universidad.
texts.en:
Our client lives with his parents in the neighbourhood of Villa Copacabana in La Paz. He is unmarried and works at a printer’s. He manages to live on the wages that he earns. The loan will be used to pay for his university education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for university education

loans.name: America

texts.es:
América es una madre D. familia D. 61 años D. edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Pueblo Nuevo, una zona rural del distrito D. Buenos Aires, zona agrícola productora D. Cacao y plátanos perteneciente a la provincia D. Morropón, región Piura. Se encuentra ubicada a mas D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace cinco años a la preparación y venta D. platos D. comida en un pequeño resturante – bar instalado en su domicilio. El negocio goza D. muy buena acogida gracias a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas y al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Ella atienD. principalmente a los trabajadores que se quedan a vivir temporalmente en el lugar. Con los ingresos que percibe D. estas actividades ella apoya con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

América desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas insumos D. modo que pueda preparar más platos D. comida y D. esa manera sus ventas y sus ganancias aumenten. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.

América es una mujer responsable y bastante activa, su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio hasta contar con un local propio. Anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
America is a mother, she is 61 years old and she lives together with her family in the village of Pueblo Nuevo, a rural community near Buenos Aires. It is an agricultural region, producing cocoa and bananas, located in the province of Morropon in the Piura region. It is located more than three hours and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For the past five years she has been preparing and selling foods from her small restaurant-bar located in a section of her home. The business is well visited thanks to her good cooking and for the excellent customer service she gives her clients. Her clients are mostly the seasonal workers that come to the region. With the profits she earns she is able to support her family. America wishes to expand her business, wishing to purchase more ingredients to be able to prepare more foods to sell, and improve her profits. In order to reach her goal she accessed a loan through Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. America is a very responsible and very active woman. Her greatest dream is to keep expanding her business until she has a restaurant. Previously she has had loans from Edpyme Alternativa and she has demonstrated timeliness and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 26 years old and runs a food stall where he prepares doughnuts. For ten years, he has been running the business with two employees. He supplies the doughnuts to the nearby area. He hopes to expand his market niche in the future. He has requested a loan of 40, 000 Kenyan shilling to buy wheat flour, sugar, charcoal ,and firewood.  He sees himself opening a bakery in five years.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar, charcoal, and firewood.

loans.name: Citlali Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Citlali, está ubicado en la comunidad de Hueyapan, Tétela del Volcán, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 6 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son Reyna A. R. y va a comprar con su préstamo mercancía refrescos por caja, pepsi, dulces por bolsa y por kilo para surtir su negocio, la señora Adela B. R. va a comprar mercancía servilletas, hilos, estambres, blusas para vender su producto, la señora Altagracia Jiménez C. va a comprar flor por mayoreo nube, polares, casinos, palma, clavelin para surtir su negocio, la señora Josefina Pérez Jiménez va a comprar tela para bordar, hilos, estambres etc. Para elaborar sus servilletas, la señora Margarita T. Aragón va a comprar pollo vivo para criar y vender por kilo y entero, la señora Emelia A. F. va a comprar producto formulas, olea, te, tabletas para surtirse y vender su producto. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por ayudarnos con los préstamos ya que estamos muy contentas por echarnos la mano y así poder lograr nuestros propósitos”.  La señora Margarita T. Aragón es integrante del grupo Citlali, tiene 26 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, tiene 1 hija que se llama Litzy Paloma de 7 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar hilo, pintura cochinilla y añil se dedica a realizar artesanías, rebosos, mañanitas, gabanes, morrales, gorras, bufandas, bolsitas para celular su negocio se llama artesanías de Hueyapan es un grupo de artesanos de San Felipe ella se integro al grupo hace 2 años, aprendió porque su mama le enseño a elaborar las prendas con telar de cintura y le intereso venderlos. El primer rebosos que realizo el hilo se lo regalo su mama vendió el rebozo e incremento para comprar más hilo y vio que si funcionaba la venta, su negocio está en San Bartolo, Hueyapan en su casa y le ha ayudado económicamente para la alimentación y para los gastos de su casa, También tiene un negocio en el centro en el mercado vende pollo por pieza o entero su esposo le ayuda en la venta de pollo y también le ayuda en el negocio de las artesanías sabe hacer las artesanías. Ella considera importante  su negocio porque de ahí se mantiene y lo que más le gusta es cuando están terminadas las prendas porque están bonitos y si no se vuelven a cocer, su negocio le proporciona gran orgullo, realizar las artesanías y sobretodo que se lo enseño su mama, ella recuerda cuando vendió el primer reboso tenía una necesidad y la saco de apuros, sus clientes son los turistas que bienes de visita y los estudiantes que compran sus morrales, los desafíos que enfrenta son costos elevados en el hilo, la cochinilla y el añil, también la competencia hay más personas que realizan las artesanías, la ganancias del negocio las distribuye una parte para comer y otra para volver a invertir en comprar el material en Santa Ana, Puebla. La señora Margarita está planeando ampliar su negocio meter más producto lo mismo pero por mayoreo y sus sueños son tener más ventas, tener  una tienda bien surtida y conocida de artesanía y lo piensa lograr por medio de los crédito y echándole ganas al trabajo. Hueyapan es de clima fresco, hay muchos árboles, se dan las frutas de tierra fría, peras, manzanas, tejocotes, membrillo, capulín, la vaina o caguinicul, el pueblo está cerca del volcán, esta la Iglesia que es una de las más antiguas y los turistas vienen a visitar la Iglesia.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Citlali and it is located in the community of Hueyapan, Tétela del Volcán, in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  It has six members who know each other and are neighbors.  Reyna A. R. will use her loan to purchase boxes of soft drinks, Pepsi, and candy by the bag and by the kilo to stock her business.  Mrs Adela B. R. will use her loan to purchase napkins, thread,  yarn and blouses to sell.  Mrs Altagracia Jiménez C. will purchase flowers wholesale ('nubes', 'polares', 'casinos', 'palmas' and 'clavelins' - all types of flower) to stock her business.  Mrs Josefina Pérez Jiménez will purchase fabric to embroider, thread, wool etc.  As well as making napkins, Mrs Margarita T. Aragón will purchase live chickens to raise and sell whole and by the kilo.  Mrs Emelia A. F. will purchase oils, formulas, tea and tablets to stock and sell.  The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “thank you for helping us with the loans. We are very happy that you are giving us a hand and we are thereby able to achieve our goals”.

Mrs Margarita T. Aragón is a member of the Citlali group.  She is 26 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She has her diploma.  She has one daughter called Litzy Paloma who is 7 years old and is attending elementary school.  She is requesting her loan to purchase thread and cochineal and indigo dyes.  She makes handicrafts; 'rebosos' (a type of scarf), 'mañanitas' (a type of shawl), jackets, backpacks, caps, scarves and cell phone cases.  Her business is called “artesanías de Hueyapan” (Hueyapan handicrafts).  It is a group of craftspeople from San Felipe.  She joined the group 2 years ago.  She learned because her mother taught her to make garments with a backstrap loom and she was interested in selling them.  The first 'reboso' (scarf) which she made was with thread which her mother gave her as a present.  She sold the scarf and bought more thread and saw that the sale worked.  Her business is in her home in San Bartolo, Hueyapan and it has helped her to pay for food and cover her household expenses.  She also has a business in the city center in a market where she sells chickens in parts or whole.  Her husband helps her with the chicken sales and also helps her in her handicraft business as he knows how to make handicrafts.  She considers her business to be important because it enables her to support herself.  The aspect of her work she likes the most is when the garments are finished because they are pretty and if not she pulls them out and starts again..  Her business gives her a lot of pride as does creating handicrafts, above all because her mother showed her how.  She remembers when she sold her first scarf she was suffering hardship and it got her out of a difficult situation.  Her customers are tourists and students who buy her backpacks.  The challenges which she faces are the high cost of thread and the cochineal and indigo dyes, as well as the competition as there are other people who make handicrafts.  Some of her business profits go towards food and some is re-invested in purchasing material in Santa Ana, Puebla.

Margarita is planning to expand her business and buy more products of the same type but wholesale.  Her dreams are to have more sales and to have a well-known and well-stocked handicrafts store.  She hopes to achieve this by means of her loan and putting a lot of effort into her work.  Hueyapan has a cool climate.  There are a lot of trees which grow cold-weather fruit; pears, apples, 'tejocotes' (the fruit of the Mexican hawthorn tree), quinces, chokecherries and sweet tamarind.  The town is near Volcán.  Its church is one of the oldest and tourists come to visit it.

loans.use: Purchase of thread and cochineal and indigo dyes

loans.name: 18.04.63 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mai N. Thị is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Mai is the group leader of a eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 63-Quảng Hưng (18.04.63 Quang Hung).

Mai is single and does not have any children. To making a living, Mai owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Mai has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2100000 VND a month.

In 2010, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Mai is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 4248000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials. Mai plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Xuân is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  N. Thuỷ Chung is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  L. Thị Thương is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  N. Thị Lan is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Lê Thị Lý is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

6.  N. Thị Dung is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

7.  L. Thị Phượng is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Mai N. Thị (92) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Mai là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 63-Quảng Hưng (18.04.63Quang Hung).
