Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may mặc trang phục nữ giới cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Mai thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Mai kiếm được khoảng 2100000 VND.  Vào 2010, Mai đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Mai đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Xuân (97) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thuỷ Chung (93) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. Thị Thương (96) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. Thị Lan (95) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Lê Thị Lý (94) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


6.  N. Thị Dung (98) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


7.  L. Thị Phượng (99) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*L. ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric and materials

loans.name: Maria Barbara

texts.es: María R. tiene 26 años y se dedica a la preparación de alimentos entre los cuales vende desayunos, almuerzos meriendas y refrescos, este negocio lo inició  con todo el apoyo de su madre y con el ánimo de pagar sus estudios superiores de enfermería que en la actualidad cursa.  María vende de contado y a crédito, diariamente, a clientes vecinos y empleados de empresas cercanas,  la  rentabilidad sobre las ventas de su negocio es de un 50% y  tiene una rotación de materias primas e insumos promedio de de 3 días; en la actualidad su clientela se ha incrementado y sus equipos son insuficientes para responder  a la demanda y muchas veces le toca repetir el proceso de preparación de algunos alimentos para lograrlo. Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el primero logró aumentar sus compras, atender mas clientes y con todo esto ayudar  a su madre en su hogar. Su sueño y gran desafío es terminar su carrera profesional y ejercerla, dejando el negocio posicionado y generando importantes ingresos para el hogar. Su gran desafío es la competencia agresiva del sector pero ella se sostiene ofreciendo alimentos higiénicos, bien presentados y con una buena sazón, con lo cual deleita a sus clientes y por eso la prefieren.  Con su credikiva planea comprar  herramientas de trabajo, comprando ollas, platos, cubiertos, cucharas y una estufa industrial para lograr mejorar aun más su negocio, que en la actualidad presenta una rotación de cuentas por  cobrar de 20 días y quiere incrementar la capacidad productiva para aumentar sus ventas de contado.
texts.en:
María R., 26, prepares food.  She sells breakfasts, lunches, evening snacks and refreshments.  The business started with help from her mother with the goal of earning funds to pay for her Nursing studies which she is currently undertaking.

María sells daily both for cash and on credit to customers that are neighbors and employees of nearby firms.  Profit on sales is about 50% and her raw materials and supplies have a three day turn over on the average.  He customer base has increased recently and her work tools are insufficient to meet demand so she sometimes has to repeat the preparation of some dish or other to meet it.

This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She used the first one to increase her purchases, tend to more customers and help her mother at home.  Her dream and great challenge is to finish her professional training and work in her profession while leaving her business well positioned and generating important family income.

She faces aggressive competition in this sector but she is steadfast in offering hygienic meals that are well presented and tasty that delight her customers; this is why she is their favorite.

She plans to use her Kiva loan to buy work tools:  pots, dishes, cutlery, ladles and an industrial stove to improve her business even more.  She currently carries an accounts payable rotation of 20 days and she wants to increase her productive capacity to increase cash sales.

loans.use: To buy work tools like: pots, dishes, cutlery, ladles and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y al menor de sus hijos en el sector Santa Isabel del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica junto a su esposa a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El suele criar cabras en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio y su esposa cría aves de corral , especialmente patos y gallinas. Cuando estos animales ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrecen en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde viven. Con los ingresos que les brinda esta actividad ellos se encargan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Mariano desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar el negocio familiar, asimismo desea realizar algunas mejoras en los corrales, para lograr su meta ha creído  conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Mariano is 67 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and the youngest of his children in Santa Isabel sector of Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Mariano and his wife raise and sell young animals.  He usually raises goats in pens near his home and his wife raises poultry, especially ducks and chickens.  When these animals have reached a good level of development they offer them for sale to the traders who visit their area.  They use the profits they make from this business activity to help their family finances.

Mariano would like to acquire balanced feed so that he can improve the family business.  He would also like to make some improvements to his pens.  He is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed to improve his business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Cheoung

texts.en: Cheoung C., 56, sells groceries, earning an income of USD 10 per day. C. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month. Two of her children are employed, earning an income of about USD 10 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  C. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnankouma, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce de bétail, de condiments, de poissons et d’articles divers                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
KADIATOU C. s’approvisionne en bétail avec les éleveurs du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et au marché de Dioïla, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Yeredeme are all married and on average they are 43 years old. They each have 4 children and they live in large traditional families in the village of Gnankouma, a prefecture of Dioila within the Region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family and as neighbors. They sell livestock, condiments, fish, and assorted merchandise. 

The women of the group Yeredeme have requested their first loan. 

Kadiatou C. acquires cattle from the farmers in the village and surrounding areas. She sells from her home and in the market in Dioila. She completes her sales in cash and credit, to a clientele made up of both women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 20000FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to cover health care expenses, to purchase food, and to pay for schooling fees. The remaining portion will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a twenty-six-year-old hard-working father of one child living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, longing to build a permanent house in the next five years. He operates an internet café; it has been in operation for three years and the business is still profitable. He started as just an employee but is now an employer and his business plan is to set up three centres in town. Francis needs the loan to buy a photocopy machine and a scanner.

loans.use: Buying a photocopying machine and a scanner

loans.name: Samson Manthi

texts.en:
Samson Manthi K. has been operating a retail shop in Emali town for a period of 10 years. He also does crop farming. He earns a profit of KES 20,000. He is married to Janet and they have two school-aged children.

He learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in Emali town. He is applying for his first loan from KADET, which he plans to use purchase more stock for his shop and also to pay for the shipping costs of these items to the shop.

Samson plans to use the anticipated profits to open an oil filling station. In the future, he plans to expand his business, to educate his children, and to buy a lorry for his business. He is hardworking businessman and a good planner.

loans.use: To increase the stock of the shop, and pay transport.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old, widowed and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, breads, junk foods, biscuits and toothpaste in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Lydia joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods

loans.name: Blanca Elizabeth

texts.es: Blanca Elizabeth M. D. R., cuenta con cuarenta y cuatro años D. edad, posee un chalet en centro escolar D. Ilopango municipio del mismo nombre, departamento D. San Salvador, en el venD. hamburguesas, fruta pelada con chile, limón y sal, golosinas, sodas. Vive en compañía D. su esposo y dos hijos. Blanca esta Solicitando un crédito para surtir D. productos demandados por los estudiantes como pupusas, mayor variedad D. golosinas y bebidas, ella desea poder ofrecerles a sus clientes todo lo que demandan día a día, con el apoyo del crédito solicitado, y así continuar apoyando con su aporte económico a su esposo Don Teodoro
texts.en:
Blanca Elizabeth M. D. R. is 44 years old and lives in her own home in the school area of the town of Ilopango in the department of San Salvador.  Out of her house she sells hamburgers, peeled fruit with chile, lemon and salt, sweets and softdrinks.  She lives with her husband and two children.

In order to meet students' demands, Blanca is requesting a loan to buy a wider variety of sweets and beverages as well as ingredients to make "pupusas".  She wants to be able to meet the daily requirements of her customers and continue helping her husband, Don Teodoro, with the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of sweets and beverages as well as ingredients to make "pupusas"

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie L. is from the village of Macaopao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Melanie is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services  to local community members with her husband as the driver. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service.

loans.name: Yunia

texts.en:
Yunia A. is 50 years old, widowed and a mother of seven children who are all adults. She has been selling clothes in Rongo town for 10 years and earns a profit margin of KES. 15,000. 


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and she is applying for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to buy more clothes for sale. Yunia plans to use the anticipated profit to repay the KADET LTD loan. 


Yunia hopes to grow her business and, in the future, to open a wholesale store for clothes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva N. lives in the kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Eva has a business in a restaurant.  She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Eva sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail.  Eva has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, chicken beef, Irish and sweet potatoes, cassava, and maize.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms and charcoal.  The main business challenge(s) for Eva  include seasonality, transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms and also to own a fully stocked hotel.  Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family and rent for business premise.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, chicken, beef, Irish and sweet potatoes, cassava, and maize flour.

loans.name: Sokphun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokphun D. is 42 and her husband, Mr. Phunly Kong, is 51. They live along National Road Number Six outside Phnom Penh. They have nine children: two sons and seven daughters. One is married and lives in separate home, one is a security guard, two are garment factory workers, one is a gas station attendant and the others are in school. Mr. Phunly Kong is a commune leader assistant.

Sokphun stays home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband's and children’s salary. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her daughters to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughters to get to work.

loans.name: Dionalin

texts.en:
Dionalin is 42 years old and married. She has 2 children, aged 15 and 13. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Dionalin is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice and corn crops at their farm. Dionalin rents a stall at the market to sell their harvest. Dionalin does her part to provide for her family's needs.

This loan will be used by Dionalin to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Auxiliadora ya tiene su propio negocio, ella vende ropa nueva y ropa usada la cual tiene mucha demanda en el lugar donde ella vive. 
Empezó su negocio con poco dinero, pero ha venido creciendo ya que ha recibido varios préstamos para invertir en el negocio y poder mantener su casa ya que es madre soltera y tiene que pagar los estudios de educación Primaria  de sus hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Su pequeño negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación, ya que anteriormente era vendedor ambulante, lo que le permite ahora, poder cuidar más a su familia.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara. Dos docenas de pantalones de varón, camisas, sandalias, short y blúmer. Para satisfacer los encargos que sus clientes le han solicitado, y tener  a sus clientes satisfecho.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora already owns her own business selling new and used clothes which are in great demand where she lives.  She started her business with just a little money but it has grown since she has received several loans to invest in her business and also support her household.  Auxiliadora is a single mother and she has to pay for her children's elementary school education. 

Auxiliadora's small business is located in her home.  She used to sell her products as a street vendor but now she is better able to look after her family.  She will use this new loan to buy two dozen pairs of men's pants, shirts, sandals, shorts and underpants.  This will enable her to fill the orders that her customers have placed with her and keep her customers happy.

loans.use: to buy men's clothes, shirts, shorts, underpants and sandals

loans.name: Elías Arturo

texts.es:
Elías Arturo es de origen campesino y de su padre heredó el amor por el campo y por los oficios agrícolas, los cuales le han permitido desde hace algunos años dedicarse a su propio negocio, la producción agrícola de hortalizas como cilantro, mora, entre otros productos propios de la finca que arrendó para tal fin, ubicada en Santa Fe de Antioquia, municipio de Colombia. 

Como gran visionario, Elías espera en el futuro tener su propia finca para mejorar su calidad de vida, la de su esposa y su hijo. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos, abonos y semillas pues durante la época de invierno que atravesó hace algunos días el país su producción se vio afectada, por lo que necesita incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Elías Arturo has farming roots and from his father he inherited a love of the land and a love for farming.  For several years this has allowed him to have his own business.  He grows produce such as cilantro and blackberries as well as other products from the farm that he rents for this purpose in Santa Fe de Antioquia, Columbia.  Since he is a great visionary, Elias hopes that in the future he will have his own farm so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his wife and son.  For now he needs a loan to purchase supplies, manure and seeds.   During the winter season, that started a few days ago, his production has been affected and he needs to increase his income.

loans.use: buy supplies, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is married and a mother of three school-age children. She is 37 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Edna is a farmer. She grows and harvests pineapples to earn a living. She sells fresh pineapple at the roadside to travelers and motorists. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year, she earns a total average of PHP 50,000 in this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay labor cost for land clearing.

Edna has been a member of GDMPC for three months. In the future, Edna hopes to purchase land for pineapple production and gain more profit.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for clearing her land.

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
A 59-year-old businesswoman, Kaninishe is a widow with six grown children. For the past 10 years she has been running a hair beauty shop as her primary business and a retail shop as a secondary business, earning a monthly income of KES 13,800 which she uses to meet family needs.

An existing KADET customer introduced Kaninishe to KADET, and she is now applying for her first loan with which she will buy beauty products such as shampoo and a blow-dryer, and add a stock of sugar, rice, maize meal to her shop.

With the anticipated additional profits arising from the loan, she will educate her children to university level. Kaninishe's hope is to purchase land and build rental houses to generate additional income.

loans.use: to purchase products for her two businesses.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
El negocio de doña Ana, es la venta de tortillas y cuajada, con varios años en las ventas, pues ha sido su medio para sobresalir adelante junto con sus hijos.
Al inicio palmeaba poco, lo que con los años, su produccion de tortilla aumento, a si como la captacion de clientes, al obtener mas capital para trabajar, el cual logro gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic dio. 
Una de sus meta el el mejoramiento de su vivienda, en donde con este nuevo prestamo embaldozara y cambiara puerta trasera, logrando mejor seguridad, como mejor higiene.
Materiales a comprar, arena, cemento, esponja, para comenzar la obra. El cual esta contenta por el bien comun de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana sells tortillas and curds. She has done this for several years, and it has been her way of succeeding along with her children.
In the beginning she only made a few tortillas, but with the years her production increased, as did her customer base, when she received more working capital thanks to a loan from Afodenic.
One of her goals is to improve her home. With this new loan she will tile her home and change the rear door. This will achieve greater security and better hygiene.
She will purchase sand, cement and sponges to start this job. She is happy for this for the common good of her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to tile her home, and to purchase a door, thus achieving a better house.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a married man with ten children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental houses that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, Charles has operated a goat meat business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his area of operation. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business, he wants to purchase goats for resale with a loan of Kshs 80,000.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogne is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married and has one child who is four years old. He has been a farmer for the past eight years, having learned rice farming from his parents. 

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and finally in harvesting activities. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik requested credit for the expansion of a family-owned pig farm. 

Rudik is 45 years old, married, and lives with his family in the village of Shaumiani, East Georgia. His family consists of himself, his wife Sirush, and their 25-year-old son Edik. Edik is a shoe-maker and works in the village.

Rudik and Sirush lead the pig farm owned by the family. They have seven pigs and sell on average 70 piglets per year. At the same time the family owns a fruit garden. Rudik sells harvested fruit locally to greengrocer retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

With the requested credit Rudik will purchase five to six piglets and feed for them. Rudik will raise the piglets and after a year will be able to increase the price of the piglets by 70-80%. The income of the family will increase by 50 to 60%. It will positively affect the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 5-6 piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for insects

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La Señora Faustina tiene 50 años, está casada con el Señor Saturnino con quien tiene 4 hijos: Julio Cesar D. 30, Rosana D. 26, Rodrigo D. 23 y Liz D. 18 años, estos 2 últimos son estudiantes y viven todavía con ellos.  
Faustina tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo D. artículos, hace aproximadamente 12 años que se dedica a esto. En cuanto a su clientela comenta  que tiene una clientela bien formada y en la cual le va muy bien.
PretenD. utilizar el crédito para la compra comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás con lo que podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Faustina is 50 years old.  She is married to Señor Saturnino, with whom she has four children: Julio Cesar, aged 30; Rosana, 26: Rodrigo, 23; and Liz, aged 18.  These last two are students and still live with their parents.

Faustina has a well-stocked store with all types of items, which she has had for approximately 12 years.  As regards her customers, she comments that she has a solid customer base and with that, things are going very well for her.

She is planning to use the loan to buy food, drinks, dairy products and other things so she can stock up and meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products and other things for her retail premises.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Esteban  es un hombre muy trabajador que decidió hace 5 años instalar su propio negocio donde se podría desarrollar su oficio como carpintero donde el pudiera tomar sus propias decisiones.
En la carpintería realiza trabajos como lo son closets, cocinas integrales, bases para camas, comedores, sillas o depende de lo que el cliente necesite conforme medidas y colores. Esteban le gusta su oficio como carpintero ya que de esta manera; es como el gana más dinero para mantener los gastos de su familia. El es padre de dos pequeños a quienes quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida es por ello que requiere de un préstamo para comprar madera, pintura, clavos, y algunos accesorios para armar  y así seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Esteben is a very hard-working man.  Five years ago he decided to establish his own business where he would be able to develop his trade as a carpenter and where he would be able to make his own decisions.

In the carpenter shop he makes things like closets, kitchen islands, bed frames, dining furniture, and chairs.  It depends on what the customer needs and in accordance with the measurements and colors.

Esteban likes his trade as a carpenter because this way he earns more money in order to support the family’s expenses.

He is the father of two little ones, and he wants to offer them a better quality of life.  That is why he needs a loan to buy wood, paint, nails, and some accessories for assembly.  This way he will continue with his business.

loans.use: to buy wood and nails and more.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haidar is a 33-year-old married man and the father of three precious children.  Haidar is a hard working man.  He started working when he was 13 years old.  His 20 years of experience has given him a stable base to improve his business in a smart way.  Haidar's main goal is to provide his children with the best education; one he couldn't have because his parent's financial situation forced him to struggle in business in his early childhood.  He hopes to see them highly educated.  That is why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua.  He wants to pay for his children's primary school costs.  This is Haidar's forth cycle with Al Majmoua.  He is a good standing borrower with a very good reputation. Haidar hopes to improve his business in the future by opening a special facial department upon his customers requests.

loans.use: to pay for his children's primary school costs.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 35 years old and lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

Elvie has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase stock for her general store. 

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Monica has been in business selling clothes at the market, on a retail basis, for the last 7 years. She works six days a week. She has requested  for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy rolls materials to make clothes. Her major business challenge is seasonality and ever increasing prices of clothing materials. 

Monica and her family live in a rented house and have access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent, and her aspiration and goal is to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy rolls of clothing materials (bitengi)

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chorn is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Kompong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is a responsible housewife who always takes care of the family, in addition to her farming work. She grows an annual rice crop alongside her husband on her own farmland. Agriculture is the sole source of her income. Currently, one of her daughters is involved in a used clothing business, which can generate additional profits for the family. In order to sustain this new business, Mrs. Chorn is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a stock of used clothes for her daughter. Mrs. Chorn hopes that she will be able to improve her standard of living as she gains more profits through the use of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothes for her daughter's used clothing business.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. For the past five years, Edison has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells alcoholic beverages and soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, Edison has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beer and soft drinks, and will help Edison to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Edison hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a large bar. 

Edison is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edison who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 32 años de edad, convive con Jeremías de 30 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Norma, es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su negocio en la venta de golosinas. Esta actividad lo realiza en el mercadito de su ciudad, que con el apoyo de sus hijos pudo estabelcerse, al principio no tenia mucha clientela, pero poco a poco fue ganándose el aprecio de ellos en especial de los más pequeños quienes son sus clientes potenciales. Norma está feliz por que el negocio le va muy bien gracias al empeño que tiene para con ello. En un futuro desea abrir un nuevo negocio en la venta de abarrotes para así obtener mejores ingresos y darles una mejor vida a su familia. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles norma comprará productos de primera necesidad para abrir su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old and lives with Jeremiah who is 30.  They have three children. They live together in their own home located in the district of Pichari. 

Norma is a woman dedicated to her family and her business selling sweets. Her business takes place in the small market of their city.  With the support of her children she was able to establish herself in the business.  At first she did not have much business, but has gradually gained the appreciation of her clientele, especially the little ones who are her best potential customers. Norma is happy because business is doing very well thanks to her efforts

She wants to open a new business selling groceries in order to obtain better profits and offer a better life for her family. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make her loan payments punctually.  With the 1,500 soles, Norma will buy standard grocery staples to open her new business.

loans.use: To buy products to provision her store

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She has run a detergent business for the past year. In addition, she is a tailor. 

Rajab joined Milango to access credit for her business. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase detergents to sell. Rajab hopes to open more detergent shops in the future. The extra income from the loan will be used to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase detergents to sell.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is 48 years old. She has two children whom are studying in secondary school. She raises pig and sells cooked food in the market for a living. From her business, she gains 4,200,000 VND a month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to make cooked food to sell in the market. The benefit will be used for enlarge her pigsty.

loans.use: to make cooked food to sell in the market. The benefit will be used for enlarge her pigsty.

loans.name: Phiona's Group

texts.en:
Joy's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Joy is 23 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Joy has been working hard to manage her saloon, which sells hair extensions. 

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used  to get more products for the saloon and will help Joy to generate greater profits and increase the business. Joy hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big business. 

Joy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Victoria P. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Hudah. She is the Director of Victoria Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kinoni in Lwengo with 450 students. Victoria Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Victoria Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Hudah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sarahi

texts.en:
I work selling clothes for men, women, children and babies. My business is located on one of the main roads in the city, very close to the transportation centers. At this moment in time, my business is in high demand because of my clothing prices, this helps me to sustain my family. This year, my oldest child will enter High School and I need to continue working to support him in this. I know that my earnings will increase with the investments that I will make.

Loan Use: Buying clothing for babies and children, shirts, socks, blouses, skirts

Me dedico a la venta de ropa para niño, dama y caballero y bebes, mi negocio esta ubicado en una de las principales calles de la ciudad a pocos metros de una de las terminales de transportes. Actualmente mi negocio esta teniendo bastante demanda por los precios en ropa, esto me ayuda a mejorar las oportunidades para tener bien a mi familia. Este año mi hijo mayor sale de secundaria y necesito seguirlo apoyando en su carrera. Se que los ingresos mejoraran con la inversion que hare.

loans.use: Compra de ropa de bebe, niño, camisas, calcetines, blusas, faldas.

loans.name: Babek

texts.en:
Babek has a small shop where he sells rubbers. He started off working by selling as a retailer. 
He saved enough money to set up a business . 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $400 and bought rubbers, rubber shoes.
For the second  time he borrowed a loan of $600 to open  a shoe store.
Now he needs a loan of $850 to buy leather shoes. He wants to improve his business. 
Babek is 37, married, has 2 children, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled  on front line in Fizuli region Akhmedbeyli village.

loans.use: To  buy leather shoes

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman is a Displaced Person from the occupied Kelbadjar district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married, and has two children. He started his business in 1999, and borrowed two Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $2300. Now he is willing to borrow $1200 to increase his variety of goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio is married and has six children. His wife takes care of the home. He began his business due to economic necessity, because the salary he earned didn’t cover the expenses of all his children. José Antonio began by doing repairs from his home and, little by little, his business grew until he could rent a shop. Apart from individual clients, he also provides maintenance services to some nearby hotels, especially for televisions and internal alarm systems.

José Antonio is requesting a loan of $325.00 to be able to buy electronic parts for internal antennas that he makes. He offers to pay the loan back in 6 months. He thanks you much for your support in helping him to get ahead with his business and to improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

José Antonio esta casado y tiene seis hijos, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar. Él empezó con su negocio viendo la necesidad económica por la que pasaba ya que con los gastos de todos sus hijos no le alcanzaba su sueldo como empleado que percibía. José Antonio comenzó realizando reparaciones en su hogar y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta poder rentar un local especial para continuar con su negocio y aparte de tener clientes individuales, el también brinda servicio de mantenimiento a algunos hoteles de su localidad, especialmente a los televisores e instalaciones y los sistemas de alarmas internos.

José Antonio está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para poder comprar piezas electrónicas para la elaboración de antenas internas que fabrica, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para poder salir adelante con su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: To buy electronic parts for internal antennas that he makes

loans.name: Nu

texts.en:
Mrs. Nu L. is a 59-year-old mother of six children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their plantation growing crops and earn around $2 each day. One of her children is a tailor and another is a grocer.

Mrs. Nu L. is humbly requesting a loan of $500 to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand her plantation.

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer to expand her plantation.

loans.name: Vaalotu

texts.en:
Vaalotu is a 22-year-old woman with two kids. She became very interested in cooking barbecue foods when she worked at a restaurant last year. Now, she plans to start her own personal barbecue business.

When she received her first loan of $300 USD, she used it to buy all the ingredients needed for making different meats. She sells the food in front of her house, close to the main road where many people pass by. She hopes to use her next loan to buy a gas oven so that it is much easier to cook her food, and in turn, bring in more income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed for her barbecue business

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Nicolaza belongs to the Las Riojanitas ("The Rioja Girls") community bank. Her business is located in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She earns a living selling sweet and savory snacks made with bases of wheat and corn flour. She also makes "chiffles" (chips made from plantains) and "maduritos asados" (a local dish) that are distributed to dining rooms at varoius schools in the area.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.800 (800 Peruvian soles or about $268), to be repaid in 6 installments, Nicolaza will buy supplies, like wheat flour, corn flour, sugar, butter, plantains, cheese and other ingredients for making her snacks.

Nicolaza, 48, is married and has 2 children who no longer depend on her and her husband. She considers herself very dedicated and persistent in her work, organized and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nicolaza pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Riojanitas, tiene ubicado su negocio en el Mercado Central del distrito de Rioja, provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de bocaditos dulces y salados preparados en base a harina de trigo y maíz, además de la preparación de chifles y maduritos asados para ser distribuidos en los comedores de distintos centros educativos de su distrito.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 ($ 268.00), el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará la materia prima para la elaboración de sus bocaditos como son harina de trigo (01 saco), harina de maíz (01 saco), azúcar (01 saco), mantequilla (10 kg.), plátano maduro (02 racimos), quesos (05 kg.), maní (05 kg.) y otros productos más que complementen la preparación de sus bocaditos.

Ella está casada, tiene 48 años y tiene 02 hijos, quienes ya no dependen económicamente de ella y su esposo. Se considera muy dedicada y empeñosa con su trabajo, organizada y responsable.

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Heriah

texts.en: Heriah is 38 years old. She earns her living producing bamboo matts at her house, usually making US$22.5 per month. Her husband, K., has no regular income. Heriah is asking for a loan of US$150 to help expand her matt-making business. She is a member of MBK, and, as a result, her business does increasingly well. She is willing to repay the current loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of a business

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en: Nigina is 32 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  She first became our client in  September of.  Her business is selling of scarfs and clothes, which she buys from Bishkek.  She has a variety goods and many customers from the region of Dushanbe.  She has steady business that grows with each passing month.  She is requesting this loan from Kiva so that she may stock up on winter clothes

loans.use: Purchase of winter assortment.

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en: Abdumanon R. was born in 1941 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Mr. R. is engaged in the home business of raising and selling livestock. He has a large flock and has gained skills and knowledge from working with livestock for 30 years. His business brings in the general family income. His wife works making products from the milk produced and making yarn. Now, Mr. R. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 to purchase mixed fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: To purchase mixed fodder for livestock

loans.name: Meg

texts.es:
Meg V. R. is an associate of the “Santa Inés” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, province of the Picota, district of Picota. Her food store is located in her own house at Francisco Bolognesi Nº 572, where she serves various foods.

In addition to the performance of her duties as the Teacher of primary education of an Educational Center of the locality, and given her know-how in the kitchen, she began a business preparing food for sale with a typical daily menu. Her customers are generally passers-by. She complements this activity with the sale of braised chicken that is a favorite at night.

With the loan of 800 soles which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase non-perishable supplies for the preparation of the various dishes of food that she offers daily to her ample clientele. She will also purchase some new kitchen utensils..

Meg is a very happy and enthusiastic woman of 38 years. She only wants to do well, and, with the humility that she shows, she wants to contribute to the progress of the community that gave her the opportunity to improve herself.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Meg V. R., es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Inés”, vive en la Región San Martín ,provincia del Picota, distrito de Picota, su local de venta de comida esta ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr: Francisco Bolognesi Nº 572, donde atiende con variada comida.

Paralelo al desempeño de su profesión como Profesora de educación primaria de un Centro Educativo de la localidad, y dado sus conocimientos sobre cocina instalo un negocio de venta de comida diario tipo menú, cuyos comensales son generalmente transeúntes, complementando esta actividad con la venta de pollo a la braza, que es muy requerido sobre todo por las noches.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses lo invertirá en insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su basta clientela ,como también renovara sus utensilios de cocina..

Meg, es una muy mujer entusiasta y alegre con 38 años, que sola supo salir adelante y con la humildad que demuestra quiere contribuir al progreso de la comunidad que le dio la oportunidad de salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the preparation of food for sale and to buy new kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma has a place where she sells candies, cookies and other things and her husband is retired. She has one daughter who is studying at the University and the place allows her to earn an income and support her family. Her home is located in the zone of Llojeta bajo in the city of La Paz and her place is located in the San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz. This is the third time that she has requested a loan, her history qualifies her as client 1 which means that she has been good at repaying her loans. The loan that she requests now will be used to supplement her capital (to purchase sweets, drinks, Kleenex, and other things) to offer her clients. Her work and experience have given her the opportunity to access this loan, furthermore the analysis of her fluid cash shows her ability to repay the loan in the stipulated terms.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma tiene un puesto donde vende dulces, refrescos galletas y otros y su esposo es jubilado. Tiene una hija en que esta en la universidad y el puesto le ayuda para generar ingresos y aportar en su familia. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Llojeta bajo de la ciudad de La Paz y su puesto esta ubicado en la zona de san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Tercera vez que solicita un crédito, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se su obligación. El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado para aumentar su capital ( Compra de dulces, refrescos, clinex, y otros) para ofrecer a su clientela. Su trabajo y la experiencia le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito, además de que el análisis de su flujo de caja demuestra su habilidad para repagar la deuda en los plazos estipulados.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise - sweets, drinks, kleenex, etc. for her grovery store.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa W. is 40 years old and the mother of three children. All her children are currently in school. She has been selling used clothing for the past 10 years in the local market. Adwoa wants to use her loan to buy more used clothes to expand her operation. She is a member of the group “Kamfo Yehowa” meaning Praise Jehovah. Members agree to guarantee one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
For the last six years, Lida has sold native products from the highlands in the market close to her house. Previously she used to live in the provinces, where she also used to work as a saleswoman. However, she later decided to move to Lima and to establish a business selling highland products such as broad beans, maize, corn, etc.

Lida travels fortnightly to the highlands to buy her products. The loans she has asked for have allowed her to cover the expenses of the trips she makes. She would like to be able to accumulate more capital to allow her to have a stall and her own house.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 6 años, Lida vende productos oriundos de la sierra en el mercado cerca de su casa. Antes ella vivía en provincia, donde también trabajaba vendiendo. Sin embargo, luego decidió mudarse a Lima y poner un negocio de productos de la sierra, como habas, maíz, mote, etc.

Lida viaja quincenal a la sierra a comprar sus productos. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para cubrir el gasto de los viajes que realiza. A ella le gustaría poder tener más capital para así tener un puesto y una casa propia.

loans.use: To travel into the provices to buy the products she sells.

loans.name: Essi Dodzi

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of two children, Mrs Essi Dodzi T. was born on September 5, 1976 in Tsévié, the capital of the Maritime Region. In 2007, she started a business to sell mineral water wholesale to retailers and small bars in her neighborhood. She's seeking this first loan to buy 30 boxes of bottled water to increase her stock and her sales volume.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de deux enfants, dame T. Essi Dodzi est née le 05 septembre 1976 à Tsévié, le chef-lieu de la région maritime. En 2007, elle a ouvert un magasin de vente d’eau minérale en gros aux boutiques et petits établissements du quartier. Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 30 cartons de bouteille d’eau minérale afin d’augmenter son stock et de mieux vendre.

loans.use: To buy boxes of bottled water

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa was born in 1979 and she lives with her husband and one child in the town Banovići. She works as a saleswoman in a shop in the town. She earns 300 KM monthly. Her husband works as a musician and does beekeeping. He can earn about 800 KM monthly.

This is her second loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of 600 KM. Edisa will use it to buy more bees because she wants to expand the business. She knows that she can earn more money for her family by selling honey because honey has a good price at the market.

loans.use: To buy bees.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally C., 39, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Phai, 39, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in the local school.

Mrs. Phally has been selling grocery items since 2005. She buys them from Korky market for resale at her home. Her husband has been a policeman since 1990 and has been motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh since 1995. He drives his motor taxi when he is free from his work. Currently, the couple is in the process of building their new house and lacks the money to finish it.

Therefore, Phally is requesting a loan of $1000 to finish her house and buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and to finish her house.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 33 años de edad, estudió quinto grado de primaria, es casada y madre de 04 hijos (03 varones de 14, 07, 02 años y una niña de 05 años de edad). Vive en la  avenida Pacífico S/N, salida a Mazocruz, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde hace tres ciclos es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio” en Alintuyo. En un inicio con S/.300 compró 02 ovinos mejorados c/u a S/.150. Quedó huérfana de madre a los 06 años de edad, sólo su padre la apoyó. A los 17 años tuvo su pareja y a los 20 años empezó a elaborar trencillas de lana de alpaca, los cuales vendió los días domingos en Ilave a un promedio de 05, 06 trencillas c/u a S/.5 y a S/.10 de acuerdo al tamaño y calidad. Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta  de ovinos.

Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 05 ovinos cada uno a S/.180 y S/. 200, dependiendo del tamaño.

Su mayor sueño es tener un pequeño establo de ovinos mejorados en el campo (Parcialidad de Alintuyo) y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is 33, went to school up to grade five, she is married and has four children (three sons ages 14, 7 and 2, and one 5 year old girl). She lives on Pacific Avenue, district of Ilave, El Collao, Puno. Three years ago she became a member of the “June 24th” community bank, in Alintuyo. At the beginning with $100 she bought 2 high quality sheep, each at $50. Her mother died when Julia was six, only her father was there for her. At 17, she met her partner and at 20 she started making braid beads made of Alpaca wool, which she sold on Sundays in Ilave at an average of 5 or 6 trencillas at $1.50 or $3 each, depending on their size and quality. Currently she buys and sells sheep. With this loan of $350, to be repaid in three months, she will buy five sheep at $60 or $70 each depending on their size. Her biggest dream is to have her own barn in the country (in Alintuyo) to raise good quality sheep and to see her children study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Alejandro Jose

texts.es: El Sr. R. L., pequeño productor de arroz y socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria actualmente tiene establecido por esfuerzo propio 4 mzs de arroz, el que atiende personalemente y en el manejo agronomico del cultivo, siendo su principal problema la trillada de la produccion, lo que reduce sus ingresos para el sustento familiar.  A traves de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio para el montaje de un trillo de arroz en su comunidad, su sueño es ser socio de este trillo y asi tener mejores condiciones de vida familiar ya que obtendria mejores precios y mayores ingresos para el futuro familiar.
texts.en:
R. L. is a producer of rice and is a member of the farming cooperative. He has established through his own efforts 4 plantations of rice, attending to them personnally including cultivation, this being his greatest problem in production and the factor that most reduces his family's income. Through his cooperative he has the opportunity to participate in the store of rice for the community. His dream is to be a partner of this cooperative so that he may provide better living conditions for his family. He would obtain better prices and yield a greater income for the future of his family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To contribute 30% portion towards the construction in La Pena.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Luis es una persona muy honesta, trabajadora y responsable, el y su esposa la señora Lety  tienen nueve años trabajando día con día su negocio que lleva por nombre “Súper L.” porque saben que solo trabajando pueden salir adelante.
Están solicitando este crédito para realizar el pago de un  proveedor de refrescos por la compra de un pedido grande y mediante esto ellos consideran obtener una mayor cantidad de clientes, logrando mayor número de ventas y un mejor futuro para ellos y su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is an honest, hard-working and responsible person. He and his wife, Lety, have operated their business called Super L. for nine years, working day in and day out because they know that hard work is the only way to get ahead.

They are applying for this loan in order to pay a wholesale provider of soft drinks for a large order which, in turn, will allow them to increase their customer base, their sales and ultimately lead to a better future for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 26 años, vive sola, ya que aun no tiene esposo ni tampoco hijos. Siempre se le ha dado la facilidad para la venta, su manera de convencer a las personas y su gran carisma son su principal arma para atraer a la clientela, la cual se ve complacida con los productos y el trato de Maritza. Ella se ha venido dedicando a la venta de productos naturales desde hace 6 años, en los cuales el negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco para arrojarle buenas ganancias. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es la venta, ya que algunas personas son muy incrédulas acerca del provecho de los productos naturales, pero el poder de convencimiento de Maritza es mucho más fuerte, logrando que esta pequeña dificultad sea superada. Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado aumentará la cantidad de mercadería para incrementar sus ventas y así lograr mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 26 and lives by herself, since she does not yet have a husband or children. She has always had a facility for sales. Her ability to influence people and her strong charisma are her best assets in attracting customers, who are pleased with the products and Maritza’s service. She has earned her living selling natural products for six years, during which time business has grown little by little, providing Maritza with nice profits. The hardest part of her work is making the sale, since some people are very skeptical about the advantages of natural products, but Maritza’s power of persuasion is much stronger, allowing her to overcome this small difficulty. This will be her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual with her payments. She plans to use her loan to increase her inventory so she can grow her sales and earn more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of products she sells

loans.name: Alex Mauricio

texts.es: alex es un joven de 24 años de edad quien se dedica a la actividad comercial desde los 19 años, debido a que proviene  de una familia que le inculco ser su propio jefe, el es casado y tiene una hija de 2 años la cual piensa ingresar al prekindrer o maternal el proximo año, el en estos momentos esta estudiando administracion de empresas en la universidad, actualmente se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en su casa de habitacion, dicha actividad le genera ingresos necesarios para mantener la familia y su hogar tambien para pagar sus estudios, el necesita un credito para poder hacer crecer su negocio un poco mas. ya que las necesidades y exigencias de los clientes son muchas y necesita tener mas variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Alex, 24, is a young man, but he started operating his business when he was even younger, at 19, full of his family's advice to be his own boss. He's married and has a daughter, 2, who he's thinking of enrolling in day care next year. He's also studying business administration at the university. Alex makes a living operating a grocery business that he runs from his house. The business generates enough income to support the family and pay for Alex's studies. He needs a loan so that he can grow the business a bit more. His customers have a lot of needs and demands and he needs a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther C. is 57 years old, married, and blessed with 2 children. She looks forward to having a better life for her family in the future. She is struggling to earn money for the family, for her husband is sickly and needs maintenance of medicines daily while her children are in school. The only income she gets to support the family is from the variety store. Her family lives in a house without electricity and she wants it to be lighted to have a comfortable living situation.

Esther is planning to increase the income of their variety store. To be able to do this, she needs additional capital in the amount of PHP 11,000.00 for her business. If this will be given, this will be her 3rd loan cycle from HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Allah Kan Dèmè (May God Assist Us) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Allah kan Dèmè est composé d’une veuve et de 3 femmes,  mariées dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants  dans le quartier Bananissabakoro de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali).  Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et d’activités de petit commerce qui sont entre autres la vente d’encens, d’habits, de chaussures, des produits de beauté, de savon et des céréales (mil, fonio et riz).

Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles en nette croissance, elles décidèrent d’adhérer au programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.

Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter 4 complets d’habits brodés, 3 cartons de crème pour la peau, 2 cartons de parfums et 20 paires de chaussures. Elles se ravitaillent mensuellement en habits brodés, en chaussures et en produits de beauté au grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Elles revendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, en ambulant et  dans une boutique située dans le quartier administratif de Ségou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 

Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel moyen de 39.500FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt et  la prise en charge  des besoins de la famille (nourritures, frais scolaires, santé etc.)  Leur objectif est d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The group Allah Kan Dèmè is composed of a widow and three married women who average 45 years of age and 4 children each. They live in monogamous families in the Bananissabakoro district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and know one another through ties of community, marriage, and small-scale commerce, which includes selling clothing, shoes, beauty products, soap, and grain (millet, fonio, and rice).

Concerned about satisfying their clearly-growing customer base, they decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding one have been correctly repaid.

This loan will be used to buy: four embroidered outfits, three boxes of skin cream, two boxes of perfume, and twenty pairs of shoes. The women resupply themselves monthly in outfits, shoes, and beauty products at the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). Sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, at the house, from going door-to-door, and in a shop located in the administrative district of Ségou. The customers are for the most part composed of women.

The women envision realizing an average monthly profit of 39,500 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to meet family needs (food, schooling costs, health, etc.) Their objective is to have a house for living in.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing (embroidered pagnes), shoes, and beauty products for resale

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is Mohamed M., a local entrepreneur in Kabala town. Mohamed was born in Kabala, northern Sierra Leone. He is age twenty-seven, married with three children. He started his business in 2002 and with the help of SMT loans, he has been a very successful businessman ever since. From the proceeds of his business, he is able to take care of his children – feeding, clothing, and educating them. Mohamed is requesting a loan of 1,000,000.00 to help him further strengthen his business.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 28-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Mouhamad has been working as a house painter for eight years. Mouhamad requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan.

Mouhamad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Mouhamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding and improving his business.

loans.use: Mouhamad will use the loan to purchase tools for his business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia runs a small village store in St.Tomas Saguday, Quirino Province. She wishes to make it grow so it will be more profitable, but she doesn’t have enough capital to increase her store’s inventory. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more supplies for her store so business will improve. Amelia patiently maintains her store so she is able to contribute to the financial support of her family. Her family’s main source of income comes from their farm which is maintained by her husband.

Amelia is 44 years old, and married to Bernabe A., Sr. The couple is blessed with four children; Bernabe A. Jr., 21 years old and a high school graduate; Ricky, 19 years old, also a high school graduate, followed by Roselyn, 10 years old and in grade school; the youngest is Julie-Anne, 5 years old.

Amelia hopes to improve their current standard of living and prays to be able to send her two youngest children to college in the future, since the two elder children were not able to complete their studies due to life’s difficulties. With the loan she will able to provide for the needs of her children. The loan will help her attain her life’s goals.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
For five years, Elesia has been the owner of a small grocery for local alcohol sales in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa. She belongs to the Semtema A South group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $100. Every day, she works at her business for six hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She hopes to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan so that she can save money for future use, improve her home, and pay school fees for her youngest children.

Elesia is 45 years old and married, and she has four children, ages 4, 18, 20, and 26. She also cares for three additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more items for the preparation and sale of local alcohol.

loans.name: Bùi Thị

texts.en:
T. Bùi Thị, 55 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000.000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 4fourh loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma C., 63, is from the city of Dapitan. She is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Thelma owns and operates vulcanizing shop.  Her main source of income comes from vulcanizing services in the local community.  Thelma has engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC to purchase an air compressor.  Thelma is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase materials to expand her business.  This loan will be the 7th from PMPC.  Thelma plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 
---------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Capital for vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng V. was born in 1973 and is currently a village woman living in Phnom Penh, the capital. She earns her daily living by growing various vegetables on her own land of her village. Her husband is a domestic construction worker. This couple has three school-aged children.

Since 2005, Cheng V. has sold her mature crop to her buyers every two or three months after she plants. Cheng Vank will be using her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticide to support her growing crops.

Note: Cheng V.’s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticide

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita D. is 36 years old, married to Fernando. She manages a village store and lives in Aguinaldo Cordon, Isabela. They have a nine-year-old son named Richard, and he is now in the elementary level.  

Conchita is maintaining her store in order to generate a daily income for her family, especially for her child’s education. The store keeps growing and her desire to improve it motivates her to be more patient and hard-working. She also decided to request a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to be used for her store.  

Conchita is looking for the benefits of her family; that is why she is so diligent and patient. Also her husband is sacrificing a lot for them. Her child Richard gives them the inspiration to move on and keep life going.

loans.use: additional capital for her store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 30 years of age. She is married to Gilbert B. who is a simple farmer. They have two children: Jay Lord who is 10 years of age and Jayson who is 4 years old. Her eldest child is already attending primary school while her youngest will soon enter pre-school. Her family lives in the simple village of Barangay Pulay of Luna, Isabela. 
 
She has managed a livestock business for almost a year and because of a lack of financial capital, she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP5,000 to be able to maintain the business. As a beginner in managing a business, Virginia believes that having enough capital will be a great factor in somehow becoming successful in the business. She also believes that “great things begin from humble beginnings” and now her main principle in life is to become successful in the future from her chosen business of hog raising.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rosa Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora ROSA EUGENIA B. P., tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios técnicos de cosmetología, trabajó de cosmetóloga en un salón de belleza de su tía.
Pero aproximadamente a los 2 años de estar trabajando con su tía logró abrir una peluquería propia en la casa de su mamá. Y actualmente sigue trabajando ahí.
ROSA es madre soltera , tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella porque  se encuentran en el colegio.
Tiene que trabajar para mantener a sus hijos ya que  no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre de ellos.
ROSA se dedica a la atención en su peluquería, realiza cortes de cabello, peinados, tintes, manicure, pedicure, etc
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de líquidos y tintes.
Este crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar un juego de tijeras, una secadora, tintes, líquidos de ondulación, espejos, etc
ROSA sueña con abrir otra peluquería en el centro de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Eugenia B. P. is 37 years old and lives in the La Esperanza district, province of Trujillo, in the state of La Libertad – Peru. She is a member of the “Mujeres en Accion” (Women in Action) communal bank. This entrepreneur has had technical studies in cosmetology and worked as a cosmetologist in her aunt’s beauty salon. After approximately 2 years of working with her aunt she was able to open her own hair salon in her mother’s house, and is currently working there.
