Rosa is a single mother and has 3 children who are her financial dependants because they are in school. She must work in order to support her children since she lacks the economic support of their father. Rosa works servicing clients in her hair salon performing hair cuts, styling, dyeing, manicures, pedicures, etc. Her first loan for 300 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of salon products and dyes. This loan for 1,500 nuevos soles will be used to buy a set of scissors, a dryer, dyes, curling product, mirrors, etc. Rosa dreams of opening another hair salon in downtown Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will use it to buy a set of scissors, a dryer, dyes, curling product, mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi. Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes des femmes mariées qui ont  en moyenne  44 ans, 5 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt de groupe après avoir correctement remboursés tous les prêts trois  précédents. 
Elles font de la vente de condiments alimentaires,  de boissons, de poissons frais,  des fruits et légumes,  du gombo et de  la restauration.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 10 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 20 casiers de boissons, 60 kg de poissons frais, 10 sacs de légumes frais, 15 sacs de gombo frais et pour la restauration 1sac de 100 kg de riz, 3 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 1bidon de 20 litres. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants et effectuent leurs ventes à Sikasso ville, à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant,en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne, les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un coin pour la vente.
texts.en:
The seven members of this Benkadi group are all married women, with an average age of 44 and on average, 5 children, and live mostly in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their 4th solidarity loan. The preceding 3 loans were all correctly reimbursed. They sell condiments, drinks, fresh fish, fruit and vegetables, okra, and cooked food.

With their new loan they intend to buy 10 packets of condiments, 20 crates of drinks, 60 kg of fresh fish, 10 sacks of fresh vegetables, 15 sacks of fresh okra, and for their cooked food: 1 sack of 100 kg of rice, 3 packs of condiments, and 1 jerrycan of 20 liters of oil. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Sikasso town and in the surrounding villages. They sell their goods in Sikasso town, out of their homes, in the various markets, and in the neighborhoods on foot, for cash, retail, and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 32,500 F CFA of which part will be put into savings or used for family needs, the rest being invested back into their businesses. They count on having more working capital so as to better satisfy their clientele and to be able to set up a sales point.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale and for cooked food production

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita G. is 10 years older to her husband Jerry G. who is now 31 years old. But their age gap had never been a reason for them to have a same goal in life which is to give their children Abegail 15 years old, Kennedy age 14, Anthea age 12, Nicole age 7 and Axel Rose 4 years old, a better life. Their 5 children are now currently studying so more expenses for the schooling of them plus the expenses in their everyday living.

Last year she joined to Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), now she will have a second loan to them which she’ll be use in her fishing business that been their main source of income to make it more productive. She will use it for buying motor for their boat that used by them in catching fish in the sea then selling it to the market or in their neighborhood.

One dreams of Warlita is to save for the future of their children, she really wants them to finish their studies so that they can help their self to improve their way of living.

loans.use: To buy motor for boat that use in her fishing business

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with a son. He is a businessman from Novomoskovsk, where he runs a small trade selling office supplies. Sergei owns a kiosk in the central city market. He launched his trade 10 years ago. Currently, he has about 35,000 Grivnyas invested in his business. 

Sergei is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to expand his trade. He is hoping to generate enough income and savings to open new vending locations in the near future. Sergei is known as a consistent and honest entrepreneur who tries to have a proactive attitude in life. We believe Sergei will have no trouble repaying this loan.

loans.use: To develop his business

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 20, es soltero, pero tiene una pequeña hija que vive con su madre (su ex pareja). Inter diario trabaja como chofer de un vehículo, transportando pasajeros desde la ciudad hasta los diversos pueblos rurales de la provincia. Al día, como máximo realiza dos viajes, y en algunas oportunidades, con suerte, encuentra pasajeros que van de vuelta, es así cuando logra reunir mayores ganancias. Los otros días trabaja en sus cultivos de café y plátanos, de ese modo dinamiza su economía, con la cual cubre los gastos de su hija. 
Para los días de cosecha, Wilmer aprovecha el auto con el que trabaja, pues mientras lleva a los pasajeros, acomoda de 3 a 4 sacos de productos a la ciudad para su comercialización en el mercado o para las diversas acopiadoras de café.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, él ingresó a este banco comunal por medio de la invitación de su hermano, a quien no quiere hace quedar mal, por lo que será muy cumplido con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 20 years old and single, but he has a young daughter who lives with her mother (his ex-wife). During the day, he works as a taxi driver transporting passengers from the city to different rural villages throughout the province. At most he is able to make two round trips in a single day. Occasionally, if he is lucky, he will secure passengers for the return trip into the city and earn more money as a result. On the days he is not driving, Wilmer works in his coffee and baN. fields as a means of boosting his finances so that he can cover his daughter’s expenses.

During the harvest season, Wilmer makes good use of his taxi. While carrying passengers, he can also accommodate 3 to 4 bags of produce to take with him into the city to sell at the market or to various coffee traders.

This is Wilmer’s first loan with MFP. His brother invited him to join the Communal Bank, so Wilmer promises to make his payments on time to keep from making him look bad. He will use the funds to buy chemical fertilizers for his coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida runs a small business in one of the local stores in Novomoskovsk, next to the central city market, selling children’s clothing items. She is a hard worker. She has worked in this sphere of business for six years and has repaid all previous loans without any problems. Currently, her turnover capital is over $2500. 

Zinaida is constantly looking for new trends and seeking to meet the demands of her customers. This time she is requesting a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase the number of products she has available for sale. She is planning to re-invest new profits in her business to help it run even more efficiently. We believe her managing skills and her ability to choose the right product and to invest lots of hard work and determination in her venture will help Zinaida do big business and become a successful entrepreneur one day.

loans.use: to develop her trade

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru: Бахтиер Хайдаров проживает в Вахшском районе. Возраст 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Бахтиер по специальности "механик". Он более 5 лет занимается услугой такси по городу Душанбе. Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Bahtier H. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 34 years old, married and has 3 children. Bahtier is a mechanic by trade. He has been providing taxi service in the city of Dushanbe for over 5 years. He is requesting a loan for the repair of his car in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda R., 49 years old and married to a farmer, grows rice. She started tilling the farm in 1990, and in just three months her first harvest was 86 sacks of rice. She joined the CEVI credit program in 2008, actively participating in the CEVI cluster meetings together with other farmers. 

She now needs additional capitalization in her business and so is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest and income.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat H. is a 33-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Matanat is a farmer. She has land and plants seasonal fruits. As a rule, Matanat and her son (who also works on the farm) grow sufficient crops for the consumption of the family and for selling. 

Matanat is hoping for a rich yield that she will sell in the market at prices attractive to the population. She is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer and for this purpose she applied for a loan of 1600 Azerbaijani manats.

Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength in life.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 45 years old and lives in Banga, South Cotabato. She has businesses in rice farming and a sari-sari (general) store. Now, with all her efforts to improve her businesses, she is able to provide for the financial needs of her two children including sending them to school.

Aida needs additional capital of Php 10,000 as a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy groceries for her store and farm supplies to make her farm more productive.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her store and farm supplies

loans.name: Elias' Group

texts.en: Elias R. Sr. is from the village of La Suerte, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 57 years old. Elias is the group leader of a 19-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Elias is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Elias runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Elias has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Elias joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elias is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Elias from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru: Нарзулоев Насрулло проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Насрулло более 10 лет занимается торговлей. У него магазин со смешенным ассортиментом. Он продает каляски, игрушки и вещи для дома. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Насрулло хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он намерен открыть еще один магазин.
texts.en:
Nasrullo N. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 37 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife is a homemaker. Nasrullo has been involved in retail sales for over 10 years. He has a store, where he sells various merchandise, including baby carriages, toys and home goods. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover. Nasrullo wants to expand his business. He intends to open another store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria María M. E. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 12 años tiene un puesto de venta de frutas  y tajaditas frente al mercado central esquina opuesta. Es madre soltera de tres hijos dos en edad escolar y  el mayor le ayuda a vender en su negocio.
Anteriormente la Señora M. trabajaba en el Mayoreo el Bisne como trabajadora ayudante de venta tiene 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel de los cuales con estos financiamientos siempre los invierte para su negocio y para hacerles alguna mejora al mismo.
Se esfuerza para salir adelante junto con sus hijos viene a vender a las 6 de la mañana y se va a las 12 del día a su casa para ponerse a freír las tajaditas en su casa para la venta del día siguiente.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria María M. E. has worked as a merchant at the market for 12 years. She has a vending post in front of the central market on the opposite corner where she sells fruit and plantain chips. Gloria is a single mother of three school age children. The oldest child helps her with making sales at her business.

Sra. M. previously worked at the wholesale market in Bisne as a sales assistant. She has been a client of CEPRODEL for three years and has always used her loans to invest in or make improvements to her business. Gloria strives to move forward along with her children. She comes to work at 6am and leaves at 12pm so that she can go home to prepare the plantain chips that she will sell the following day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits such as grapes, apples, mangos, bananas, and watermelons

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a single mother of five children and her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Agnes takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, rent, school fees and feeding the family. Agnes owns a stall selling all types of food like bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava and yellow bananas. She sells to all categories of people at retail only. She works six days a week. Agnes receives at least 15 customers a day. Agnes has been in this business for many years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has been with MCDT for a few years servicing her 12th loan.  She wants to use this loan to increase her stock by buying more bunches of bananas, bags of cassava, sweet potatoes, yellow bananas, tomatoes and onions. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger and start going directly to farmers. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava, sweet potatoes, yellow bananas, etc

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: Madame Khadidiatou T. est une jeun coiffeuse de 28 ans qui habite dans la localité de Camberene. Elle gère son salon de coiffure dans un local bien  aménagé situe très  prés  de la caisse. Elle a une bonne expérience  dans ce domaine car après  ses études  elle a fait une formation en coiffure. Pour satisfaire son besoin de diversification  de son activité elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs destine a acheter des produits de beauté  prévus  pour la revente. L’accroissement  de ses revenus lui permettra de participer a la gestion des besoins du quotidien chez elle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khadidiatou T. is a 28-year-old hairdresser living in Camberene. She runs her nicely arranged beauty salon in a location close by the branch office of UIMCEC. She has good experience in this domain, for after her studies she undertook hairdressing training courses. She wishes to diversify her activity and therefore is requesting a loan for 150,000 francs which will be used to buy beauty products for resale. Her increased earnings will enable her to participate in the management of daily household needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Rosa Rebeca

texts.es:
Rosa  C. tiene 48 años,  se encuentra casada y tiene tres hijos que se encuentran de 28, 26 y 21 años, todos sus hijos son solteros, los  dos primeros  trabajan y son quienes ayudan en la economía del hogar y para el  estudio del  último hijo que está en la  universidad, su esposo es chofer de un Instituto de la ciudad,  con nostalgia nos comenta que tenía una casa pero por ser garante de una amiga  que no pagó la deuda embargaron su propiedad  y ahora viven arrendando en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad ubicada al sur del Ecuador a una altura de 2500 msnm, esta ciudad es muy reconocida por ser cuna de escritores, poetas, deportistas, también fue designada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadora hace tres  años gracias a la invitación de una compañera del mismo, se siente  muy contenta de formar parte de estas mujeres luchadoras como su nombre lo dice, ella  es consultora de belleza de la línea Yanbal y Avon hace tres años aproximadamente y gracias  Dios le va muy bien y además le queda tiempo para estar con su familia.

Con su nuevo crédito comprará perfumes, maquillajes, labiales, cremas, tratamientos para el cabello y corporales y bisutería de  Yanbal y Avon para satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes. Su meta es llegar a tener una casa nueva.
texts.en:
Rosa C., age 48, is married and has three children. The children are 28, 26, and 21 years old; and they are all single. The first two work, and they are the ones who help the household economically. They also help with the last child’s education. Her husband is a driver for an institution in the city. She nostalgically tells us that she had a house. It was guaranteed by a friend who did not pay the debt, so the property was seized. They rent the place they now live in. They live in the large city of Cuenca, which is located to the south of Ecuador at 2,500 meters above sea level. This city is very well known for being the cradle of writers, poets, and athletes. It was also designated as the Cultural Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO in 1999. She has been a member of the Mujeres Luchadora (Tenacious Women) Communal Bank for three years, thanks to an invitation from a colleague in the bank. She feels very happy to be part of these tenacious women, as the name indicates. For approximately three years she has been a beauty consultant for the Yanbal and Avon lines. Thank God, it is going very well. Also, she has time to be with her family. She will use the new loan to buy perfume, make-up, lipstick, creams, body and hair treatments, and costume jewelry from Yanbal and Avon. She will buy these to meet her customers’ needs. Her goal is to have a new house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, make-up, lipstick, creams, body and hair treatments, and costume jewelry from Yanbal and Avon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy foam

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven S. A., aged 30, operates her own small business selling different types of vegetable at the local market. She sells the vegetables that she grows or buys them from other farmers. She has a life partner in her husband (who appears in the photo above) who is also a truck driver for a small firm. The couple helps each other in order to feed their two teenage kids, who are enrolled in school.

Ven S. A.’s husband has recently resigned from his job and he hopes to invest in a motorcycle-trailer business as a taxi driver but he has no capital yet to stA. this business. Therefore, Ven S. A. has requested a loan of US$500 to be used to buy a second-hand motorcycle with attached trailer for her husband to use to pick up passengers for a fee.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle with attached trailer for her husband's businesss

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 49 years old, married to Felix and has 3 school-aged children. Nena owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 20 years. Like other mothers, she says she works hard for her children's education so they could have a bright future.

In 2008, Nena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment for land preparation. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Nena from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment for land preparation

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es: Augusto, de 65 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos.Durante  todos los días, brinda el servicio de taxi, y trabaja 12 horas diarias. Ya lleva 15 años, en el volante; y en todo este tiempo ha logrado adquirir  experiencias que comparte con sus amigos. Luego de un tiempo de trabajar por su cuenta decidió integrarse a una flota de taxis de la ciudad; ya que es de uso más frecuente;  por la seguridad que brindan. Conoce todas las rutas del  sur y norte de  la ciudad, y utiliza las mejores rutas  en horas de tráfico, para brindar  un servicio oportuno a sus pasajeros. Le gusta su trabajo porque es tranquilo, y  dispone de sus horarios, solo que a veces corre el riesgo de asaltos y robos, pero la experiencia le ha permitido conocer a los ocasionales pasajeros que moviliza. Para mas adelante tiene planeado seguir trabajando como hasta hoy y así espera terminar de pagar  las letras de su auto.Es el  doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP,  y será responsable como en las anteriores ocasiones, también esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible  el dinero solicitado que le permitirá continuar progresando.Augusto tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de 4  llantas para su movilidad, para mejorar el servicio, y continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Augusto, age 65, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He provides taxi service everyday, and he works 12 hours a day. He has spent 15 years being at the wheel. In all of that time he has gotten experiences that he shares with his friends. After a time of working for himself he decided to join a fleet of taxis in the city. He did this because they are used more frequently and because they offer better security. He knows all of the routes to the south and north of the city. He uses the best routes during traffic hours so that he can provide his passengers with appropriate service. He likes his work because it is peaceful and he arranges his schedules. Sometimes he runs the risk of assaults or robbery, but the experience has allowed him to meet the random passengers that he transports. In the future he plans to keep working as he has done. This way he expects to be able to finish the payments on his car. This is his twelfth loan with MFP. He will be responsible like he was on the previous occasions. Also, he is very grateful for all of the people who made the requested money possible. It will allow him to continue progressing. Augusto plans to use the requested money to buy four tires for his vehicle in order to improve service and continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new tires for his automobile

loans.name: Let's United Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Let’s United” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve. At least they will be able to provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick. 

Mosia S. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. Mosia was born in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. But he now lives in Makeni together with his wife, who is a businesswoman, and two children who attend primary school. 

Mosia is a tailor and has been in this profession for five years. Mosia will use his share of the loan to buy working materials such as poplins, cloths, threads, etc.

loans.use: To buy working materials such as poplins, cloths, threads, etc.

loans.name: Paso A Paso Group

texts.en:
Paola is the president of the loan group "Paso a Paso" (Step-by-Step), which consists of 17 associates from the city of Talca.  In the photo, Paula is in the second row, second from left to right, and is wearing a red jacket. 

Paola sells women's clothing and accessories. The accessories she offers include purses, belts, handkerchiefs, scarves, necklaces and rings. Paula sells from her home and in the business establishments of some of her clients: a clinic, a municipality, an institute of social preservation, and three hair salons. 

With this loan Paola intends to purchase seasonal clothing so her inventory is up-to-date.  Paola travels two times a month to purchase merchandise in Santiago (capital of Chile).  She dreams of having a boutique, ideally in her house so she can look after her children. She has three daughters, two-year-old twins and a 14-year-old daughter.  Paola also works at a supermarket stocking shelves, but she is unable to maintain a fixed schedule for this work as the health of one of her twins requires regular visits to the clinic. 

Fondo Esperanza is an important contributor to Paola's business and family, because as an independent business owner she can manage her time in ways that allows her to better accommodate the daily needs of her family. Paula also values the support and encouragement she receives from the loan officer and her fellow group members. The businesses of the other group members include the production and sales of empanadas, fast-food, salads, chocolates, home décor (bed sheets, curtains, table cloths, etc.), sale of coal, underwear, jewellery, clothing, and a blend of crafted accessories. 
 
Talca is in the Maule region, in the central part of the country.  The majority of the population lives in the rural area, and is dedicated primarily to activities related to rural production. Talca is also known for its beautiful colonial architecture and artisan goods. The area's main attractions are the flora, the fauna, and the vineyards. Despite the fact that the workforce and production in Talca has increased, according to the recent census, this area is still, unfortunately, one of the poorest in Chile.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory for spring and summer

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia, de 38 años de edad, convive con su pareja y juntos tienen una hija, Ariana de cuatro años. Viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propia casa. Florencia se caracteriza por ser una persona creativa, ya que eso fue clave para que su tienda tome mucha presencia en su barrio, en donde expende variedad de productos y a un precio cómodo al alcance de la economía de sus clientes. Es por ello que se siente contenta por lo que hace, además cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja. Su punto de venta está localizado en su mismo barrio de su propia localidad, no obstante, en adelante ella piensa ampliar su tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de que pueda implementar con un nuevo formato de vanguardia, para que de esa manera pueda buscar diferencia ante sus demás competencia y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos económicos y su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura en cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además está contento con su banco comunal, debido al  buen clima cordial que predomina en su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería para que de esa manera pueda abastecer  su tienda con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Florencia is 38 years old and lives with her husband. Together they have a four year old daughter named Ariana. They have their own home in the town of Quimbiri which is located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. Florencia is known for being a creative person, which helped her establish a store that has developed a great presence in her neighborhood. There she sells a variety of products at affordable prices within the reach of her customers. She is very happy with what she does and also has the help of her husband. Her store is located in the same neighborhood where her house is located. However, she wants to move forward by expanding her grocery store so that she can implement a new layout that will separate her from the competition, help increase her revenues, and improve her quality of life.

This is her second loan with MFP. She is sure that she can faithfully complete her payments. Florencia is happy with her Communal Bank since her group promotes a friendly atmosphere. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise so that she can restock her store and fulfill the needs of her most demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de sus 4 hijos menores, con muchas ganas de salir adelante juntos  habitan en un populoso barrio ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Desde hace 1 año, luego de dedicarse a la comercialización de diferentes productos, decidió empezar a vender zapatos y zapatillas. Al principio no fue fácil, porque  sus clientes estaban acostumbrados en comprarle productos para el hogar, pero luego de comprar algunos calzados que ofrecía, percibieron que éstos eran de calidad. En la actualidad compra variedad de zapatos, ofreciéndoles a mayores precios con la modalidad de pago al crédito, por lo que le resulta rentable, permitiéndole solventar los gastos de su hogar sin problemas.  Afirma que le desagrada cuando sus clientes se demoran en cancelar, y esto atrasa la compra de  mayor cantidad de calzado, pero como es una mujer emprendedora, planea más adelante ampliar la mercadería de calzado que ofrece, pues desea instalar una pequeña tienda en algún mercado cerca del lugar donde vive. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete que pagara puntualmente sus cuotas en agradecimiento a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rocío tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de calzado y zapatillas, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes y espera cumplir con todos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rocio, 33, lives in her own home with her 4 minor children, and she has a strong desire to get ahead. They live together in a populated neighborhood located to the north of the city. A year ago, she decided to sell different products, specifically shoes and sneakers. At first it was not easy, because her customers were used to buying products from the home from her. But later they started buying the shoes that she offered, because they realized that they were of good quality. Now she buys a variety of shoes, offering her customers the best prices and the ability to buy on credit. As a result, the business is profitable and this allows her to cover her household expenses without a problem. She states that she does not like it when her customers are slow to repay her; this delays her ability to buy a greater quantity of shoes. But since she is a very enterprising woman, she plans in the future to expand the merchandise that she offers. She wants to set up a small store in some market close to the place where she lives. This is her second loan with MFP, and she pledges that she will make her payments on time. She appreciates of all of the people who made this loan possible that will allow her to continue to work and seek progress. Rocio plans to invest the loan requested in the purchase of a variety of shoes and sneakers, as she has a number of pending orders and she hopes to fill all of them and in this way improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply her business with shoes and sneakers

loans.name: Nelia's Group

texts.en:
Nelia P. is from the village of Pagbangkeruan, Alcala, Cagayan in the Philippines. She is 57 years old. Nelia is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nelia is 57 years old and married with 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nelia makes and sells fish balls and other dim sum fare. Nelia has been engaged in her business for more than 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support members of her immediate family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for food products

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mario; el tiene 51 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de panadería y también trabaja prestando servicio de taxi, el trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de panadería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar  materiales para preparar el pan como harina, azúcar, leche y manteca. 


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mario belongs to the SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY Community Bank which is located in the town of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name. He is 51 years old, married, and has three children. He has a bakery and also runs a taxi service. He works from 6 am to 7 pm.

Mario wants to improve his bakery business and plans to use the loan to buy ingredients for making bread such as flour, sugar, milk, and lard.

He is grateful to all those who contribute to his dreams by making donations, and he promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Deylin

texts.es:
El Sr. M. de 28 años de edad, vive con su mamá en el Barrio Pedre Miguel, reparto Mitch casa # 2 en el 3er anden; su nucleo familiar son 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años respectivamente y su esposa Yessi Romero quien se dedica a cuidar a los niños.

M.  es constructor empirico (maestro de obra), desde muy pequeñ le ha gustado el trabajo y se dedica a la contruccion de lavanderos, letrinas y Cruces de Cemento, Fogones, Adornos etc.  de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para dar el pan de cada dia a su Familia a la vez recibe otros ingresos por ser socio con su Hermano que tiene su negocio en Santo Tomas,  a traves de creditos ha logrado mejorar su casa, y salir adelante; por lo mismo esta solicitando nuevamente el apoyo de Kiva para continuar mejorando su vivienda, esta vez solicita credito para contruir un cuarto de 3mts x 4 mts de ancho.   

El  Mayor sueño es poder establecer su negocio con mejores condiciones y llegar a ser un gran empresario para brindarles mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr M. is 28 years old and lives with his mom in Pedre Miguel neighborhood.  His nuclear family consists of his two children aged 6 and 3 and his wife Yessi Romero who looks after the children.

M. is a master builder.  He has enjoyed the work since he was a small boy and he builds cement washtubs, latrines, crosses, hearths and ornaments, etc.  From this work he makes his monthly income so that he can put bread on the table for his family.  At the same time, he receives further income from being a partner of his brother who has a business in Santo Tomas.  Through loans he has managed to improve his house and move forward in life.  He is requesting a new Kiva loan so that he can continue improving his home.  The loan he is currently requesting is to build a 3 metre by 4 metre room.

M.'s biggest dream is to be able to improve his business and become a big businessman so that he can make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for fifteen years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces tea, maize, beans, vegetables, bananas and milk, which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. He also earns income from his business of selling dairy cows to the local market. His primary challenges have been diseases which are too costly to treat and the high cost of transport especially during the rainy seasons.

He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 25,000 KES and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He hopes that his farming business will do well and that he will be able to open a cereals shop for his wife to supplement the family's income. He also plans to purchase a piece of land with the proceeds from this loan.

Francis is 40 years old and married with two children, ages 7 and 13, who both attend school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
Con su primer credikiva Yaqueline a aumentado su capacidad de producción pues ahora cuenta con una caladora de mesa , 1 pirograbador  y un mototol, que aumentan sus posibilidades de responder mas oportunamente  a su clientela  y sobre todo con mayor calidad. Ahora se prepara para su nuevo credikiva con el cual comprára en mayor volumen sus insumos como  hilos, lanas,  piedras de bisuteria, para elaborar productos que le han  encargado y adicionar nuevos diseños de pedrerías aplicados a  bolsos y a telas, aprovechando que tiene una ayudante y porque además estará árticipando en la  ferias de las Colonias. Su sueño es dedicarse en el año 2011 a viajar exponiendo sus productos en sitios turisticos de la costa Caribe como la hermosa ciudad de Santa Marta y la historica Cartagena de Indias y los municipios d elos alrededores, buscando construir una clientela directamente. Agradece a asus financiadores de Kiva por su credito, porque le ha ayudado a fortalecer su microempresas y aun piensa ampliarla con su ayuda en financiamientos. 
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Yaqueline puede acceder al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/200671
texts.en:
With her first Kiva loan Yaqueline increased her production capacity: she now has a scroll saw, a pyrograph (wood etching machine) and a moto-tool with which she is able to increase her ability to respond to opportunities with her customers and do better quality work.  Now she requests a new Kiva loan which she will use to buy supplies in large volumes, such as: thread, yarn, and beads for costume jewelry.  She will use these supplies to make products for which she has orders, and to add new beaded designs that she and an assistant apply to purses and fabrics in advance of the "Ferias de las Colonias" (an event where a large number of handicrafts are sold).  Her dream is to devote herself in 2011 to travel, exhibiting her products in tourist areas on the Caribbean coast, such as the beautiful city of Santa Marta and the historic Cartagena de Indias, and surrounding municipalities, seeking to build a clientele directly.  She thanks the sponsors of Kiva for their support, because it has helped her to strengthen her small business, which she is still thinking about expanding with the help of loans.

If you want to know more about Yaqueline's history, you can access more information using the following link:

http://kiva.org/lend/200671

loans.use: to buy supplies such as thread, wool, and beads for costume jewelry to make products for which she has orders, and also make new beaded designs for purses and fabrics.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma G. is from the village of Sibula. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. Vilma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Vilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Noun P., 58, is married and lives with her husband in the Kompong Chhnang province. She grows rice and makes US$4 of profit a day, while her husband works as a soldier. Noun P. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase fertilizer, gas and rice seed.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, gas and rice seed.

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es: La señora Amelia tiene 20 años y vive en la zona M, ella convive y tiene una hija D. tres años, es nueva en el grupo “Señor D. Muruhuay” la cual está conformado D. 10 amigas vecinas que pusieron el nombre al grupo debido a la devoción que tienen por esta virgen. Amelia venD. miel desD. hace 4 meses para ayudar a mantener su hogar y ah logrado poner una pequeña tienda D. miel, con el ultimo prestamos desea invertir y expandir su negocio y junto a su pareja, que es chofer D. transporte público, poder sacar adelante su hogar y para esto necesita las habilitaciones D. Edaprospo así como trabajar arduamente.
texts.en:
Amelia is 20 years old and lives in M. neighborhood.  She lives with her partner and her 3 year-old daughter.  She is a new member of the “Señor D. Muruhuay” group.  This group has 10 members who are all friends and neighbors.  They gave their group this name because of the devotion that they have for this virgin.

Amelia has been selling honey for four months to help support her household and she has managed to set up a small store selling honey.  With this loan she would like to invest in her business and expand it and, together with her husband who is a public transport driver, get her household ahead.  To achieve this she needs loans from Edaprospo and to work hard.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey B., 22, is single and lives with his parent and his younger brother in the Battambang province. He is a moto-taxi driver, earning 6 USD of profit each day. His mom is a waitress in the local restaurant. On average, she is able to make 3 USD per day. Srey B. is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to replace an old and unreliable motorbike. (Srey B. is pictured with his mother behind.)

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more baby blankets, powder and soap

loans.name: Isu Lomama Group

texts.en:
Beyisile is 54 years old and married with two children, ages 11 and 32. She runs a small business in Stanger, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. In the photo above, she is wearing a white scarf around her head.

She's been in this business for five years and sells handcrafts and potatoes from her home and elsewhere. She also takes care of other two relatives. She says that the main challenge to her business is that the customers do not pay on time.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy handcraft materials and potatoes. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family life and her business. In five years time she would like to build a shelter for her business.

loans.use: Buy handcraft materials and potatoes

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: Maria Julia P., de cincuenta y nueve años de edad, reside y tiene una tienda en la zona costera del municipio y departamento de La Libertad en donde provee a sus vecinos y clientes que transitan, productos de primera necesidad como: huevos, granos básicos, pan dulce, carnes, arroz, bebidas, actividad que desarrolla durante el día. Adicionalmente esta incansable salvadoreña vende tamales de gallina todos los días y quesadillas los fines de semana, además de pupusas por encargo por la tarde en la zona del Puerto de La Libertad, lugar muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Maria Julia ahora esta solicitando un crédito para poder invertir en su tienda y comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para elaboración de sus deliciosas comidas: harina de arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, leche. Espera contar con este crédito dado que vive sola y no cuenta con ayuda de más nadie
texts.en: Maria Julia P. is 59 years old.  She lives in and owns a store in the coastal zone of the town and department of La Libertad.  She provides her neighbors and clients that pass by with basic goods such as eggs, basic grains, sweet breads, meat, rice, and beverages.  She dedicates herself to this business during the day.   In addition, this tireless Salvadorian sells chicken tamales every day and quesadillas every weekend, and she sells pupusas [a traditional Salvadorian dish made of corn tortillas] by order in the port, a zone frequently visited by foreign and national tourists.  Maria Julia is requesting this loan to be able to invest in her store and buy more ingredients to prepare her delicious foods: rice flour, corn, beans, sugar, and milk.  She hopes to receive this loan since she lives alone and does not receive support from anyone.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, milk, and disposable products

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado is a married man who lives in Banga, South Cotabato with his family. He has 4 children, the oldest of whom is 16 years old.

Conrado is a farmer. He has been growing rice for more than 10 years now and earns approximately PHP 5000 per month. Conrado works hard to provide for his family and sustain his children's education.

Conrado's loan will be used to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. is 36 years old, married and has six children who are between the ages of 22 years and 10 years old. 

Pamela has a business of selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for the past three years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more clothes to add to her stock. 

She is optimistic that her business will do well after she gets the money as she currently earns a profit of KES. 20,000, which goes to pay school fees for her children and catering to her family’s needs.

She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is currently in a business of selling charcoal. She is 35 years old, married, with two children, all of them go to school. Rita will borrow a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa P. tiene instalado un puesto de ropa en el mercado de Colon, departamento de La Libertad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en dicho mercado, Blanca es una mujer emprendedora que nunca dice no al trabajo siempre se encuentra activa y cuando recibe a los clientes que la visitan los espera con una gran sonrisa en el rostro y les ofrece el mejor servicio; porque el trabajo hecho con gusto y con amor trae los mejores beneficios. Blanca quiere aumentar su clientela y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa usada de todo estilo para que la gente se encuentre satisfecha. Blanca quiere lograr que su negocio prospere en un futuro para mantener siempre activa su fuente de trabajo y tener en su hogar una seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa P. has a clothing stall in the market of Colon, department of La Libertad. In the market she sells used clothing. Blanca is an enterprising woman who never says no to work. She is always active. She welcomes her customers with a big smile on her face and offers them the best service, because work done with joy and love brings the best benefits. 

Blanca wants to increase her customer base and that is why she is requesting INTEGRAL a loan that will enable her to buy used clothing of different styles to satisfy the demand from the people. Blanca wants her business to thrive in the future to keep her job source always active and maintain the financial security of her home.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: A. Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine est née le 22 Juillet 1965 à Zagnanado, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Mariée à un enseignant du nom de Honoré, Madeleine a neuf enfants à charge, dont quatre sont les leurs. Tous les enfants de Madeleine et de Honoré sont  scolarisés. Madeleine et son mari vivent ensemble avec les enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Ayant arrêté l’école au cours secondaire, Madeleine a appris ensuite la couture, une activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Madeleine vend divers fournitures de couture à son domicile. Madeleine s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Madeleine sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit ; crédit lui servira à mieux équiper son salon de couture par une nouvelle machine à coudre en vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Madeleine was born on July 22, 1965 in Zagnanado in the Ouémé Department. She is married to Honoré, a teacher. Madeleine and her husband have nine children in their care, of whom four are their own. All their children attend school. Madeleine and her husband live with the children. The parents provide together for the various family expenses. Madeleine left school at secondary level and then learnt dressmaking. This activity enables her to provide for her needs. At the same time, Madeleine sells various sewing supplies at her home. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Looking for a way to better satisfy her clientele, Madeleine applied for her second loan. The loan will enable her to better equip her sewing workshop by purchasing a new sewing machine to better meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 33 years old, is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, running a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Rosita has requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Karla Veronica

texts.es: La señora Karla tiene 38 años su actividad es una pulpería.  Este negocio surgió como su principal fuente de ingresos, ella es una persona muy responsable. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que han sido de buena ayuda.  Actualmente sigue adelante con este negocio pues es el único medio de vida que posee, pues tiene que cuidar a sus 2 hijos a cargo que son menores de edad. El financiamiento es para invertir en su negocio   y ofrecer una gran variedad como enlatados, cremas, golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos y sopas. Sueña con que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karla is 38 years old.  Her business is a grocery store which is her main source of income.  Karla is a very responsible person.  This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan.  They have been very helpful to her.

Karla currently continues getting ahead in her business as it is the only way she has of earning money and she has to look after her two young children who are dependent on her.  Karla will invest this loan in her business and offer her customers a wide variety of products such as canned goods, creams, candies, soft drinks, basic grains and soups.  She dreams of her children finishing their education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, creams, candies, soft drinks, basic grains and soups

loans.name: Emerma

texts.en:
Emerma is 41 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one school-age child.
Emerma works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to pay for the labor cost for fishing boat repair. Emerma has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Emerma hopes to purchase a brand new fishing boat.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for fishing boat repair

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old business lady. She is married to Samuel who is a primary school teacher. They are blessed with four children ages 14, 12, 4 and 3, respectively. She has been running a retail shop for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mary will use the loan to add a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal to the shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her shop. Her hope is to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add sugar, rice and maize flour to her shop

loans.name: Amador

texts.es: Amador tiene 41 años, convive con Antonia  de 35 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia, ubicada la comunidad de Sta. Rosa Alta del distrito ecológico de Sivia. Amador es un hombre de buenos principios, trabajador con un futuro estable, él trabaja con la finalidad de tener una  vejez tranquila y sin preocupaciones económicas. Él desde muy joven se dedicó a las labores agrícolas, en donde apoyaba a sus padres en las labores del campo, y ellos como herencia le dejaron una pequeña parcela de terreno, en donde ahora siembra y produce cacao. Desde entonces trabaja solo, en estas tierras, En un futuro desea adquirir un terreno donde pueda instalar un vivero para tener plantas de cacao, y donde pueda injertarlos, de esta manera espera incrementar sus plantaciones de cacao. Es por esta razón que macedonio recurre a MFP, para solicitar un crédito con la finalidad de realizar su anhelado deseo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, desea instalar un vivero donde pueda injertar cacao.
texts.en:
Amador is 41 years old and in a common-law relationship with Antonia, age 35. They have three children and live in their own home in the community of Santa Rosa Alta in the ecological District of Sivia. Amador is a man of good principles and a hard worker with a stable future. He works in order to have a peaceful retirement without any financial worries. For a very young age, Amador has engaged in farm work, helping his parents with the field labor. As part of his inheritance, he acquired a small parcel of land on which he now plants and grows cacao. Since acquiring his own land, Amador works alone. In the future, he hopes to acquire another piece of land so that he can build a nursery for growing and grafting cacao plants which he hopes will increase production. For this reason, Amador has returned to MFP to request a loan so that he can complete his desired wish.

This will be his second loan with MFP and he promises to submit his payments on time. The loan of 3000 PEN that he requested will be used to build a nursery for grafting cacao.

loans.use: to build a nursery for grafting cacao.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from the village of Zeda Simoneti, West Georgia. She is 48 years old, married and lives with her husband Mamuka, their 17-year-old daughter and 15-year-old son. Naira works as a cleaner in local school. Mamuka works in a stone workshop, as a laborer. The children go to school. Along with their jobs Naira and Mamuka head up the family agricultural business – they have two milk cows and one calf. Naira produces cheese and sells approximately 10 kg of cheese each Friday in Kutaisi (nearby town) open market. Also, the family has a vineyard with 700 grape vines. Mamuka produces wine and sells it in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris. 

Naira requested a loan to change the roof of the house. It is already old and needs to be changed, because it can’t keep out the rain and snow. Naira will use the materials from the old roof for covering the cattle-shed. 

The credit will help the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is the father of a two year-old child.  He has been doing rice farming for the past 9 years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Edwige Bernadette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 41 ans, divorcée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 28 et 32 ans. 
Étant mariée très  jeune en 2009, elle divorce avec son mari  et  pour  prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants qui sont a l’université, elle se lance dans le commerce des divers comme les filets d’oignons, tomate, du poisson fume , du poisson sale, de l' haricot. …
Ses ventes sont de 20.000frs à 50.000 frs par jour.
Avec le prêt obtenu elle va acheter des filets d’oignons, des cartons de poissons sales, des paniers de poissons sales, un sac haricot de 50kg, des cartons de tomate.

Très entreprenante, elle tient à aller loin avec son commerce, et a pour ambition de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
This 41-year-old borrower is a divorced mother of two children aged 28 and 32. Having married very young, she divorced her husband in 2009. 

To support her children’s college education, she started selling various food items such as onions, tomatoes, smoked fish, salted fish, and beans. Her sales average 20,000 to 50,000 francs per day.

She will use this loan to buy bags of onions, cartons of salted fish, baskets of smoked fish, a 50 kg bag of beans, and cartons of tomatoes.

A very enterprising woman, she has big plans for her business and hopes someday to become a wholesaler

loans.use: to buy bags of onions, cartons of salted fish, baskets of smoked fish, bags of beans, and cartons of tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.es: Urbano, está soltero y vive con sus padres actualmente. El lo que va comprar con el crédito es una novilla para engorde. El cuenta con el terreno apto a su poder para la explotación de este proyecto. El quiere comprar la novilla pequeña para engordarla y luego venderla en el mercado local y así generarle ganancias. Además el terreno que el utilizara esta sin uso por lo cual quiere invertir en la compra para utilizarlo racionalmente. El quiere obtener de este proyecto nuevo las mayores de las ganancias para su bienestar y la de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Urbano is single and currently lives with his parents.  He wants to use the loan to buy a calf to raise.  He has a plot of land which is appropriate for this type of project.  He will raise the calf and then sell it at the local market where he can make a good profit.  The land he has is not in use so the purchase would be aimed at using it rationally.  With this new project he wants to increase his income for the well-being of his family.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a loan through the state banks and FUDECOSUR is giving him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Mariela Armelis

texts.es:
Mariela de 43 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Isla trinitaria”. Una mujer muy trabajadora.
El negocio de ella es la venta de comida como: pescado frito, encebollado, tortilla.
Inicio está actividad desde que su esposo la abandono, además es empleada domésticas en una vivienda.
Tiene una hija de 16 años, estudia en colegio público.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, pintura, para la construcción de su  vivienda.
Su sueño es arreglar su vivienda y que  su negocio siga progresando con la ayuda de Dios.
texts.en: Mariela, 43, lives in a suburban zone called “Isla Trinitaria.”  She’s a very hardworking woman.  Her business is selling food like fried fish, “encebollado” [Ecuadoran seafood stew] and tortilla [green plantain dumpling].  She started this business when her husband abandoned her.  In addition, she works as a domestic employee at a residence.  She has a 16-year-old daughter going to public school.  She requests the loan to buy cement, sand and paint to build her house.  Her dream is to fix up her house and that her business continues making progress with God’s help.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, paint, etc.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say, 39, is a married woman who resides in Ornlong Veng, Siem Reap province. She earns a living by operating 2 businesses: farming and owning a general store. She has been engaged in these businesses since 2007. Normally she earns a profit of $4USD a day to cover the household expenses and support her children’s education. She has 3 children who are living under her care and income. 

Say intends to expand and fix her house this year. With a Kiva loan in the sum of 4,000,000 KHR, she’ll use it to buy housing materials and also spend on payment for a laborer harvesting their rice. In the future, she plans to save money to expand her selling business and insure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to buy housing materials and also spend on payment for a laborer harvesting their rice.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 56 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. She has a fish vending business from which she earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Emeliana has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to own a fishing boat.  She is a hardworking mother and she wants to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells clothes (bitenge) at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 7 years. She works six days a week. 

Monica has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy materials to make clothes. Her major business challenge is seasonality. Her aspiration is to buy plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik is engaged in an agricultural business. She keeps livestock and cultivates land. Hasmik would like to develop farming, for which she needs a sufficient financial investment. With the requested loan, Hasmik plans to purchase livestock. Expansion of the farm will help Hasmik get more income and renovate her house. House renovation means improved living conditions for Hasmik and her family. Hasmik lives together with her husband and two children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kimleav's Group

texts.en:
A 31-year-old married mother, Kimleav lives in a village within Ponhea Krek district. She has three dependent children, two of whom are in school while the third is too young to attend school. 

Kimleav has been raising pigs for six years, supplementing her income by planting cassava. With her current business, she earns more than 5 US dollars per day. Kimleav has been with VisionFund since 2010, and she leads of a group of five female members. She is requesting a loan of US$225 to buy piglets and feed for her pigs. With the loan, she hopes to produce more fat and healthy pigs in order to increase her income, provide a better living for her family, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed to increase her business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Flor De Viento Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE VIENTO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elena. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, servicios, venta de aceite y limpieza, 

La señora Elena,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una asesora de crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de aceite que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de aceite) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The community association "Wind Flower"  begins its first cycle with Pro Mujer through the regional office Santiago II.  It consists of eight members and is led by a committee headed by Mrs. Elena.  The members are involved in various businesses, including: trade, production, services, sale of olive oil and cleaning.

Mrs. Elena, indicates that it is their first time working with Pro Mujer and began with the institution at the invitation of a credit counselor. She has a business selling olive oil that has been functioning for some time.

The credit will allow her to raise capital (for the purchase of oil), which she will acquire in Ceja wholesale and subsequently market in fairs. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she lives in a civil union and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in credit and health.

loans.use: to purchase olive oil

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is 56 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. Her children are aged between 16 and 26.

Faustina sells seaweed to earn a living. She also supports her husband, who is a fisherman, in selling his catch at the market. Faustina works hard to improve their living. She requested this loan to buy more seaweed to sell. Faustina hopes to acquire an area where she can start seaweed farming.

loans.use: buy seaweed to sell

loans.name: Doleel Djiguéne 52 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Doleel Djigueene 52 regroupe cinq femmes  qui font parti d’une grande association de développement. Leur activité consiste  à faire du commerce de divers produits.
La présidente, madame Ndèye Marie , vend des chaussures, des habits prêt à porter, des bijoux, des parfums etc.…Elle a une expérience de plus de dix ans dans ce domaine. Elle est marié et appui son époux sur les dépenses du foyer : frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
Avec l’épargne qu’elle fait elle envisage d’ouvrir  dans l’avenir un magasin.
.
texts.en:
The Doleel Djigueene 52 loan group is composed of five women who belong to a large development association. They buy and sell various products.

The group's president, Ndèye Marie, sells shoes, ready-made clothing, jewellery, perfumes, etc....She has over ten years of experience in this line of work. She is married and helps her husband cover family expenses: paying for their children's education.

With the loan, she plans to open a store sometime in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes, ready-made clothing, jewellery, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Keanan

texts.en: Keanan, 28, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in the Kampong Chhnang province. Selling wood with her husband, she makes US$6 each day.Keanan is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike to transport wood. She sees this purchase a good investment to expand her business and she is confident it will increase her income.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike to transport wood

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has had five successive years in active farming in her rural home in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya. Her farm produce includes maize, bananas, beans, and wheat, which she sells to the local markets.

Alice has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow. 

She hopes she will be able to buy a motorcycle from her farming income to ease supplying of the farm produce to the local markets, as well as to earn additional income from transport services offered to fellow farmers for a fee. She also plans to educate her two children who are still schooling.

She says the main challenges are the unpredictable calamities like hailstorms and animal diseases. She is glad Juhudi Kilimo is making loans accessible to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Gertrude is married with three children and all attending school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a pub in a shop that she rents .  She has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda,spirits, and jerrycans of local gin. She generates additional income through selling piped water. She works seven days week . Her major business challenges includes defaulters. She would like to see her pub fully stocked with different brands of drinks. She resides in a family house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major challenges include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer, soda,spirits

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a buy and sell silver jewelries business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of silver jewelries to sell to her customers.

Wilma has been in this business for 12 years now.

Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of silver jewelries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tov

texts.en:
T. Tov is living in Phnom Penh, near to the railways, with her daughter and grandson. She is earning some money in sewing clothes at home on her own sewing machine. Her profit is around 12,000 Riel ($3) daily with one machine but she has another source of income. She has rooms for rent in a nearby building. She rent it to the factory workers and the beer girls working in the city. There are five rooms, each of them is rented for $15 monthly. This breeds an additional $75 to the family income.

T. Tov requested $700 to invest in both of her businesses. The first $300 will be spent for purchasing a new sewing machine and to have the other one repaired. This new machine will be used by her daughter.

T. Tov will use the remaining $400 to have her house with rooms for rent repaired. She perceives it has an important investment for her future.

She is very excited about receiving her loan. “When CREDIT will give out my loan, our income will rise”, she said. With her future loan she would like to develop her sewing business, buy more machines and hire employees.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine and repairing her house to rent rooms

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa and his brother Vafadar like this business. They are Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, Veyselli village, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region.
One day they decided to borrow a loan of $600 in order to buy new sort seedlings.
Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation, a local NGO based in Ghana, has been assisting women, especially in business, for quite a number of years now. Deborah N. (lady with the machine) is a client of this organization. She is a seamstress. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her improve upon her sales.

loans.use: working capital

texts.en: Mrs. N. lives in Nghe An, a rural province in northern central Vietnam. She is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a fisherman and works for a local cooperative. Her two daughters, 20 and 18, are both at university in Hanoi. For 3 years she has been a member of TYM. Before joining TYM she had a profit of $1.25 per day, but with the loans she was able to invest more in her shop and her profit nowadays is $6.25 per day. She wants to sell beer in her shop, but her storage room is open and too hot, so she will use the loan to erect a roof.

loans.use: She wants to sell beer, but her storage room is open and too hot, so she wants to erect a roof.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Thirty-three year old Abibatu C. is married with five children.  Through her business, she is able to contribute immensely towards her family's well being.  Her previous loan improved her business. She owns a stall of grocery items in the Magburaka town market.  She used the previous loan to purchase peanuts and also produces peanut butter.  Abibatu said, “with the loan, I am able to make a profit of $15 a week compared to $5 before the loan”.   To make more profits, Abibatu is requesting a loan of $200.

loans.use: Increase grocery stock at her market stall.

loans.name: Mema

texts.en: “Whatever talent you have is the gift from God” - That is Mema’s belief, mother of six and 45 years old. Mema’s business is sewing and she does it out of her own house at Malie. Most people come to her house and order whatever pattern and sizes they want. She is very good in sewing clothes especially Puletasi, aloha and kids wear.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, scissors and other supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Ilkhama

texts.ru:
