Mrs. Ilkhama M. lives in a village located near the city of Saatli, Azerbaijan. She is 40, married and has 3 children. Five years ago, Mrs. M. together with her husband (shown on the photo) purchased a small number of chickens, raised them and then sold them at the local market. The sale went well and brought a sizable profit. In addition, Ilkhama was able to sell and use the eggs that chickens produced. To finance expansion of her successful business, Ilkhama applied for a loan from NorMicro, a Kiva partner.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Г-жа Илхама живет в деревне, расположенной около города Саатлы Республики Азербайджан. Ей 40 лет, замужем, имеет троих детей. Пять лет тому назад она вместе со своим мужем (см. фото) купила небольшое количество цыплят, вырастила их и продала на местном базаре. Торговля пошла хорошо, прибыль была ощутимой. Кроме того, Илхама могла использивать для продажи и потребления яйца, которые несли куры. Успешный бизнес требовал расширения. С этой цели Илхама решила взять кредит и обратилась за помощью к Норвежскому Микрокредиту-партнеру КИВА.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is a 48 year old married mother of 4 children, 30, 28, 27, 26, who raises layers (chickens) and pigs. She wants the loan to purchase small pigs to rear.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Agnes H.. She is married with five children, their ages between 17 and 29. In 2005 Agnes established a livestock business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to expand her livestock to include poultry and the sale of eggs.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on Kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. "Who or what are kuku?" you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals or prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To expand her livestock business by purchasing chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Wati

texts.en: Wati Y. is 42 years old and her family's sole means of support because her husband is no longer able to work. Every day she gathers dry grass and sells it to an agent who resells it as animal food. Wati does not have a regular income and sometimes earns as little as $2 a day. She is a member of MBK and has applied for a loan of $150 to expand her business. She will repay the loan within one year.

loans.use: To expand a small business

loans.name: David A.

texts.en: David is a native of the Makeni town of Sierra Leone but married a woman from Kormasilai village. While visiting in-laws, he heard about the SMT loan program and became interested in settling in the village.  In other words, David moved to Kabala after he learned about the opportunities awaiting him there with respect to farming and the SMT program.  With the approval of the community as guarantor, he accessed a loan from SMT and started a vegetable farm.  David was very happy to have a good harvest and, as a result, he generated an income of Le. 900,000.  He then planted more vegetables near the swamp and will harvest them within a week.  David has completed his repayments and would like to expand his faming activities.  He is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 1,000,000 to purchase rice, peanuts and fertilizer, and to hire labourers.

loans.use: To expand his farm and care for his family by purchasing additional inputs and by hiring labourers.

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
Maria has been a teacher for 14 years and lives in the Angeles colony in the rural zone, 6km from Nueva Guinea. She’s currently studying to get her teaching degree. With the help of her farmer husband, she’s raising 3 children. Her dreams for her children are that they get a better education and that she is able to provide them with the best living conditions.

Every day Maria rides horseback for 2 hours, showing her enthusiasm for and dedication to teaching the peasant children.

She’s soliciting a loan to improve the conditions of her home, whitewashing walls and putting down a floor.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria se desempeña como docente desde hace 14 años, vive en la colonia los angeles zona rural a 6 km de Nueva Guinea, actualmente esta estudiando para obtener titulo de magisterio , con la ayuda de su marido que es agricultor estan criando a sus 3 hijos ,su deseo es que sus hijos tengan una mejor educacion y proporcionarle las mejores condiciones.

Todos los dias maria viaja a caballo a 2 horas de distancia demostrando su entusiasmo y dedicacion de enseñar a los niños campesinos.

Solicita el prestamo para mejorar las condicones en su vivienda repellando paredes y colocando piso.

loans.use: To improve her home by whitewashing walls and putting down a floor.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David S. is sixty-two years old. He is married and has four children who are currently in school. David earns money selling various kinds of chemicals like weed killers, fertilizers, pesticides, as well as spraying machines to the local farmers. Many local farmers buy his products during the currently ongoing farming season when many crops are being planted. Therefore, David wants to take out a loan to buy increased supplies of chemicals and spraying machines to better serve the needs of his customers. He also hopes to thereby increase his income and be able to send two of his children to university this year. David is a member of the community called Nananom (Elders) Trust Group, whose members provide a form of guarantee (social collateral) to one another to enable overall higher rates of loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase of weed killers, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr:
Mrs. Emilienne Kpeitcha lives in Tchonvi in the Oueme Department in Benin, where she was born around 1979. Married, with 6 children, she sells food products in the local market with her children. She is seeking a loan to reinforce her capital so that she can purchase fresh fish, condiments, and various groceries.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Dame K. Emilienne vit à Tchonvi, dans le département de l'OUEME au BENIN où elle est née vers 1979. Mariée et mère de 6 enfants, elle vend des produits vivriers dans le marché de ladite localité avec un de ses enfants. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son capital, pour l'achat de poissons frais, des condiments et divers produits vivriers.

loans.use: Purchase three bags of corn, three boxes of fresh fish, and 2 cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Mercedes G. P. is 26 years old, and a single mother of two. Her children are 7 and 8 years old, and are enrolled in fourth and fifth grade, respectively. Maria lives with her children and their father, and she depends on her business for income. Maria began selling shoes with help from her mother, who also works in retail and helped Maria get started. Maria has a small stall in the market in the bus terminal, where she sells footwear. She dreams of being able to help her children grow as professionals, expanding her business, and turning it into an exclusive footwear store. With a loan, Maria will be able to increase her inventory and use the resulting earnings to continue improving her home and helping her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Mercedes G. P., tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera, madre de dos hijos, con edades comprendidas entre los 7 y 8 años respectivamente, cursando uno de ellos el cuarto grado y el otro el quinto grado, estudiando en un colegio publico, el padre de sus hijos no vive con ella, depende totalmente de su negocio siendo este la venta de calzado en general, teniendo un pequeño tramo ubicado en le mercado la terminal de buses frente a distribuidora el Ahorro, atendido personalmente. Sus sueños, son poder ayudarle a sus hijos a desarrollarse como profesionales, ampliar su negocio y de ser posible poner una tienda exclusiva de calzado. Su negocio da inicio producto de la necesidad de empleo contando con el apoyo de su señora madre que le apoyo en el desarrollo de dicha idea de negocio ya que tambien era comerciante. Con el financiamiento pretende incrementar su inventario y con las ganacias poder ir mejorando su casa y por consiguiente apoyar a sus hijos lo mas que pueda.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: San Bartolome De Tambo Real Group

texts.es:
The communal bank was formed on December 20, 2002, in the Tambo Real community located in the Zurite district of the province of Anta.  It has been in operation for five years and currently 24 members belong to the bank - 19 women and five men.  The economic activities of the community in which the members participate are cattle raising, processing milk into yogurt and cheese, small animal sales and [the sale of] agricultural products.  The communal bank is named after the community’s patron saint whose anniversary is August 24th, the date when the bank will celebrate it’s fifth anniversary.  The history of the bank is linked to the origin of the community.  Mutual support known as “Ayni” (“today for you, tomorrow for me”), solidarity and respect are the community’s inherent values, whose practice is part of its ancestral customs.  A product of these values is the communal bank that has a history of good credit.  Currently it’s in its fourth cycle.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El banco comunal fue creado el 20 D. diciembre del 2002, en la comunidad D. Tambo Real, del distrito D. 					
 Zurite D. la provincia D. Anta.					
Tiene  5 años D. funcionamiento, actualmente son 24 socias					
pertenecen al banco comunal esta conformado por 19 mujeres y 5 varones					
Las actividades economicas D. la comunidad a las que se dedican las socias son:					
La crianza D. vacunos y la transformacion D. la leche en Yogurt y Queso, el comercio 					
animales menores y productos agricolas.					
El banco comunal, lleva el nombre del patrono D. la comunidad, cuyo aniversario					
es el dia 24 D. agosto. Fecha en el cual el banco comunal festejara su 5º aniversario					
La historia del banco comunal se enmarca en los principios D. la comunidad, el					
apoyo mutuo, conocido como "Ayni" hoy dia por ti mañana por mi, la solidaridad y el 					
respeto, valores inherentes a la comunidad, cuya practica es ancestral. Producto D.					
estos valores es un banco comunal, con una historia D. credito calificada como					
buena. Actualmente se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo

loans.use: Activities that include agriculture, livestock raising, production of yogurt and cheese, and trade

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 45-year-old Magreth K. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with two children, between the ages of 19 years and 27 years. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Magreth K. has been running a banana business since 1983. She buys bananas from farmers and take them to town where many people like to buy them. Her business is doing good. She works at the business for 4 hours per day, 6 days per week and she is assisted by one employee. Magreth K. currently earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock of bananas. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

Magreth thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of bananas.

loans.name: Indiana Mercedes

texts.es: Doña indiana B., es un joven emprendedora, que tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, esta joven empredora seria su segundo tramite con el programa Kiva, con el cual ha sido beneficiada, como valorarán doña indiana es propietaria de un negocio donde se oferta ropa, cosmeticos por encargo, teniendo cinco añoas de tener dicho negocio, en esta oportunidad doña indiana tuvo una pequeña mejoria en cuanto a incremento de su inventario inicial, ya que es su unica fuente de ingresoso fijo y con la cual pretende ir mjorando poco a poco su condiciones de vida al lado de su familia, ya que tambien ha hido fortaleciendo su pequeño negocio como es una pulperia, como podran valorar es una joven emprededora viendo y tomando cada uno de los retos de la vida, a fin de poder brindar un futuro digno a su familia. Esperando contar con el apoyo de todas aquellas personas que al igual que ella toman retos en la vida y cada uno de esos retos los traduce en negocios.
texts.en:
Indiana B. is an enterprising young woman of 29 years old. She is married with one son. This will be her second application through Kiva, with which she has benefited in the past. Indiana is the owner of a business where she offers clothes, and cosmetics to order. She has had this business for five years. With this opportunity Indiana will make a small improvement to her business by increasing her stock. Her business is the only fixed source of income for her family, and with it she hopes to continue improving her family's quality of life, little by little. She has been strengthening her small business, and it is obvious that she is hardworking person, overcoming the challenges of her life in order to provide a decent future for her family. We hope we can count on the support of those people who, like her, take on challenges in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for increasing stock

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia tiene 39 años es madre soltera de una hija de 13 años llamada Anacecilia. Las ganas de progresar de Felicia han hecho que ella incursione en el negocio de la venta de Ropa para mantener a su hija la cual es el motor que impulsa su vida. A Felicia le gusta trabajar en la venta de ropa ya que es un trabajo que no requiere mucho esfuerzo y le da la libertad de apoyar a su hija con sus estudios, además la venta es buena y cada vez va mejorando. Felicia vende mantas, pantalones, poleras, etc las cuales son vendidas muy rápido por la calidad y los bonitos diseños, haciendo que su negocio crezca cada vez mas y dando a Felicia las esperanzas de progreso y un futuro mejor. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero con que apoyes a Felicia comprara mas cantidad de mantas que es lo que se vende mejor.
texts.en:
Felicia is 39 years old, and the single mother of one 13-year old daughter named Anacecilia. Her desire to get ahead led her to start a business selling clothing in order to support her daughter who is the sole motivation in her life. Felicia likes to work selling clothing since it is work that doesn’t require much effort, and gives her the freedom to help her daughter with her studies. In addition, sales are good and continue to improve. Felicia sells blankets, pants, t-shirts, etc., that sell quickly because of their quality and lovely designs. This makes her business grow each day and gives Felicia hope for progress and a brighter future. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds with which you support Felicia, she will buy more blankets as these are what sell best.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of blankets to sell.

loans.name: I Nengah Widana

texts.id:
I Nengah Widana sudah menyelesaikan pinjaman tahap pertama. Pinjaman itu dipergunakan untuk membeli pupuk dan bibit jaging kwalitas unggul. Sekarang kebun jagungnya sudah selesai dipanen. Tanah seluas 1 hektar yang dimilikinya, semuanya ditanami dengan jagung. Dalam satu tahun, I Nengah Widana bisa memanen jagungnya sebanyak tiga kali. Sekali panen I Nengah Widana mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 2.000.000.- setelah dikurangi seluruh biaya yang diperlukan untuk pengolahannya. Jadi selama 1 tahun I Nengah Widana mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 6.000.000.- Semua keuntungan tersebut dipergunakan untuk biaya kehidupan setiap hari, menabung, memperbaiki rumah dan membayar pinjaman yang dimilikinya. I nengah Widana merasa sangat mersyukur dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya karena penghasilannya bisa meningkat sehingga ia bisa meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya.
Saat ini musim hujan sudah tiba dan I Nengah Widana berencana untuk mendapatkan pinjaman kembali dengan jumlah yang lebih banyak karena ia berencana untuk menyewa lahan untuk ditanami jagung sehingga keuntungannya bisa meningkat.
texts.en:
I Nengah Widana had already repaid the loan of the first phase. That loan was used to purchase fertilizer and corn seedlings of superior quality. Currently his cornfield has just been harvested. The 1-hectare plot of land he owned is entirely cultivated with corn. Within a year, I Nengah Widana is able to harvest 3 crops of corn. Each harvest I Nengah Widana generate income of Rp. 2.000.000.- (about USD200) after deducting all payments needed for cultivation of the crop. Therefore in a year I Nengah Widana generated income of Rp. 6.000.000.- (about USD600). The entire mentioned income is used to pay daily living expenses, savings, for home improvement and repay loan he possess. I Nengah Widana is very thankful with the loan he received as his perquisite continued to increase until his family’s welfare improved. At the moment is the rainy season thus I Nengah Widana planned to procure another larger loan as he planned to lease land to cultivate corn thus increasing his income.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lease land, fertilizer and superior quality corn seedlings (Menyewa lahan, pupuk dan bibit jagung kwalitas unggul)

loans.name: Georgina Luz

texts.es:
Georgina   es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. 
Georgina es casada, tiene  41 años y dos hijos  de 13 y 1 año,  el mayor está en la escuela.
Georgina  tiene su negocio de venta de productos de belleza Unique ofrece a sus amigos y familiares, ahora también va a comenzar en el negocio de la venta de productos de limpieza asociada con su hermano, ya cuenta con varios  pedidos.
Desde  hace cinco años recibe los préstamos que le han  ayudado a invertir más para su stock de productos de belleza.
Georgina necesita  un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos de limpieza (lejías, detergentes, ambientadores, etc.)
Georgina sueña con  una  tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the El Tiunfo Communal Bank. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children who are 13 and 1 years old. Her eldest child is in school. Georgina sells beauty products for a living, but would also like to start another business, selling cleaning products with her brother. They have already had some orders placed by friends and neighbours, so they are confident of business. Georgina has been receiving loans as a member of the Bank for 5 years now. She needs this next loan, of 1600 soles, so that she can buy cleaning products (bleach, detergents, air fresheners etc). Georgina dreams of owning her own store one day.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bleach, detergents, air freshner, etc.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Kun S., 42, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She works running a grocery store, making about US$ 5 in revenue every day. Her husband is a professional painter. On average, he makes US$ 6 per day. This couple has four children, one of whom is in school. The oldest daughter works selling souvenirs in front of Angkor Temple.  Mrs. Kun S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to expand her grocery store by adding more goods to meet her high customer demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem P., 45, is a true entrepreneur who has a business making wooden boats. He employs other craftsmen in the building of his boats. This business provides him a profit of US$5 per day. His wife makes and sells fermented fish at the market and earns approximately US$5 per day as well. The couple has four children and all of them are students. Mr. Chem P. would like to take out a loan to purchase more wood for his boat-making business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for the boat-making business

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Besides being an entrepreneur, Emelia A., 31, takes care of her four kids. Currently, all the kids are at primary school level. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and her children in their own house at Kwahu Da, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. She also runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for four years now.

Emelia is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall in the community. Her grocery products sell very quickly after she purchases them. Also, she will be adding soft drinks to her store to diversify her trading.

Emelia is a member of the community group called ‘Anigyee’ (meaning Happiness). Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Fredis  Omar

texts.es:
Fredis A. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de Estelí y cuya labor es la crianza de ganado al cual se dedica con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en su municipio.

La actividad de la crianza de Ganado del señor Fredis abarca el cuido y mantenimiento de la vaquillas por lo que procura con mucho esfuerzo extraer la leche para posteriormente venderla en su local. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para invertir en la retención de vaquillas y así continuar mejorando su situación y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fredis A. is a gentleman from Estelí city. He works very hard and with dedication raising cattle in his municipality. For Fredis raising cattle encompasses the care and maintenance of the heifers. It takes him great effort to milk the cows, and later sell the milk in his locale. He is hoping to receive a loan from Ceprodel to be able to keep the heifers and continue improving his situation and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To keep heifers

loans.name: Maryam

texts.ru: Марьям - 51 год. Она разведена и живет и двумя детьми и невесткой. Старший сын женат и имеет сына. Дочь еще не вышла замуж. Марьям занимается продажей канцтоваров и косметики на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда, магазин № 234. Она кредитуется у нас уже 2 года. В начале ее бизнеса она продавала только канцтовары. Теперь ее бизнес расширился: теперь она продает и косметику. Канцтовары ей поставляет фирма, а косметику она заказывает у косметических дистрибьюторов. За последний займ она планирует  заказать партию косметики от компании Avon.
texts.en:
Maryam is 51 years old. She is divorced and lives with her two children and her daughter-in-law. Her older child, a son, is married with a son of his own, while her daughter has still yet to marry. Maryam's business is selling school and office supplies and cosmetics at the "Panshanbe" market in Khujand, where she occupies store number 234. Maryam has been an MLF client for two years. Initially, she only sold school and office supplies but has since expanded into cosmetics as well. A company furnishes her store with the school and office supplies, but she has to order her stock in cosmetics from distributors. With this loan, Maryam plans to purchase inventory from Avon.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy S. manages a small parcel of rice farm. She is 37 years old and has 7 children. She wants to develop her business more, and also dreams of buying additional lots to better support the needs of their family. Her husband, William S. is also a farmer, and they have been together for 17 years already. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. The loan will really help her increase her yield. Fertilizers are vital components to improve the soil conditions of the farm, and as a result of using fertilizer, she believes she can achieve the maximum yield of her rice. 

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. It provides its clients not just with loans but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Nighat Abdul Aziz Group

texts.en:
Anwari baji and Ameeran baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling businesses.

Nasreen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) for preparing dresses to display in a boutique.

Nighat baji is the wife of A. A. who has lived in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 14 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines.

Nighat baji runs a boutique in the community. She prepares embroidered dresses and displays them in her boutique. People like her collection a lot. She has been running the boutique for the past three years.

She is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) for preparing embroidered dresses to display in her boutique.

loans.use: To buy material for making embroidered dresses

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen M. is a 68-year-old single woman who lives with 53-year-old Susan Sanchez. Susan is Carmen's business partner and they sell cooked food, rice, and other common commodities for the convenience of their neighbors. They chose this kind of business considering the large distance of their residence from the main municipality.

The business has been run since she received her first loan from ASHI amounting to Php 5,000. Now, Carmen wishes to apply for a loan from ASHI amounting to Php 7,000 to be used in the same kind of business. Given a chance to receive the bigger loan, the volume of commodities she will sell will be increased and she can help many people from their village have access to commodities with less effort and time consumed.

Despite her age, Carmen wants to maximize her remaining strength and capacity in her business so as to have savings. In this way, she can obtain the security of tenure she wishes for herself when she grows very old. As a single, old woman, she believes that there will be nobody to take care of her nor shelter her when she becomes very old unless she has money. 

Carmen, though, is very positive that she will be able to manage her business well and have it grow.

loans.use: To buy rice, gasoline and vinegar to sell

loans.name: Saumalama

texts.en:
Saumalama T., 38, is married with six children. She has two years of experience in her taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village five days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala. She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Saumalama’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She plans to use her loan to buy tools for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weedkiller and needed chemicals, knives, a sharpenner and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: The smiling face in the accompanying photograph is Mrs. Chhun Y., who is 51 years old. She currently owns a farm that she bought four years ago where she plants different kinds of crops. She is a single mother blessed with five children. Most of her children work in various occupations and they also provide their income to be responsible for their familing. Because Chhun Y.’s farm is far from a watering system, she has decided to seek a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally L. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayn de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Sally is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sally joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sally is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Sally from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Seat

texts.en: Seat H. is 37-year-old and a resident of Siem Reap Province, where he has established a small family home with others family members. He is a fisherman who depends on fish in and around Tunle Sap River on which he normally generates an income of $2 or $3 a day. His wife’s name is Chann Sam, 38, who is a wine distiller and pig raiser, who appears in the picture over. This couple has given birth to two teenage children who are not so long in school and work in construction. Seat H. will be used his loan to buy fertilizer for growing a rice crop during this farming season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for growing a rice crop

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
La señora Mary, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Decididas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 33 años y es madre de 05 hijos, los 05 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Tiene años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00,  comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.
Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Mary nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mary belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Decididas”, located in the district of Tarapoto, San Martin, in the San Martin state. She is married and 33 years old. She is mother of 5 children, all of them students who still depend upon her.

For years she has been dedicated to providing city transportation services using her “motokar”. Her husband is in charge of taking it to different parts of the city. Her activity has started with a first loan from Manuela Ramos. She gradually saved money that she used to buy spare parts in order to improve the services she provides to her community.

With this 1,400.00 new soles loan she will buy spare parts and oils such as: lubricants, wheel hubs and spark plugs. This way, she’ll be able to provide her clients a better service. Nowadays, Mary is an independent woman. Her husband and her decide and manage their business. Mary tells us that belonging to the women group helped her know better her rights and that together, they can make their rights be respected.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts and lubricants

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: A. Elisabeth est mariée à GANKPIN Martin, un chauffeur. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés qui sont les tiens. La famille réside à Kadjacomè dans la commune de Sèmè Kpodji. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Elisabeth vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Elisabeth est dans le secteur de la restauration. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Elisabeth achète ses provisions. Elisabeth a déjà quatre ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Elisabeth a eu trois crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Elisabeth demande un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de farine de manioc, riz, haricot, maïs, bidons d’huile, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is indulged in managing her own variety store located just in front of their house. She is requesting to avail a loan of PHP5,000 to have additional capital to maintain and further improve her store business. She wants to buy more stocks of products for her store. She hopes to avail her request for her business to become more productive. Her income from the business is being used to sustain the daily needs of her children and she hopes that through the loan they will all be benefited.
	Lilia, 35 years old, is already married and has three school-aged children. As a mother, Lilia never loses hopes in trying to reach success. She knows that she needs to be strong and patient in dealing with her responsibilities. She wanted to provide sufficient needs of her family especially their children because their future depends on them as parents.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more stocks of products for her store

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Elena O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en la cual vende una variedad de prodcutos, en estos momentos no tiene muy surtido su negocio y por tal razon necesita el credito, desea comprar mercaderia al por mayor, Maria es una persona luchadora y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante, quiere que su negocio crezca y asi poder tener otra calidad de vida.
su meta o sueño es poder tener un negocio grande en el cual pueda dar empleo  a varias personas, ya que en este pais uno de los problemas es el desempleo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena O. sells consumer goods. She has a store in which she sells a variety of products but right now she doesn't have much inventory and needs the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. Maria is a fighter and really wants to get ahead. She wants her business to grow so that she can improve her quality of life. Her dream is to have a large business that will employ other people since in her country one of the problems is unemployment.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, snacks, rice, beans and other grocery items

loans.name: Susana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Susana D. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración y venta de helados y refrescos de diferentes sabores siendo comercializados en su propia casa de habitación donde sus clientes le visitan para comprar dichos helados y refrescos porque los prepara muy sabrosos.

Actualmente ella atraviesa dificultades porque no posee la materia prima para elaborar los helados y refrescos y por esta razón solicita el crédito para comprar la materia prima como lo es las frutas, el azúcar, las bolsas plásticas para continuar con la producción y venta de los deliciosos helados y ya no más tener vacía la refrigeradora sino mantenerla muy llena de estos productos.
texts.en:
Susana D. makes and sells frozen treats of various flavors from her own home where her customers visit her to buy these treats because they are very delicious. She lives in the El Viejo municipality in the Chinandega department. She is currently going through some difficult times because she doesn't have the raw materials to make her products so she is asking for financing to buy items such as fruit, sugar and plastic bags to continue producing and selling her tasty frozen treats and no longer have her refrigerator empty but, rather, keep it full of these products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her frozen treats.

loans.name: Constantina Maria

texts.es:
La señora Constantina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” desde hace 2 años vive en el  distrito y provincia de Azangaro, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y madre de 02 hijos. Ella curso el quinto grado de primaria, actualmente se dedica al acopio de leche y al mismo tiempo elabora y vende quesos.

Ella cuenta que el primer préstamo que solicitó fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con el cual pudo incrementar su capital para poder seguir con su negocio y así poder ofrecer de mejor manera sus productos

Ella requiere un crédito de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con el que  aumentará su capital  para comprar una moldeadora de quesos y  así poder ofrecer sus productos a mas clientes.

Su sueño para el futuro es ser distribuidora mayorista y mejorar su planta quesera para poder llegar a más lugares.
Lo que  más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias y las capacitaciones que recibe.
texts.en:
Constantina, 46, is married and the mother of two children. She finished fifth grade and she is a milk consolidator and cheese maker and seller. She lives in the district and province of Azangaro and has been a member of the "Punta Sahuacasi" communal bank for the past two years. She tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to increase her working capital so that she could go on with her business and offer her products more efficiently. She now needs 700 new soles to buy a cheese moulder so that she can offer her products to more customers. Her dream for the future is to be a wholesale distributor and to improve her cheese factory so that she can reach more places. What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality of the members and the training she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cheese moulder and milk.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: G. Célestine est née en 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Célestine est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Célestine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Cotonou, depuis près de 12 ans. Célestine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Célestine a arrêté les études au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Célestine vend divers produits (conserves, pâtes alimentaires, huile de palme, plateaux d'oeufs frais, savons, mèches, etc.). C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Célestine s'approvisionne. Célestine a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Célestine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Célestine G. was born in 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Célestine is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Célestine has lived together with her children and husband in Cotonou for 12 years. Célestine helps her husband provide for the family. Célestine ended her studies at the secondary level. For ten years, Célestine has sold various products (canned goods, pasta, palm oil, trays of fresh eggs, soaps, hair extensions, etc.). It is at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, that Célestine gets her supplies. Célestine has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), both of which were repaid properly. Célestine is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ, in order to increase the stocks of her goods and to better satisfy the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned goods, hair extensions, trays of eggs, and cans of palm oil

loans.name: Vaen

texts.en:
Mrs. Vaen N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mrs. Vaen N. is 51 years old and the mother of nine children: four are construction workers, two others are vendors and the rest are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Muk Mun, is a palm juice collector. She is a villager in Ping Pong village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Vaen N. faces an obstacle with her plantation because she does not have enough moN. to buy farming supplies. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for plowing the rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for plowing the rice field

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Diamantes” esta representado por L. señora Dilian y conformada por 11 miembros  de socios que en general se conocen de tiempo ya que residen en el mismo barrio. Una gran mayoría de las socias se dedican a L. actividad comercial como por ejemplo L. presidenta se dedica a L. venta de abarrotes, otras se dedican a L. venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de pan, venta de zapatos, leche y yogur. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias afirman que el nivel competitivo es alto pero que saben como salir adelante ya que tienen experiencia en su rubro y saben como salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de su familia. El crédito será destinado a L. ampliación de sus negocios con al adquisición de mercadería insumos y herramientas que faciliten su trabajo. En cuanto a L. experiencia crediticia de los miembros del grupo una  gran parte  ya trabajo bajo L. modalidad de créditos individuales y solidarios por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento sobre el manejo de los fondos otorgados, saben invertir en sus negocios y cumplir con sus obligaciones de forma que puedan obtener una ganancia que les ayude a mejorar L. calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Diamantes” (Diamonds) Group is led by Sra. Dilian and consists of eleven members who know each other because they live in the same neighborhood. A majority of the members are engaged in commercial businesses. For example, the group president sells groceries. Others sell food, clothing, cosmetics, bread, shoes, milk, and yogurt. Regarding the competitive environment, the members argue that the level of competition is high but they know how to deal with it because they have expertise in their specific fields and know their families’ livelihoods depend on them.

This loan will be used to expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to facilitate their work. As for their previous credit experience, the members have participated in both individual and solidarity group loans, so they have extensive knowledge of how to manage their funds, invest in their businesses, and complete their obligations. They hope this opportunity will guarantee a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operatng capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina S. Gutiérrez tiene 55 años y vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio de la Ciudad de Barranquilla. Se dedica a la mercancía en general y tiene tres hijos de 30, 28 y 19 años. Es un cliente desde hace 20 años en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y ha recibido 29 créditos durante este tiempo que han cambiado mucho su nivel de vida, incluso varios con fines educativos para sus hijos. Y éste que ahora solicita es para cancelar el 5º semestre de su hija menor.
Su niñez transcurrió al lado de sus padres y sus doce hermanos en el barrio Nueva Esperanza; desde los 12 años trabajando en la venta de vestidos de niños y otras mercancías, pagaba las mensualidades de su escuela y ayudaba al sustento de su familia, con las utilidades que de ello obtenía; golpeada por calamidades domésticas  tuvo que abandonar los estudios de bachiller a mitad del camino e iniciar su trabajo en un almacén como empleada,  donde gradualmente ganó la confianza de sus jefes y sin ninguna preparación llegó a ser la administradora de este negocio, del cual se  retiró 10 años después. Con el producto de su liquidación compró la vivienda en la que aun habita al lado de sus tres hijos, que son su razón de ser y quienes la impulsan a trabajar y esforzarse diariamente para sacarlos adelante.
Luz Marina, con el lema, “nunca miro hacia atrás, siempre adelante”, es una mujer luchadora que en condición de separada desde hace 17 años, tiene como carta de presentación un trabajo independiente, honesto y responsable con el cual ha logrado darle a sus tres hijos estudios profesionales; ella ha sido apoyada con créditos educativos para su familia, que sólo reciben los buenos clientes de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, entidad que también le ha otorgado financiamiento para fortalecer su negocio de venta de mercancías al detalle, las cuales distribuye en toda Barranquilla. 
Manifiesta que su negocio de venta de calzado, ropa, electrodomésticos, prendas de oro y plata, variedades y papelería tiene 30 años de estar funcionando y su buen funcionamiento es producto de la experiencia adquirida en un almacén como empleada y del ingreso al programa de créditos de la Fundación, que le ha prestado dinero para aumentar su capital de trabajo, lo cual le ha representado prosperidad y le ha permitido cumplir muchos de sus proyectos y metas, uno de los cuales es ver a su última hija realizada como profesional para lo cual aplica a un crédito por valor de $1.575.532y el otro es tener un local propio en el centro de la ciudad  pues toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio de mercancías variadas y quiere seguir creciendo.
Con la experiencia de sus años de negociante dice que “Todo no es ganancia”. Sus clientes compran sus mercancías a crédito y en ciertos momentos ha habido clientes con los que le ha tocado perder, y por eso toma en cuenta las referencias y quiere que sus clientes sean empleados. Sueña con que su hija termine la universidad y es su meta de tener un local en el centro de Barranquilla.
texts.en:
Luz Marina S. G. is 55 years old. She lives in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood in the city of Baranquilla. She works in general merchandise and she has three children: 30, 28 and 19 years old. She has been a client of the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for 20 years and she has received 29 credits during that time. They have really changed her lifestyle, including the education goals of her children. This one that she is asking for now is to pay for her younger daughter's 5th semester. She grew up with her parents and her twelve siblings in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood. Since she was twelve, she has been working selling childrens' dresses and other merchandise. She would pay her monthly tuition and help support her family with the profits she obtained. Suffering from domestic trauma, she had to leave her high school studies halfway through and begin to work as a store employee. Gradually, she gained the confidence of her bosses and without any schooling in it became the manager of this business. She left this ten years later. With her severance package she bought the home she still lives in with her three children. They are her reason for being and it is they who drive her to work and make an effort every day to get them ahead. Luz Marina, with the motto "I never look back, only ahead", is a fighter who has been separated for the last 17 years. Her business card is an independent, honest and responsible job with which she has been able to give her three children professional educations. She has been supported with education loans for her family. These are only given to good clients at the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. This organization has given her financing to strengthen her business of merchandise sales, which she distributes throughout Baranquilla. She states that her business is the sale of shoes, clothing, appliances, gold and silver jewelry, miscelaneous and paper products. It has been going for 30 years and its smooth operation is the product of her experience acquired as a store employee and from entering the loan program at the Fundacion, which has lent her money to increase her working capital. This has meant prosperity for her and has allowed her to finish many of her projects and goals. One of these is to watch her youngest daughter become a professional. This is why she is aplying for a loan in the amount of $1.575.532. Another goal is to have her own locale in the center of town. All of her life she has been in the business of various merchandise and she wants to continue growing. With her years of experience as a business person, she says that "It's not all profit." Her clients buy her merchandise on credit and at times she has had to lose with some clients. This is why she takes references into account and she wants her clients to be employed. Her dream is for her daughter to finish college and her goal is to have a locale in downtown Baranquilla.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Her daughter's college education

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is a rice farmer from Banga, South Cotabato. She is 51 years old with six children, her eldest being 27 years old.

Merilyn started managing a rice field back in 1980 and now it reaches to 6 hectares (15 acres). She also has a piggery business. The profit from her farm is the source of income that her family depends on.

Now, Merilyn would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to expand her farm and supply the necessary materials needed for her rice field and piggery.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Maluku Cell A Lidya Mutonyi Group

texts.en:
Lidya M. is a hardworking businesswoman, thirty-two years old, who is married and blessed with three children schooling. She has three dependents schooling, too.

Lidya has owned a beauty salon business for over ten years now. She is using the loan to purchase beauty salon items such as hair chemicals, hair combs, hair shampoos, hair relaxers, and so forth for her work to attract more customers.

Lidya is injecting more capital into her business. Her future hope is to at least construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty salon items

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: G. Séraphine est née le 03 Juin 1952 et vit depuis 23 ans à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AHOUASSA Rodolph, Séraphine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont présentement à sa charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Séraphine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis 35 ans, Séraphine mène comme activité, la vente de céréales (haricot, riz, maïs, etc.) dans sa boutique size à Agla. De façon secondaire, Séraphine vend également du charbon de bois. L'activité de Séraphine lui procure des revenus qu'elle utilise pour assurer ses différents besoins et ceux de sa famille. Séraphine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Séraphine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé et les a tous bien remboursés. Séraphine sollicite un troisième prêt afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de se faire plus de profit après la vente de ses produits. Dans l'avenir, Séraphine ambitionne acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Séraphine G. was born on 3 June 1952 and has lived for 23 years in Agla, an area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Rodolph Ahouassa, Séraphine is the mother of three children, all in school, of whom two are currently in her care. The couple provide for the family together. Séraphine never attended school. For 35 years, she has run a business selling cereals (beans, rice, maize, etc.) at her store located in Agla. As a secondary activity, Séraphine also sells charcoal. Her business provides her with an income that she uses to meet her various needs and those of her family. Séraphine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has already benefited from two loans with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), both of which she repaid properly. She is seeking a third loan in order to increase the stocks of her products and to make a higher profit after selling her goods. In the future, Séraphine dreams of acquiring a plot of land.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals (beans, rice, maize) and charcoal

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
En 2003, cette femme s’est lancée dans le commerce  de pagnes, elle exerce ce commerce près du marché local du port autonome de Lomé vu qu’il existe peu de revendeuse de pagnes dans ce marché, ainsi elle arrive à réaliser de grosses recettes. Elle veut augmenter son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle, elle sollicite auprès de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de 12 pagnes hitarget et de 10 pagnes phoénix.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2003 this lady began trading "pagnes" (West African colourful fabric), and she carries out this business near the local market in the independent port of Lomé. Since there are very few retailers of "pagnes" in this market, she manages to procure a significant income. She would like to increase her stock of goods and for this reason she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 12 Hitarget "pagnes" and 10 Phoenix "pagnes". She is married and mother to three children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary rose MonteA. has been an ASHI member since 2007. Her family is very thankful that she has an opportunity to improve their standard of living through the proceeds of her variety store business that she has established with the support of the loans she has requested from ASHI. Her husband’s support of her business is Mary rose’s encouragement to keep going through the challenges of being poor but growing her business despite that.

Over time, Mary rose has been able to purchase inventory for her store. The variety store business has brought happiness to Mary rose’s family, especially to her. Because of its profits, she has been able to send her children to school. Being a good mother, she always wanted to support her children to have a brighter future. 

With that in mind, Mary rose is requesting a loan from ASHI to purchase more supplies for her store in order to attract more customers. This would not only provide her with happiness in life, but would also make her business grow and make more profit, which will allow her to support the educational needs of her four children until they graduate from college. She also hopes to build a comfortable home to live in.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her store.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, localidad muy hermosa por sus calles, sus iglesias, sus ríos, su gastronomía, sus artesanos y sus escritores,  atractivos propios de la ciudad,  Es socia  hace ocho  años del banco comunal El Crédito gracias a la invitación de su cuñada, con los créditos recibidos  ha cubierto algunas necesidades de la casa y el negocio ya que ella se dedica a la venta de juguetes a la entrada de las escuelas, lleva 17 años en ésta labor. Con el  nuevo crédito que reciba comprará carros, pelotas, canicas, yoyos, baleros, etc., y también lápices y borradores para tener un stock surtido para ofrecer a los niños
 
Ana María  tiene 45 años, casada y madre de tres hijos que se encuentran de 27, 23, 17 años,  el primero de ellos es soltero pero vive independiente, su  segundo hijo estudia en la universidad de la ciudad y su último hijo no le gusto estudiar por lo que se dedica a trabajar, su esposo realiza transporte escolar, tienen su casa propia en otro canton  de la ciudad de Cuenca por lo que viven arrendando.
texts.en:
Ana María lives in the city of Cuenca, a city known for its very beautiful streets, churches, rivers, food, handicrafts writers, and other attractions. She has been a member of the communal bank " El Crédito" for 8 years, thanks to the invitation of her sister-in-law. With the loans she has received, she has covered some necessary household expenditures and invested in her business selling games at the entrance of schools. She has been doing this work for 17 years. With this new loan she will buy toy cars, balls, marbles, yo-yos, cup-and-ball games, and other toys. In addition, she will buy pencils and erasers to have an inventory to offer the children. Ana María is 45 years old, married, and is the mother of three children who are now 27, 23 and 17 years old. The eldest is single, but lives independently. Her second son studies at the university in the city, and her youngest does not like to study and so he works. Her husband works as a school bus driver. They live in a canton of the city of Cuenca where they live in a rented home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy toy cars, balls, marbles, yo-yos, cup-and-ball games, and also pencils and erasers

loans.name: Estrella Margarita

texts.es:
Del banco  comunal Alfa es socia la señora Margarita está pasando por momentos bastante crítico ha sufrido la pedida de dos seres queridos para ella, hace un mes perdió a su hijo y su mamá, está muy triste pero a pesar de todo lo que está pasando nuestra socia tiene que seguir luchando por sus otros hijos.

La actividad que realiza la señora Margarita es el comercio de ropa de prendas intimas, ya son 3 años en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien, está casada, su esposo es técnico en refrigeración, ella sale a vender  su mercadería por el sector y cuando el esposo esta libre le acompaña.

 El crédito que recibe en la Fundación lo invierte en surtir su stock de prendas como bóxer, medias, tangas y más.  Nuestra socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar a los mayoristas para poder obtener mejores ganancias, nos ha comentado que su negocio en este último mes ha bajado porque ella lo descuido con todos los problemas que ha tenido que enfrentar,  pero ella está convencida que lo retomara con muchas fuerzas y le ira muy bien acotó con una sonrisa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Alfa communal bank. She is going through a pretty devastating period due to the loss of two loved ones: she lost both her son and her mother a month ago. She is very sad but despite all she has to continue on for her other children. Margarita sells intimate wear. She has been in this line of work for three years now and does very well. She’s married and her husband is a refrigeration technician. She goes out to sell door-to-door in her area and when her husband is free he goes with her. She will use the funds she gets from the Fundación to buy stock items like: boxer shorts, hosiery, thongs and other items. She travels all the way to Guayaquil to buy from wholesalers so that she can get better profits. She tells us that business has fallen off a bit this last month because all the problems she’s had to face have caused her to neglect it a bit. However, she’s sure that she will retake it firmly and do well, she added with a smile.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Brassieres, boxer shorts, thongs, hosiery.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en: M. Jack, a 35-year-old married mother of two children and caring for two dependents, has operated a drug shop business for two years. She is using the loan to purchase a variety of drugs to meet her customers’ needs. A very hardworking businesswoman, M. Jack's  dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of drugs to  meet her customers’ needs

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito N. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 44 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecito plants and harvests rice for sale. Anecito has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month.

Anecito joined CEVI to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecito is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fertilizers and seeds. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve his family’s general living conditions.

About CEVI

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 64 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos.Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, durante algunas horas del día.  En una pequeña maleta lleva  variedad de productos, y cuando tiene mas pedidos cita a sus clientes a su casa o de lo contrario les lleva los productos a sus casas. Generalmente sus compradoras son las hijas de sus vecinas, quienes semanalmente le pagan, por lo que trabaja muy confiada, y con su mercadería colocada. Esta muy satisfecha por la labor que desempeña; porque es tranquila y además porque hace muchos años atrás, solo tejía y bordaba en su casa, ahora con este negocio tiene muchas  amistades con las que se distrae y a la vez comercializa. Para mas adelante tiene planeado comprarse una vitrina, donde exhibirá sus productos para que sean  más visibles para  sus clientes.Es el  décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le es de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar  todas sus cuotas a tiempo, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar laborando.Ana tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de diferentes productos de belleza (perfumes, talcos, cremas humectantes), de esta manera piensa abastecerse, para ofrecer la mejor variedad de mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana, 64, lives in her own house together with her husband and 4 children. For 3 years she has sold cosmetics for several hours a day. She transports a various of products in a small suitcase. When she has more orders her clients make an appointment at her home, or alternatively she takes the products to their homes. Generally her purchasers are her neighbours' daughters, who pay her weekly - and because of this she works very confidently, and with very good merchandise. Ana is very satisfied with the work she performs, because it is relaxed, and because for many years before she used to only weave and embroider in her home. Now with this business Ana has many friendships which entertain her and at the same time provide her with business. In the future she wants to purchase a glass display case to display her cosmetics so they are more visible to her customers. This is the tenth loan she has had with MFP and she knows that they are very useful in augmenting her working capital. She promises to make her repayments in time, and additionally is very thankful to all the people that made the loan possible that will allow her to continue working. Ana plans to invest the money in the purchase of different beauty products (perfumes, talcs, moisturising creams) and in this way wants to stock up her shop to offer a better variety of merchandise to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock shop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. 

Victoria is 39 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike for the transportation of charcoal bags to her home for stock.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Las Palmeras inicia su ciclo 5 con 14 socias, las socias pertenecen al departamento D. Huancavelica donD. L. actividad económica principal es el comercio.
Victoria es socia del Bancomunal, es casada, tiene 3 hijos jóvenes D. 29, 27 y 19 años D. edad. Victoria inició su negocio con una mini tienda y con poco capital, con el sueldo que recibía del Magisterio fue invirtiendo D. a pocos, ahora tiene una bodega surtida con productos D. primera necesidad, gracias a los prestamos que recibe pueD. invertir en mayor cantidad D. productos compra al por amyor.
texts.en:
The “Las Palmeras” (The Palms) Communal Bank is starting its fifth cycle with 14 members. The members belong to the Huancavelica department, where the main economic activity is commerce. Victoria is a member of the communal bank. She is married and has three children who are 29, 27, and 19 years old. Victoria started her business with a mini store and a little capital. She was slowly investing in the business with the money that she gets from teaching. Now she has a grocery store that is stocked with basic needs items. Thanks to the loans she gets she will be able to buy products in greater quantities for wholesale prices.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 35 years old and a mother of two children aged 11 and 13.  Both of her children are in school. Her husband is a soldier. 

Mediatrice currently sells sand that is used for construction in the local area. However, she is changing her business.  With the loan, she plans to buy new children’s clothes to sell.  People know her as an honest saleswoman, and trust her and the products she sells.  If she earns enough from the business, she will buy a goat.  If she does not earn much, she will buy a chicken to add to the four chickens she already owns.  She eventually wants to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Lideres De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: Zoraida tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la zona B de Huaycan, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales aun esta a cargo de 2, ya lleva 20 años vendiendo Herbalife y abarrotes en general, además de 7 años trabajando con Edaprospo con el cual últimamente pudo comprar una computadora, mejorar su tienda y cubrir los gastos de su casa y del colegio, espera pronto instalar un locutorio en la tienda y que también les valla bien a sus 14 socios del grupo “Lideres de Santa Rosa” los cuales son sus amigos del mercado donde trabajan el cual lleva el mismo nombre del grupo.
texts.en:
Zoraida, 51, lives in Huaycan’s Zone B. She has a life partner and three children two of whom are still in her care. She has sold Herbalife products and assorted groceries for 20 years. She has collaborated with Edaprospo for 7 years and recently was able to buy a computer, improve her store and cover her household and school expenses. She hopes to install a public phone booth soon in the store and that the 14 members of her communal bank, called “Lideres de Santa Rosa,” will all do well. They are all her friends from the market where they work and which has the same name as the group.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 38 years old. Anita is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is aged 19 and the youngest is only 5 years old. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Anita has been engaged in hog raising for over 15 years.

Anita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Anita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise and additional feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise and buy additional feeds

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya where he has been farming for the last 10 years. His farm produces maize, beans, bananas, milk and tea which he sells to the local market and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also owns and operates two posho mills (used for grinding maize into flour-as pictured )in the same location.

Douglas is 36 years old. He is married with 4 children who are aged between 7 and 17. All the children attends school.

He recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 KES which was used to purchase a posho mill. He has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow and a posho mill. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his children. His major challenges have been dishonest employees and the fluctuating weather patterns that affect his crop production. In future, he plans to have at least 3 posho mills strategically placed in his local market.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and a posho mill.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace más D. 4 años se dedica a L. atención D. su negocio, en el que ha instalado en su casa un espacio para vender artículos escolares, así como algunos alimentos que no hay en su zona, aprovechando que sus clientes van a su establecimiento a requerir el servicio D. locutorio que ofrece también. D. esta manera es como se gana L. vida, es por eso que su tienda es L. más concurrida, es por ello que tiene mayores ganancias y rotación D. su mercadería que constantemente son adquiridos en L. ciudad. Prefiere vender en su zona  porque  es una buena oportunidad D. negocios y ganancias y por tal espera incrementar su negocio D. mercadería y mejorar sus instalaciones. 

Es su cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que L. conocen como una persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. más mercadería para su tienda en  artículos  D. escritorio y algunos artículos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Arminda, age 41, lives with her husband and three children in their own home.  For more than four years she has been managing a business, a store established in a space in her home where she sells school supplies and a few food items since there is no other store in the area.  Her customers also take advantage of the phone services that she also offers.  This is how Arminda earns her living, which explains why her store is always busy.  In order to earn as much income as possible, she constantly turns over her inventory and must acquire her merchandise in the city.  She prefers selling in her area because it provides a good business opportunity for generating profit.  For this reason, she hopes to expand her retail business and improve her facilities.  

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  Arminda is very happy to know that she has the financial backing of people who are aware of the fact that she is a responsible individual with her payments.  In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  Arminda thanks everyone who approved her loan request since it will very useful in advancing her business.  The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise for her store, such as school supplies and a few basic necessities.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Anita is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a business providing pedicure and manicure services to local community members. She also sells Natasha and Avon products like polo shirts. Anita has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Anita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of her pedicure and manicure services. This will be the first loan taken by Anita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her pedicure and manicure service

loans.name: Amarilis Del Establo Group

texts.es:
MARISABEL D. FUENTES, tiene 37 años D. edad, es separada y  tiene 2 hijos menores uno D. 12 y el otro D. 2 años siendo ellos la razón D. su esfuerzo y trabajo para apoyarlo en el logro D. su educación. Ella integra el grupo “AMARILIS DEL ESTABLO” junto con ocho personas igualmente trabajadoras.
MARISABEL, se dedica a la venta D. golosinas y gaseosas en forma ambulante, es decir por diferentes lugares del distrito D. Carabayllo que es la zona donD. vive. DesD. muy niña se inicio en el trabajo dependiente bordando polos, en confecciones y poco a poco juntó su dinero formando un pequeño capital que le permitió iniciar el negocio D. la venta D. golosinas. Al ver que sus ventas eran diarias se esforzó para vender lo más que podía, y D. esa manera su negocio iba creciendo por que invertía más para vender más. 
Con este negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que, no cuenta con el apoyo permanente D. su esposo y padres D. ellos. 
Su trabajo diario es para satisfacer sus principales necesidades especialmente D. sus hijos menores y en el corto plazo instalar una bodega en su casa para dedicarse más tiempo a sus niños, es por ello que este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos, mercadería para implementar su negocio y así  generar mayor utilidad que le permita ahorrar para llegar su meta.  

** El señor Simeon V. Quiñones aparece en la foto pequeña en la esquina D. la foto grupal **
texts.en:
Marisabel D. Fuentes is 37 years old, separated and has 2 small children - 12 and 2 years old. They are the reason for her efforts and hard work to support them in achieving their education. Marisabel is a member of the group 'Amarilis Del Establo', together with 8 equally hardworking people.

Marisabel works selling lollies and soft drinks door to door, in different places in the Carabayllo district which is the zone where she lives.
