She started working independently when she was very young, embroidering polos and dressmaking, and little by little saved a small capital amount which permitted her to start her lolly sale business. Upon seeing that she maD. daily sales she began trying to sell as many as she could, and in this way her business has grown as she invests more to sell more.

With this business Marisabel has been able to improve her family's circumstances, as she doesn't have the permanent support of her husband and their fathers. Her daily work covers her main necessities, especially for her small children, and in the short term will allow her to install a grocery store in her house so she can dedicate more time to her children. It is for this reason Marisabel is seeking a loan to purchase stock and merchandise to implement her business and generate better earnings which will permit her to save and arrive at her goal. 

** Mr. Simeon V. Quiñones is in the small photo in the corner of the group photo **

loans.use: Purchase products and merchandise to stock business

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en:
This village loan includes eight members. They are located in Ruessei Chrouy village in Kandal province. This village group selected, Mrs. Keo K., a 28 year old married woman, as the village bank president. They will each use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Keo K. and her husband, Mr. Chin Chanthy, are grocery and soup sellers in the local village. With these businesses, they still earn a small income with which to support their famiL.. As the grocery business is still generating onL. a meager income, Mrs. Keo K. would like to expand her store. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries and more food supplies.
  
This couple has two children: one is attending the local school and the other is just 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to expand her current business.

loans.name: Kigando Abeteraine Group

texts.en:
Grace is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with six children who lives in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a member of the Kigando Abeteraine borrower group (pictured in the photo that accompanies this profile), in which each member of the group guarantees the loans of the other.

Grace is charged with the responsibility of looking after her family, and her dream is to be able to educate all her children up to the university level. She has been running a small retail shop for ten years which has boosted her income level.  Her business plan is to become a wholesale trader.  Grace needs her portion of this group loan to buy sugar, coffee, soap and salt to sell at her shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, soap and salt for to resell in a shop

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia es cliente antigua de emprender, ella vive en casa propia en la zona se santa fe, lugar ubicado en una rinconada de la zona sur, tiene dos hijos menores que se encuentran a su cuidado, ella viaja al desaguadero a comprar su productos como tunta, chuño, ají amarillo, rojo, condimentos, etc., su esposo trabaja de albañil por las distintas zonas de la zona sur, la señora es cumplida y responsable en sus pagos, al margen de sus ventas, ella tiene un kiosco en una  parada de mini bus, que atiende dos veces por semana, ya que no tiene mucha afluencia de transportes de esa línea, por lo tanto se solicita la atención como cliente kiva. El crédito que ella solicita invertirá en su capital de trabajo en la  compra de chuño, ajíes, etc. y parte en compra de material de construcción, ya que ella esta amurallando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is a long-standing client of Emprender.  She lives in her own home in Santa Fe district which is located in a corner of the southern part of the city.  She has two dependent children in her care.

Lucia travels to Desaguadero to buy her products such as 'chuño' (a freeze-dried potato product), 'tunta' (white 'chuño'), yellow chili peppers, red chili peppers, condiments, etc.  Her husband works as a construction worker in different areas in the south of the city.

Lucia is punctual and responsible in making her loan repayments.  She has a kiosk at a mini bus stop where she works twice a week since there isn't a lot of transport on that line.  However, she is requesting attention as a Kiva client.  Part of the loan she is requesting will be invested as working capital, buying 'chuño', chili peppers, etc. and part will be used to buy building supplies since she is building a wall around her house.

loans.use: To buy white 'chuño' (freeze-dried potato product), chili peppers, etc.

loans.name: Mary Njoki

texts.en:
Mary is 23 years old, married to Edward Kiarie who contributes to the family income, and they have one child. She practices mixed farming, that is, both  crop and dairy farming. She has been in the business for a period of seven years with an income of KES. 7,000 per month.


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and Mary is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use it to buy animal feed and pay for labour. She has no history with any other MFI. 


Mary hopes to have a large dairy farm so as to increase their income. This will enable her to  improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pay for labour.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 35 years old and has six children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old and the youngest 5 months. Betty's husband is a policeman.

Betty owns a small store in which she sells soft drinks, water, and juices, and she is requesting a loan in order to buy more juices, sodas, milk, and water. With the profits, she plans to buy household equipment, such as cups and saucepans.

loans.use: To buy more juices, sodas, milk, and water

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling vegetables. She lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her vegetables vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,500. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lourdes aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: Additional working capital for selling of vegetables

loans.name: Kakola Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en: 42 year-old Constance N. is affiliated with Kakola Women's group-Lugazi. In the course of the last ten years, she has been in charge of a boutique business in Kakola-Lugazi. She has been selling ladies clothes primarily. She says she began this business with savings from her farming business. She still does farming, though it is now more of a second fiddle. Weekly, this business generates her 50,000 shillings as profit. She says she is requesting this loan to purchase more ladies' and children's clothes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' and children's clothes.

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.ru: Алиева Лутфия жительница Шахритусского района. Ей 50 лет. Она Разведена. У нее 3 детей. Сын находится в России на заработках. Сама Лутфия имеет средне - специальное образование, медсестра. По специальности проработала 10 лет. Сейчас она занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает однотонные материалы с вышивками. И еще она продает штаны и специальные ткани для вышивки. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки ниток и материалов с вышивкой.
texts.en: Lutfiya A. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is fifty years old, divorced, and has three children. Her son is working in Russia. Lutfiya has a vocational education as a nurse. She worked in her profession for ten years.  Now she is works in trade. She rents a shop where she sells embroidered monochromatic fabrics. She also sells trousers and special fabrics for embroidering. She has been doing this work for five years.  She is taking out a loan to buy thread and fabric for embroidery.

loans.use: to purchase thread and fabric for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his general store area and cover their house expenses

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a thirty two year old married woman with four children and she owns a house in Kasese Uganda. She has been in produce for ten years dealing in maize and beans for sell. Her hardship is limited capital and her vision is to establish outlets in different trading centers and educate her children. Peluce needs the loan facility to buy maize and beans for resell.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans for resell.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling of cosmetic products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Blesilda earns additional income from frozen foods. Blesilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Blesilda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of beauty supplies to sell through her cosmetics buying and selling business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of beauty supplies to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and married to Peter. She is a dairy farmer in Kikuyu town. This is her primary business which she has been doing for the last thirteen years. Her husband Peter helps in the farming activity so as to increase the family's income. 

With this loan, Jane plans to buy a dairy cow for more milk production. Any additional income will come in handy as Jane hopes to venture in to pig farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Nora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional snacks & canned goods.
Nora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks, shampoo & detergents

loans.name: Ligia Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora Ligia es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por el sector Tres Marías, en este lugar la gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y como está cerca de la ciudad de Cuenca mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Doña Ligia tiene 23 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 4 años de edad y un bebé de  6 meses. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su padre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, el papá labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es propia.
 
La Señora Ligia labora en una fábrica de pantalones hace 8 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su quinto crédito y lo va a invertir en la entrada de una máquina de coser industrial para realizar trabajos de costura desde su casa.
 
Su meta es tener su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
Sra. Ligia is a member of the Communal Bank “Arco Iris” (Rainbow). She lives in the sector of Tres Marías, a place where the residents engage in livestock breeding and agriculture. This area is near the city of Cuenca where many of its people work in different business activities.

Doña Ligia is 23 years old and a single mother of two children, a four-year-old and a six-month-old baby. She does not own a house, so she lives at home with her parents and shares in the household expenses. Her father works in construction as a mason and her parents own their home.

Sra. Ligia works at a factory that produces trousers. She has been in this job for eight years and works Monday through Friday all day. At home, she spends her time raising chickens.

Ligia is receiving her fifth loan as part of her Communal Bank. She will invest the funds in a down payment toward an industrial sewing machine so that she can take sewing jobs at home. Her dream is to have her own sewing workshop.

loans.use: to make a down payment toward an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia works hard to support her family. She is single and has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines for 5 years. Eufemia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery stock such as eggs, toothpaste, shampoo, etc. In the future, Eufemia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock such as eggs, toothpaste, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Tusiampei

texts.en:
Tusiampei is 50 years old and a married woman. She has nine children who depend on her. She has been a farmer for a period of 16 years.

She knew about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She paid the previous loan successfully without complication; this is her second loan from KADET LTD. She wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 60 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Huancaro llamada Virgen Asunta de Racsa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 7 sacos de papa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Elena, a member of “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA” a communal bank located in the Cusco district, province and department.

Elena is 60 years old, she is single and has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with retail activity: she sells potatoes and she has a stall in Huancaro,in the “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” market. She works from 8 am to 6 pm, and thank to this activity she is able to provide for her children. She would like to improve her potatoes sale activity, and she is requesting a loan to buy 7 bags of potatoes.

She is pleased with the loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy 7 bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Rolando De Jesus

texts.es:
Rolando, vive con su familia conformada por sus padres y su esposa, más dos hijos, él es agricultor, inicio con su padre y aprendió poco a poco el proceso de la agricultura, no tiene un horario fijo para atender las labores y actualmente necesita comprar insumos agrícolas para aplicarlos a la siembra.
Él solicita un préstamo que cubra el gasto en abono y pesticidas, estos materiales le ayudan para fortalecer y prevenir las plagas en los cultivos.
Su objetivo es tener éxito en las cosechas, que la producción sea abundante y sana para poder garantizarle a la familia la alimentación por un tiempo.
texts.en:
Rolando lives with his family which is made up of his parents, his wife and their two children.  He is a farmer-he started with his father and little by little learned how to farm.  He doesn’t have a set schedule but he takes care of the work and now he needs to buy agricultural supplies for the crop.

He is requesting a loan to cover the expenses of fertilizer and pesticides.  These products help him strengthen the plants and prevent infestations.

His goal is to succeed with his crops and for the harvest to be abundant and healthy, so that he can guarantee his family food for a while.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to apply on his crops

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La señora María Luisa desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de tamales que ella misma prepara, de diferentes guisos como lo son de pollo, puerco y queso con rajas, que distribuye a sus vecinos y amistades a un precio accesible, los vende en paquetes de 12 y 6 tamales. María Luisa desea un crédito para comprar materia prima como la maseca, carne, pollo y demás ingredientes para la elaboración del producto ya que de esta forma podrá seguir con su venta y así generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. María Luisa has been preparing and selling tamales for 10 years. She prepares different types of tamales filled with chicken, pork, and slices of cheese. María Luisa sells her food to neighbors and friends at an affordable price and the tamales are sold in packets of either 6 or 12.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as cornmeal, meat, chicken, and other ingredients for making her product. This will allow her to continue making sales and generating better revenues.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making tamales.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 41 years old.  He has been selling second hand shoes for the last two years making a monthly profit of KES 30,000.  He has been loaned KES 35,000 which he plans to stock children's school shoes as the new term is about to begin.

With the anticipated profit, he hopes to open a big shop where he can stock bales of shoes for future sale.  In the near future he would like to own more shoe shops.

loans.use: to stock children's school shoes as the new term is about to begin.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Pilar es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Horizonte. Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 29 años de edad, soltera.
Lleva tres años perteneciendo a la familia de Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la venta de producto de plastiqueria, como es soltera se  dedica todo su tiempo a la atención de su negocio, los días que viaja para comprar más mercadería deja encargada en su puesto a  una persona  de su entera confianza.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 10 tinas grandes, 50 baldes de 10 litros, 50 bandejitas chicas, 100 taper de plástico mediano, 50 jarras de 4 litros, 25 azucareras, 25 bandejas medianas, 50 taper redondos, 50 toma todo.
Sus compras las realiza al por mayor. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la facilidad que tuvo al ingresar al banquito para que le dieran su primer préstamo para poder aumentar el pequeño capital que tenía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pilar is a member of the Nuevo Horizonte communal bank, in the Calleria District, Ucayali Department. She is 29 and single.
She has belonged to the Manuela Ramos family for three years. Her business is selling plastic products. Because she is single, she devotes all of her time to the business. On days when she travels to purchase more merchandise, she leaves her store with a person whom she trusts entirely.
With her new loan of 2,000.00 nuevos soles, she will purchase: 10 large tubs, 50 ten-litre buckets, 50 little trays, 100 medium-sized plastic containers, 50 four-litre pitchers, 25 sugar bowls, 25 medium trays, 50 round plastic containers, and 50 water bottles.
She makes her purchases wholesale. She thanks Manuela Ramos for the ease with which she was able to join the bank and get her first loan to increase her small amount of working capital.

loans.use: to purchase buckets, containers, pitchers, and other plastics.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, es socia de Finca Peru desde hace 11 años.
María compra y vende cochinilla y tara, el primer préstamo que obtuvo lo utilizó para comprar cochinilla. Agradece porque le ayudaron a formar su negocio, le gusta mucho el ahorro y las capacitaciones. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para la compra de cochinilla, y la meta que tiene ahora es poder terminar de hacer su casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Tarpuy” communal bank.  She’s 34 years old and has two children.  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for the last 11 years.

María is a cochineal and spiny holdback merchant.  She used the first loan she got to buy cochineal.  She is grateful because they helped her start her business.  She likes the savings and the training very much.  She will use the requested loan to buy cochineal.  Her current goal is to be able to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy cochineal.

loans.name: Blanca Jeanette

texts.es: Blanca Jeanette de cuarenta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una venta de ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, de todo tipo y variedad, blusas, calcetines y artículos como carteras y otros accesorios, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad a precios bajos,  siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan; Blanca Jeanette es una mujer emprendedora siempre está dispuesta a trabajar duro para alanzar sus objetivos, su secreto para llegar al éxito es la perseverancia y el entusiasmo; está dispuesta a hacer crecer el negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  blusas, pantalones, trajes, calcetines, carteras entre otros. Blanca Jeanette tiene fe que con su dedicación lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca Jeanette is 40 years old and lives with her life companion and their children. She has a business selling clothing of all types and varieties for women, men, boys, and girls. These include blouses, socks, and items such as handbags and other accessories. She has many customers because her products are of good quality and offered at low prices. In addition, she always has what people need. Blanca Jeanette is an enterprising woman who is always willing to work hard to achieve her goals. Her secret for success is having perseverance and enthusiasm.

She is willing to grow her business, so she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to buy blouses, trousers, suits, socks, handbags, and other items. Blanca Jeanette has faith that her dedication will lead to financial security for her household.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, suits, socks, handbags, and other items.

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
Kenedy has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last seven years. Besides the transport business, he also practices farming. He is 34 years old and married to Shiphirah, they have one child. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to open green grocer a business for his wife. 

In the future, Kenedy hopes to buy another motorcycle for his transport.

loans.use: To open a business for his wife.

loans.name: June

texts.en: June is a married man who has three children. June is 51 years old and resides at Lintugop, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur: Philippines. June operates a home-based business, making and selling buko salad (sweet young coconut salad) products to earn a living. He has been in this business for 3 years. Each month, he earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to purchase additional ingredients for buko salad making. June has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, June wants to build a house and to support his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for buko salad making

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Planting and harvesting rice is what Modesto and his family rely on to survive in their daily living. He only earns an income twice a year during the harvest seasons of April and November. This income is insufficient for their needs, so his wife raises hogs for additional profits. The couple has to strive hard since they were blessed with nine children. Four of them attend school and the rest have settled into marriage. 

Modesto at this moment has insufficient funds for the maintenance of his rice field. He is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy rice seeds and four bags of fertilizers to be used in farming.

He hopes to increase his crop production to save for the education of his children and to someday achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and four bags of fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband's transport business. Her husband purchased an auto-rickshaw a few years ago on installment and wants to payoff the remaining installments all at once.
By doing this, the auto-rickshaw will become his property and he will be able to run his transport business better.
Zahida is a housewife and performs her duties by staying at home. She is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a nearby school and getting their education.
Zahida is very hopeful that an investment will help her husband in his business and her family will be able to enjoy better living conditions as a result of it.

loans.use: To pay off the installments of an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Bert

texts.en:
Everybody dreams to have a happy family and successful lifestyle. But for some of us this remains a dream. But Bert, a 39-year-old farmer, dreams to experience a comfortable life with his wife and two children and persists to achieve that dream. So he asks for financial assistance through asking for a loan amount of P20,000 to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow his business.

He hopes that his business will grow accordingly to become a practicable source of income. Through this, he could lift his family from poverty and achieve his dream.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to grow his business.

loans.name: Ingridnaide

texts.es: La señora Ingridnaide a sus 34 años de edad es madre de 6 hijos de 20, 18, 17,17, 7 y 1 años de edad, junto con su esposo tiene que trabajar arduamente para conseguir los ingresos para el sostenimiento que su gran familia. La señora Ingridnaide se dedica a la venta de mercancía por catalogo y por encargo de sus amigos, familiares y conocidos. Para la temporada de fin de año la señora Ingridnaide necesita de la compra de mercancía que le permita mejorar sus ventas y así incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Ingridnaide es brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en: Ingridnaide is 34 years old and a mother of 6 children aged 20, 18, 17, 17, 7 and 1 year old.  Along with her husband, she needs to work very hard to earn enough money to sustain such a big family.  Ingridnaide works in the sale of catalog products which her friends, family members and other clients order.  For the end of the year, she needs to purchase merchandise that will allow her to improve her sales and as such improve her family's quality of life.  Her dream is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: purchase a selection of body creams, perfumes, and make-up.

loans.name: Felipa Danelia

texts.es: Felipa es una emprendedora que ha salido adelante con muchos esfuerzos  ha emprendido su propio negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos uno de ellos se encuentra a su cargo todavía que le ayuda en el negocio. Felipa nos cuenta que con el apoyo que se le ha brindado le ha ayudado mucho ya que ha  aumentado su inventario en el negocio y que ahora le ofrece variedad de productos a sus clientes. Felipa está solicitando crédito para nuevamente invertir en el negocio para comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños además cosméticos que  son los productos que mas buscan sus clientes.
texts.en: Felipa is an entrepreneur who has managed to get ahead in life with a lot of effort.  She started her own business so that she could provide for her children.  One of her children is still in her care and helps her in her business.  Felipa tells us that the support she has received has helped her a lot as she has increased her business inventory and now offers a variety of products to her customers.  Felipa is requesting a loan so that she can once again invest in her business, buying men's, women's and children's clothing, as well as cosmetics.  these are the products that her customers request the most.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's and children's clothing, and cosmetics

loans.name: Jiriman

texts.en:
Jiriman is married and has two children. He owns a produce business. He started as a farmer and saved to start his current business. 

Jiriman is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy rice to sell. He faces a challenge of high price fluctuations; his personal goal is to educate his children. His business goal is to expand his business to new markets.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell.

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 42  ans, 3 enfants et vivant  majoritairement dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits, de fruits et légumes, de poissons et des condiments.
AMI, debout à droite sur la photo,  fait le commerce de poissons dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, une 55 kg de poissons ( 20kg de frais et 35kg de fumés). Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle les revend à une place fixe au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Pour acheter des poissons fumés et frais

loans.name: Mery Lorena

texts.es: Sandoya  vive en las Orquídeas sector norte de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Ella comenzó con el negocio de bazar y papelería hace 1 año atrás. Compro una vitrina y perchas ahí ella vende láminas, cuadernos hasta artículos de bazar. Ella atiende su pequeño negocio sola. Ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Ella cuenta que al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio  pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando esas condiciones pues ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio y su sueño es ampliarlo más para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que día  a día le compran en su bazar. Su sueño es arreglar su vivienda y  comprarse un carro. Con el préstamo quiere comprar  artículos para el bazar, papeles, láminas,  etc.
texts.en:
Sandoya lives in the Orquídes area north of the city of Guayaquil.  She started with her variety and stationery business one year ago.  She bought a display case and some racks, and that is where she sells illustrated prints, notebooks, and even novelty items.  She tends to her small business alone. She starts work at 8:00 a.m., and she works until 10:00 p.m.

She says that in the beginning there was a lot of delinquency in her area, and her business was not very productive.  Little by little, these conditions have been improving.  Now her business is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand it more in order to be able to meet the needs of her consumers who shop at her store day to day.

Her dream is to fix up her house and to buy a car.  She wants to use the loan to buy novelty items, papers, and illustrated prints, etc.

loans.use: to buy novelty items, papers, and illustrated prints, etc.

loans.name: Falta Alguien En Foto Igualdad Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca, las comunidades que colindan con Veracruz se caracterizan por su amplia producción de caña de azúcar y los habitantes dedican su vida al campo. En una de estas poblaciones se conformó un grupo llamado Igualdad, este valor es el más importante para los diecisiete integrantes que creen que todas las personas deben practicar. Las integranes y sus actividades son: María venta de refresco y comida; Dolores, Reyna y María Leonarda, comida; Cesárea, cosméticos; Erika, ropa y calzado; Modesta, plata; Araceli, cerdos; Alicia, pizzas; Xochitl, calzado por catálogo; Claudia, abarrotes; María Teresa, tacos; María  Del Carmen, ropa; Judith, verduras; Saúl, pan; Daniel quien maneja una herrería y Samuel, una carpintería. 

   Doña Alicia es una persona que desde pequeña aprendió a trabajar y ganarse la vida para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos familiares, "esa faceta de mi vida me hizo madurar rápidamente enseñándome a luchar por mis ideales y por todo aquello que quiero alcanzar”.  

   Actualmente Doña Alicia se dedica a vender pizzas, negocio que inicio desde hace ya once años. Recuerda con una sonrisa en los labios como su hijo Che, como lo llama de cariño, le enseñó a preparar pizzas, hamburguesas, hot-dogs, malteadas y salchi-papas. Su hijo también ha sido un gran apoyo pues juntos pudieron comprar el equipo e ingredientes  necesarios para la pizzería, sobre todo el horno donde cocina que fue conseguido por Che en los Estados Unidos.

   El 30 de Abril se celebra el día del niño y la pizzería ya tiene pedidos especiales para la ocasión por lo tanto Doña Alicia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que utilizará para comprar harina, queso, peperoni, piña, pimientos, jamón, leche, carne, verdura y gas.

   Los integrantes del grupo Igualdad se sienten muy contentos con el crecimiento de cada una de sus actividades y agradecen a todas las personas que hacen posible se les otorgue un nuevo préstamo.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de Doña Claudia, Doña Alicia viste blusa color café, y una falda estampada.

loans.use: comprara: harina, queso, peperoni, piña, pimientos, jamón, leche, carne, verdura y gas

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat, a 40 year old Palestinian woman, lives and works in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon. 
She is divorced and raising her five children by herself, which requires a stable source of income. That is why she decided to open her clothes shop for kids and women two years ago. However, she has 12 years of experience in selling clothes as she used to be an employee in one of the main clothes shop in the camp. Mirvat also fixes clothes during her free time for extra revenue. Her two daughters help her in the housing expenses, they are employees in a company outside the camp. 
Before the winter season, Mirvat is asking for a 3,597,000 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa in order to buy large quantities of clothes at a lower price. 
Mirvat doesn't have a lot of competitors in the area, she is friendly with her clients and is very devoted to her shop. Her brother helped her to open the shop in 2013 in an excellent location of the camp and she has been relying on herself since then.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes for her shop

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is an active member of Mercury Mothers where she is a secretary. She is married and has four children. Her major business activity is growing and selling of maize, beans, avocados and on a small scale coffee. In addition, she has a dairy cow and this gives her some extra income. The monthly sales from avocados and milk total $88, whereas coffee sales of about $70 come in every month. The vegetables also contribute to her monthly income but minimally because they are mainly for home consumption. 

Esther has been spending so much money on paraffin to light her home and electricity is so expensive and not reliable in her area.

loans.use: Esther wants to buy a solar panel for to be used at her home.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a single mother of three sons and lives in the area of San Juanito, in the state of Chihuahua. She has been dedicating herself to selling sweets from her home for the last few years, since her sons were very little. She did not have any money and struggled through very economically difficult moments, and did not have anybody to look after her sons. For these reasons she began her little business. Her business grew little by little with her large effort, dedicated and the unconditional support from her sons.

In order for her business to continue growing as it has been, she needs a loan of $325, which she will use to buy merchandise and increase supplies and therefore sales. Yolanda needs your support and thanks you sincerely for it.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es madre soltera de 3 hijos y viven en la localidad de San Juanito, en el estado de Chihuahua. Ella desde hace tiempo se dedica a la venta de dulces en su propio domicilio, pues hace mucho años, cuando sus hijos eran muy pequeñitos, ella no tenía dinero y atravesaba por momentos muy difíciles económicamente, y no tenía quien le cuidara a los niños, es por todas estas circunstancias por las que comenzó con este pequeño negocio. Mismo que ha ido creciendo poco a poco con su esfuerzo, dedicación y el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos.

Para poder seguir creciendo y continuar como hasta ahora, ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de 325 dlls, mismos que destinará a la compara de más mercancía que incremente el surtido y de esta manera sus ventas. Yolanda necesita de tu apoyo y te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is a hard working farmer who grew up in Baba. He produces rice and corn on land given to him by his father, who, he still helps and work with. He lives with his girlfriend, who he hopes to marry and start a family with in the near future. He will invest the loan so he can plant for the next cycle by preparing the land, and buying fertilizer and seeds. He does not have children but is still very family oriented, as he is close to his mother, father and brothers. He hopes he can fix the lands so they can be productive for years to come.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Baba compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by big large companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans, as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plough the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are no drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of products including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many of the loans will also go towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice and Corn Farming

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs N. is 47 years and has 4 sons and one daughter ages 27-18. She lives in Nghi Loc in Nghe An Province, one of the poorest regions of Vietnam. Her family does the traditional farming: growing rice, and raising pigs and chickens. The oldest son is now a guest worker in Taiwan. She joined TYM in 2002 and used the loan to buy a rice mill. Now she needs $450 to buy a cow and rice for the mill.

loans.use: Buy rice and a cow

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena P. Alcón, divorced and the mother of 8 children, has been a member of Pro Mujer for 7 years. Her principal work is the collection and recycling of plastics.

Before this, she used to work selling jackets, which she made herself. She quickly discovered that a better way to generate income was the buying and selling of this merchandise. Since she was very young, she learned the art of sewing, and she walked through the streets carrying her products.

At present, Elena only works collecting plastics for recycling, an activity she does along with her youngest daughter. Her objective is to put together capital to travel to the city of Cochabamba, in order to purchase a greater quantity of plastic products for resale, and in that way generate greater resources for her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Elena P. Alcón, divorciada y madre de 8 hijos, es socia de Pro Mujer hace 7 años, su actividad principal es la recolección y reciclaje de plásticos.

Anteriormente su actividad era la venda de chamarras, que ella misma confeccionaba, de pronto descubrió que la mejor forma de generar ingresos era la compra y venta de esta mercadería. Desde muy niña aprendió el arte de la costura, y deambulaba por las calles, cargada de sus productos.

Actualmente Elena solo se dedica a la recolección de plásticos para su reciclaje, actividad que realiza colaborada por su hija menor. Su objetivo es reunir capital para poder viajar a la ciudad de Cochabamba, con el objetivo de lograr mayor cantidad de plásticos para la venta y de esta manera generar mayores recursos para su familia.

loans.use: Her objective is to put together capital to travel to the city of Cochabamba, in order to purchase a greater quantity of plastic products for resale, and in that way generate greater resources for her family.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam N., age 56, is a sugarcane broker who earns up to $9.60 per day in revenue. She purchases the sugarcane from an individual’s plantation and resells it to a wholesaler at a market. Her husband raises cattle for a living. They have seven children. Two children work in Thailand and five of their children are students. In order to increase her inventory and expand her business, she would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase sugarcane in larger quantities, reducing costs by buying in bulk and thus increasing profits. She plans to use the increased profits to take care of her family and finance her children’s education. She is pictured at home with her husband in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase additional sugarcane inventory.

loans.name: Nikolinka

texts.en: Together with her husband, Nikolinka G. keeps 16 sheep and a cow. They also keep about 130-140 sheep belonging to their fellow villagers. Nikolinka and her husband live in a house with their three kids. The loan they apply for will be used to buy 10 more sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 more sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soldering wires and pay for electricity to improve his business.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Mr. Elshan is a person with a very low income. He is 32, married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Elshan owns and operates a clothing stand in the bazaar of his hometown of Saatli. Recently he employed a shop assistant and now is looking for more funding to further increase the quantity and quality of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru:
Safarali T. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 40, married and has 4 children. He has a high school diploma with a specialization in mechanics. Professionally, he is trained in fixing plumbing equipment and he makes his living by offering this service. This is the only source of income for his family. Safarali would like to receive a loan in order to purchase technical equipment (welding equipment, etc). Moreover, in this region there are few technicians trained to offer this service, therefore additional equipment would provide better services to the people. Safarali plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Туйдиев Сафарали проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 40 лет, женат имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-техническое. По профессии сантехник. Зарабатывает на жизнь путем оказания сантехнических услуг. Работает по найму. Это единственный источник дохода его семьи. Планирует получить кредит для приобретения технического оборудования( сварочный аппарат идр.) Кроме того мастеров такого рода в районе мало поэтому занимаясь данным делом он дает возможность населению пользоваться данными услугами. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Edelmira Leonor

texts.es:
Señora Edelmira Leonor García V. is 55 years old. She studied Business Administration. She has one daughter who is independent. She takes care of her 2 grandsons. She lives in the district of Mache de la Provincia in La Libertad, Peru.

She has a brick making business and she also serves breakfast, lunch and dinner to 11 people who at the end of the month will pay her for her services. She used to work for Empresa Ratamas where she would haul in a truck 3 tons of merchandise such as vegetables, gasoline, charcoal and Kerosene. She worked there for about 10 years. She travelled to the U.S. to find a better job, but didn't get there and instead found a job at the Venezuelan embassy as a cook. She only stayed in Venezuela for 5 years because she had to come back to her country to take care of her mother since she was very ill. Her mother died, and now she had to take care of her father.

She belongs to the group/club called ' King of Kings' where she obtained her first loan. With this loan she was able to purchase pots and pans.

With this loan, which she will repay within 4 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, paper stuff (napkins) and cement bags. Her biggest dream is to one day have a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edelmira Leonor García V. tiene 55 años de edad, estudio la especialidad de secretariado ejecutivo. Tiene una sola hija que ya no depende de ella, actualmente tiene 2 nietos a su cargo. Vive en el Distrito de Mache de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Su negocio consiste en la fabricación de ladrillos de cemento el cual vende por millar, además tiene 11 personas que atender con desayuno, almuerzo y cena que al cabo de un mes le remuneran por su atención. Su negocio se inicia con la venta de verduras, gas, carbón y kerosene en la Empresa Retamas, trasladaba aproximadamente 3 toneladas de mercadería en un camión, allí trabajó 10 años. Posteriormente viajo al país de EE.UU. en busca de mejoras, consiguió un trabajo como cocinera en la embajada de Venezuela en la OEA permaneció 5 años debido que tuvo que regresar a su país porque su madre se puso mal de salud y ella se sentía en la obligación de cuidarla. Paso el tiempo y su madre falleció, ahora le tocaba cuidar de su padre el cual se quedaba solo. Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Rey de Reyes” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero con el que compró ollas y un perol para preparar algunos potajes. Con el préstamo de S/. 700.00 que cancelara en cuatro meses comprara un saco de arroz, azúcar, una caja de aceite, servilletas y para comprar algunas bolsas de cemento. Su mayor sueño es instalar una ferretería en la que esté bien implementada.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to prepare home cooked meals

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es:
Roberto B. is 38-year-old farmer who lives in Ticuantepe. He has 2 children with his wife. He and his wife both work very hard to provide basic necessities at home. Through their hard work they’ve been able to develop a small business selling tropigas (propane) for the last 10 years. He’s soliciting a loan to buy agricultural products.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

don Roberto B. es agricultor a sus 38 años de edad reside en Ticuantepe procreo 2 hijos con su esposa, ambos trabajan muy duro para garantizarle las cosas basicas en el hogar , ella lo apoya trabajando como comerciante quienes han logrado con esfuerzos propios tener un pequeño negocio de venta de tropigas desde hace 10 ños. Solicita el credito para comprar insumos agricolas

loans.use: To buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua M. is 60, married, and has four children who have all completed school and are working. She is a food vendor selling banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish or soup. Afua has a lot of customers because banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and also firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

Afua belongs to a community group called Anyidado Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for food preparation: maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and also firewood

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr:
Anna A. was born around 1964 in COTONOU in the economic capital of BENIN. She is the mother of six children including the eldest, age 26, a student. Three other children are in school, in grades 10, 9, and 6, respectively. She resides in the ENAGNON PLAGE district in AKPAKPADODOME (Cotonou) with her husband, Thomas ADODO, a motorbike taxi driver in the city of COTONOU. In the beginning, Ms. Anna A. used to sell staple foods and had operating funds of about 40,000 francs CFA. To buy her merchandise, she used to go to AZOVE in the Mono but wasn't able to create a large enough inventory due to her limited means. She then came to obtain an initial loan of 50,000 francs CFA to grow her capital. From there, she added to her business the sale of condiments, since after the initial loan, her operating capital increased. With the experience she acquired with regards to commerce, and because of growing demands from customers, she is presently requesting a third loan of 100,000 francs. With these funds, she is thinking of again diversifying her business by buying, in Lomé in Togo, children's clothing for distribution, which is also going to enable her to find other types of customers.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

A. Anna est née vers les années 1964 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN et mère de six enfants dont le plus âgé, 26ans, est étudiant. Trois autres sont scolarisés respectivement en classe de 2nde, 3ème et 6ème. Elle réside au quartier ENAGNON PLAGE à AKPAKPADODOME (Cotonou) avec son mari, ADODO Thomas, conducteur de taxi moto dans la ville de COTONOU. A ses débuts, dame A. Anna vendait des vivres et avait un fonds de roulement estimé à 40.000fcfa. Pour l’achat de sa marchandise, elle se rendait à AZOVE dans le Mono, mais n’arrivait pas à faire un approvisionnement suffisant vu ses moyens limités. Elle vint alors contracter un premier crédit de 50.000fcfa pour accroître son capital. De là, elle a ajouté à son activité la vente des condiments puisque après le premier prêt, son fonds de roulement a augmenté. Avec l’expérience qu’elle a acquise en matière de commerce et en raison des demandes croissantes de la part des clients, elle sollicite actuellement un 3ème crédit de 100.000fcfa. Avec ces fonds, elle pense varier à nouveau ses activités avec l’achat à Lomé au Togo des vêtements pour enfants pour la distribution ce qui va aussi lui permettre de rechercher d’autres types de clients.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of charcoal and some condiments

loans.name: Agricultural Machinery Services And Raising Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ha Thi N. is 30 years old. She is a very hardworking person. Not only does she work the farm, raise pigs and cattle, but she also invested in buying a tilling machine and wheat processor to serve the agricultural community. Her group has completed their first round of funding and repayment in good fashion. In this round of funding she is requesting 3,808,000 VND to buy another wheat processor.

Her group includes:

  • Mrs. Chuyen Thi N., requesting 3,808,000 VND to supplement her capital in a silk business.
  • Mrs. The Thi N., requesting 2,464,000 VND to invest in buying breeding chickens.
  • Mrs. Han Thi N., requesting 3,360,000 VND to invest in buying feed for pigs and chickens.
  • Mrs. Huong Thi C., requesting 3,808,000 VND to invets in feed for pigs and chickens.
  • Mrs. Loi Thi N., requesting 2,464,000 VND to invest in buying pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Ngô Thị Hà (MS: 09050007), năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị là người rất chăm chỉ. Chị không chỉ làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, bò. Chị còn đầu tư máy cày, máy tuốt lúa để làm dịch vụ cho bà con nông dân. Nhóm chị đã hoàn thành C. kỳ một rất tốt. Lần này chị vay 3.808.000 VND để mua máy tuốt lúa.

    Trong nhóm chị còn có

  • Chị Ngô Thị Chuyên (MS: 09050006), vay 3.808.000 VND bổ sung vốn làm tơ tằm
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Thế (MS: 09050008), vay 2.464.000 VND bổ sung vốn mua gà giống.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Hân (MS: 09050011), vay 3.360.000 VND bổ sung vốn mua cám lợn, gà.
  • Chị C. Thị Hường (MS: 09050010), vay 3.808.000 VND bổ sung vốn mua cám cho lợn, gà.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Lợi (MS: 09050009), vay 2.464.000 VND bổ sung vốn mua lợn.

loans.use: Buy machinery, feed, breeding animals

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana was born in the region of Chullunquiani - Mazocruz, Puno, Peru, and is 51 years of age. She has studied through the third grade and is married and the mother of 8 children.

She is a member of the Communal Bank Julia Jimenez - Mazocruz, and is in the business of buying and selling cattle, alpacas, and sheep at the fair in Huacullani on Tuesdays every week. She occasionally also sells beef and alpaca in the Mazocruz fair.

With this loan of S /. New 2000.00 Suns ($700.00 USD), which she plans to repay in 4 months, she wishes to purchase two bulls which she'll fatten up.

Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Tacna, and be near her children who live in that city, where she can continue to work selling more cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Feliciana nació en la Parcialidad de Chullunquiani – Mazocruz, Puno, Tiene 51 años de edad, estudió hasta tercero de primaria, es casada, madre de 8 hijos, vive en la Parcialidad de Chullunquiani. Socia del Banco Comunal Julia Jiménez – Mazocruz, ella se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, alpacas, ovinos en la feria de Huacullani los días martes de cada semana y vende de vez en cuando vende carne de alpaca en la feria de Mazocruz. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, el que pagará en 4 cuotas, tiene planificado comprar 02 toretes para engorde. Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Tacna y estar cerca a sus hijos que viven en esa ciudad, a su vez seguir trabajando con su negocio y vender más cabezas de ganado vacuno.

loans.use: To purchase two bulls. (Compra de 2 toros)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of many goods to restock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
La señora Lucero pertenece al Banco Comunal Auroras en Acción, tiene 38 años de edad y vive en Manuel Cox Manzana 10 lote 7 del pueblo joven Aurora Díaz, distrito Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Cursó hasta el quinto año de secundaria y ya no continuó  estudiando porque se casó. Tiene una hija de 17 años y un hijo de 14.
Se inició vendiendo algunos artículos de primera necesidad, luego fue creciendo gracias a los préstamos que le hacia Manuela Ramos, que al principio los hizo sin que su esposo lo supiera, cuando él se dio cuenta ella había tomado conciencia que como mujer puede ser autónoma y su esposo también lo entendió así. Ahora tiene un puesto en el Mercado Los Luchadores del puerto de Salaverry y es así como esta mujer valerosa surge día a día.
Obtuvo un primer préstamo de 300 soles para devolverlo en 4 cuotas, con este préstamo es que ella hace crecer su negocio.
Con este crédito de 1,200 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en el puesto del mercado Los luchadores.
Su gran sueño es verlos profesionales y felices a sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucero belongs to the Auroras in action community bank. She is 38 years old and lives at 10 Cox Manzana, plot 7 in the village of Aurora Díaz, in the district of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo in the suburb of La Libertado, Perú. She completed through the 5th year of secondary school, but stopped attending school when she got married. Lucero has a 17 year old daughter and a 14 year old son. She began her business by selling basic goods and later grew her business thanks to the loans she obtained through Manuela Ramos. At first, the organization gave her loans without her husband's knowledge, but when he realized Lucero had already proven herself as an autonomous woman, and her husband viewed it the same way. Now Lucero has a booth in the Port Fighters market in Salaverry, and like that this valiant woman works day after day. She obtained her first loan of 300 soles and returned it in 4 months, and with it was able to grow her business. With this 1,200 soles loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in her booth in the Fighters market. Her largest dream is to watch her children to grow up to be happy and professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her booth in the local market

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mr. Ban V. is a villager in Trapeang Som village in Takeo Province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn his living. His wife, Mrs. Long Sreytouch, is a pig breeder. She faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support her business.

In order to deal with this problem, Mr. Ban V. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets and pig feed to support his wife’s business. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 26 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Chek K. is 37 years old and sells fruit in Battambong province. Her business has been around for about five years and she makes US$ 2.50 every day, while her husband is a teacher and makes US$ 2.50 as well to help support the family.

Selling fruit has been a difficult business, as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. Chek K. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to make two investments. She would like to invest US$ 500 to create another business selling beef and pork and also put US$ 500 into her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruits to sell. She sees these investments as opportunities that will help her to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To operate a new business and add more fruits

loans.name: Faaleo

texts.en: Faaleo Leui, 64, is married and has six children.  She has many years of experience in the ice cakes and pancakes business. She sells to the villagers and general public six days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (166 USD).  SPBD loans are Faaleo’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase things to run her ice cake business as mentioned above. Another part of her loan will be used to renovate her home and for her personal use.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer, sugar, cordial, plastic cups, and chinese lollies

loans.name: Sadaina Nakibuye ‘S Group

texts.en:
Sadaina is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 39-year-old married woman with 4 children aged between 13 and 19 years. All her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She rents a one-roomed house where she lives with six people. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a retail shop in Kampala selling bed sheets. Sadaina works six days a week and uses public transport to and from shopping in Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. Sadaina sells to an average of 15 customers a day. Agnes has been in this business for ten years and has been in MCDT for five years, servicing her tenth loan. Her monthly expenses include rent for accommodation and also daily market dues, school fees and food. She wants to buy more things for her shop.

loans.use: To buy  merchandise

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S. is 30-years-old and has a business making shoes to earn a living. He uses the wheel of a big truck to make shoes and sells them at the market. On average, he makes US$4 of profit per day. His wife stays at home doing house work and helps him in this activity when needed. The couple has one little child.

Mr. Mao S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase materials to make more shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more shoes.

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.es: Martha Regina Solís Moreno tiene la edad de 34 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Martha tiene dos varones. La actividad económica de Doña Martha es la venta de productos de limpieza. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica  a este negocio y con los financiamientos obtenidos es que compra los productos  para abastecerse lo suficiente y ofrecerlos a sus clientes. Los propósitos de Doña Martha son de comprar productos en mayor cantidad y disminuir los viajes para conseguir los productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que así podrá comprar los productos solicitados por sus clientes. Los deseos de doña Martha son de conseguir una mejor manera para ofrecer sus productos ya que actualmente la forma en que lo realiza es recorriendo las calles. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Martha Regina Solís Moreno is 34 years old and married. Martha has two sons. Martha sells cleaning products. She has had this business for more than 11 years and with the financing she is buying products to stock her business sufficiently so as to be able to sell to her customers. Martha plans on buy products in large quantities and reduce the number of trips needed to obtain the products. The financing is for working capital so that she can buy the products her customers seek. Martha wishes to find a better way to offer her products because today the way she sells is as a street vendor. She is seeking C$ 5.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia Narda

texts.es:
La señora Julia A. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su actividad de venta de cosméticos en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha sufrido debido a los fenómenos naturales que la han azotad.  

Por esta razón ella nunca ha dudado en acudir a Ceprodel siendo este su apoyo para la compra de los materiales de construcción. Es por esta razón que espera ser beneficiada con un crédito para obtener a lo inmediato los materiales de construcción e invertirlos en su vivienda para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Julia A. is dedicated with much strength to her activity selling cosmetics in her own home in the Somotillo municipality with the purpose of improving the living conditions from which she has suffered because of the natural phenomenoms which have scourged her. For this reason she has never doubted approaching Ceprodel being there for her support to buy construction materials. It's for this reason that she hopes to benefit froma loan to immediately obtain the construction materials and invest them in her home to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Aboudermane

texts.fr: Monsieur A. est un homme marié qui habite le quartier de Kégué, il est père de 02 enfants, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. C’est cette activité qui lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille. Il exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « A. et Fils ».il a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit  qu’il a bien remboursé. Il sollicite un  deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de produits d’alimentation générale par l’achat de 05 cartons de lait liquide, 10 sacs de riz, 04 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 05 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is a married man who lives in the Kégué neighborhood; he is the father of 2 children. His business is selling groceries, and it is this business that allows him to support his family. He tends shop in his own little store that he calls ,«A. et Fils». He has already had one loan from WAGES and has reimbursed it correctly. He is requesting a second loan which will allow him to add to his stock of grocery items by buying 5 cases of liquid milk, 10 sacks of rice, 4 cases of pasta, and so on.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Astou Mbene

texts.fr: ASTOU MBENE F. EEST NEE EN 1963 A THIES.ELLE EST MARIEE ET EST MERE DE JEUNES ENFANTS .SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER POUR REVENDRE DES FRUITS DE MER,DE LA PATE d'arachide et de l'huile de palme.AVEC CE PRET ELLE VEUT RENFORCER SES STOCKS DE PRODUITS POUR MIEUX SATISFAIRE SA CLIENTELE.
texts.en:
Astou Mbene F. was born in 1963 in THIES. She is married and a mother with young children. Her work involves buying and then selling seafood, peanut butter, and palm oil. With this loan, she wants to bolster her stock of goods to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuff

loans.name: Mansur

texts.ru: Мансур - мужчина средних лет 1960 года. Женат и отец 5-х детей. Мансур занимается откормом и продажей скота на скотном рынке. Он закупает скот и продает через месяца 2-3, если найдется хороший клиент. Или продает через неделю или две недели. Мансур закупает скот дешево по 5-10 голов и продает их в розницу подороже. Таким образом Мансур зарабатывает на жизнь и оборачивает свой капитал. Мансур содержит всю семью. Ему помогают сыновья. Мансур кредитуется в нашей организации более 2-х лет. Он всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Мансур благодарен кредитной организации за финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Mansur is a middle-aged man, who is married and has 5 children. He is involved in livestock feeding and sales at the livestock market. He buys livestock and sells it 2-3 months later, if a good client is found. Sometimes he resells the livestock a week or two weeks after purchase. Mansur buys livestock at cheap prices, 5-10 heads at a time and resells them retail at higher prices. Mansur supports his whole family. His sons help out with the business. Mansur has been a borrower at our organization over 2 years. He always has clear goals in how he uses his loans. Mansur is grateful to our organization for the financial assistance.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sales

loans.name: Agua De La Vida Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Agua De La Vida” forma parte de la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace diez años aproximadamente, pertenece al centro focal Los Andes, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con doce miembros y  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
La fundadora del grupo es Susi Díaz, ella formo este grupo con amigos  y familiares. Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar y también universitarios,  diversos son los negocios de este grupo, por ejemplo Verónica se dedica a la venta de ropa para bebes, Susi elabora y vende comida, Martha tienen una librería, Juan José es mecánico, Alejandro  ofrece servicio de Internet, Alicia vende CDs en ferias de la ciudad. Necesitan capital para realizar compras de mercadería al por mayor para mejorar sus ganancias y cumplir con las obligaciones que tienen con sus familias.
texts.en:
The association named “Life Water” has been part of the Pro-Mujer family for approximately ten years; it belongs to the main center Los Andes, located in the city of El Alto. Currently it includes twelve members and they have shown to be an organized group when it comes to their loan payments and internal activities. The founder of the group is Susi Díaz; she created this group with friends and family. Within the group the majority of the members are married women with children, almost all school aged and also university students. The group’s businesses are diverse, for example, Verónica dedicates herself to the sale of clothing for babies, Susi makes and sells food, Martha has a bookstore, Juan José is a mechanic, Alejandro offers Internet services, and Alicia sells CDs in markets in the city. They need capital to purchase wholesale merchandise to improve their earnings and fulfill their obligations to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos Humberto P. M. reside en el municipio de Lourdes Colon departamento La Libertad. Carlos tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Carlitos de 5 años y Cristian de 3 años de edad. Carlos es un padre de familia muy responsable ya que con muchos sacrificios le ha dado a su familia un techo seguro siendo ellos los dueños de su vivienda. Carlos curso hasta la primaria en la escuela pero eso no le ha sido de obstáculo para crear y administrar su propio negocio donde se encarga de la reparación de bicicletas, Carlos solicita este crédito para la compra de materiales básicos que se utilizan frecuentemente en cualquier arreglo de bicicletas.
texts.en:
Carlos Humberto P. M. lives in the Lourdes Colon municipality in the La Libertad department. Carlos, 31, lives with his wife and two sons. Carlitos is five, and Cristian is three. Carlos is a very responsible father. He has made many sacrifices to put a solid roof over their heads; they are the owners of the house. Carlos only attended elementary school, but that has not been an obstacle for him in creating and running his own business. He repairs bicycles. Carlos is asking for this loan to buy basic materials that he uses frequently to repair bicycles.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to repair bicycles

loans.name: Wevina

texts.en:
"Before, I was about to give up when we failed in our business. But opportunity knocked again when CEVI came and gave us capital to support our business. I am a farmer and I am managing a 5-hectare farm with my husband. In as much as we like to grow our business, all we can do is to work harder to achieve an abundant harvest on our farm," says Wevina C., a 50 year old mother of five children. 

Now she would like to ask for a loan worth Php 10,000. She will use the loan to purchase herbicides and insecticides. The loan will truly help, especially in achieving an abundant harvest for the family.

CEVI helps small business grow. She received not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and insecticides

loans.name: Vera Luz

texts.es: Vera Luz G.  N. de 29 años de edad vive en el departamento de  Ahuachapán.  A pesar de su temprana edad, Vera Luz cuida y cría tres hijos todos menores de edad por sí sola. Para mantener a su extensa familia, Vera ha montado en su propia casa, una tienda y venta de ropa, a la que dedica  todo el tiempo diario. Vera solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio, con el objetivo de hacer crecer su tienda, y poder brindar  a sus tres hijos una vida estable y sana.
texts.en:
Vera Luz Garcia N., 29, lives in the "departamento" of Ahuachapan. Despite being still young herself, Vera Luz is raising and caring for three children, all still pre-schoolers, alone. In order to take care of her large family, Vera has set up a shop selling clothes in her house, a business that she operates all day, every day. Vera is applying for a loan so that she can stock her business and, in turn, grow her business and provide her three children with a stable and healthy life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak L. N., age 26, is a widow and has a school-aged child. She lives with her sister and her child in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, she works in a local garment factory, earning approximately US $3 per day. The family is also assisted by her sister who sells various kinds of fruit and grilled corns.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, N. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, N. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $200 to purchase more various kinds of fruit to expand her sister's business. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: buy more fruit

loans.name: God Time Is The Best Group

texts.en:
God Time is the Best is a group of 5 borrowers led by Bandu S.. They live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. Bandu is 28 years old and married with 2 children, ages 4 and 11. She also cares of a child who was orphaned in the war. All of her children are in school. Bandu was unable to attend school, although she enjoyed it, because the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide and, therefore, school was considered unnecessary. She lives in the remote city of Kolahu in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia.

Bandu’s sells gasoline from her roadside stall. She has run her business for 6 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic – she stays open long hours for them.
