She’s taking the loan to increase her inventory of gasoline, which she purchases in Monrovia, to meet the demand of the growing economy. Her dream is to expand her business so that, one day, she can have a full gas station in town. With the profits from her business, Bandu dreams of sending her kids to college.

loans.use: Purchase gasoline wholesale

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Modesta es casada, tiene 57 años y 4 hijos, Modesta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. animales bebes como pato, pollos para crianza, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Modesta necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pollos.
Los sueños D. Modesta son construir su casa.

loans.use: Para la compra de pollos.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 47years old and married with 5 children. She sells furniture wood. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000, to purchase more furniture wood. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make the down payment on a house to qualify for a government loan

loans.name: Maria Carlota

texts.es:
La señora MARIA CARLOTA L. F., tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO. Ella presenta estudios  superiores de educación pero no llegó a ejercer porque al finalizar su carrera quedo embarazada y se dedicó a su hogar y a la crianza de sus hijos. MARIA está casada, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo 1 y su nieto dependen económicamente de ella, es por eso que ella trabaja arduamente elaborando sus manualidades para así poder obtener dinero para las necesidades de su hija, nieto y de ella. La socia se dedica a confeccionar carteras de hilo, muñecos y adornos y con su primer crédito de 300 nuevo soles compro materiales como: hilos, lana, a crochet, algodón, etc. 
Con este crédito de 300 nuevos  volverá a comprar lana, hilos, algodón, telas para realizar los pedidos navideños que tiene que entregar.
MARIA sueña con  tener mas pedidos y así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Carlota L. F. is 52 years old and lives in the district of Salaverry, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She is a member of the ‘Las Empresarias al Exito” communal bank. Maria completed further education but never managed to put it to use; as soon as she finished her studies, she became pregnant and stayed at home to bring up her children. She is married and has three children, but only one of them as well as a grandson is financially dependent on her. They are the reason that she works hard making handicrafts, so that she can earn money to buy necessities for her daughter, her grandson, and herself. Maria makes woven bags, soft toys, and ornaments. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought items such as thread, crochet wool, cotton etc. With this new 300 sole loan she will again buy wool, thread, and material for the Christmas orders that she already has. Her dream is get even more orders and in this way earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wool, thread, cotton, material

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es:
Blanca P. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en el barrio la Calera en la parroquia Baños al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, éste lugar se caracteriza por sus atractivos turísticos como sus aguas termales, su gastronomía  sobre todo las papas con cuy, nuestra socia  tiene 31 años de edad, se encuentra casada y madre de dos hijos uno de 14 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio Daniel Córdova y su último hijo  en la escuela Rincón del Saber unidades educativas de la localidad, su esposo como la mayoría de hombres de la región azuaya emigró al exterior  en busca de un futuro mejor para su familia y gracias  al esfuerzo de su trabajo construyeron su casa propia.

Blanca trabaja en su tienda  de abarrotes desde seis años, su horario de atención es de 6 a.m. a 8 p.m. todos los días en forma ininterrumpida, nos comenta que la ventaja de tener su propio  negocio es ser dueño de su tiempo, ya que si necesita hacer algunas gestiones sólo la cierra y listo.

Este es su ciclo 16 trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación beneficiándose tanto en  su negocio como en su hogar, con el nuevo crédito va a  comprar arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite y más productos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda con todo lo necesario e ir incrementando su negocio poco a poco.

Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca P. is a member of the Communal Bank “El Arenal” (The Sandbox). She lives in the neighborhood of La Calera in the Baños Parrish of southern Cuenca. This area is known for its tourist attractions (such as the thermal springs) and the local cuisine containing guinea pig and all types of potatoes. Blanca is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two children (ages 14 and 8). Her older child is a student at Daniel Córdova High School, while the younger one attends the Rincón del Saber School. Like most men from this region, Blanca’s husband moved abroad in search of a better future for his family. Thanks to his hard work, they will be able to build their own house.

Blanca works at the grocery store she started six years ago. She is open from 6am to 8pm every day without interruption. The advantage of having her own business is being in control of her own schedule. If she needs time to manage issues away from the store, then she can close the business until she is ready to reopen.

Blanca is working on her 16th loan cycle with the Foundation. Her previous loans have benefitted her home, as well as her business. With this new loan, she will buy rice, sugar, salt, oil, and other basic necessities to restock her store and enable her business to grow slowly. Blanca’s goal is to finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities to restock her store

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is forty years old. She is a married mother of five children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. Paulina works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She trades in footwear for both males and females. Paulina sells in her community and also treks to other communities to sell on their market days. Paulina has been in business for nine years and says the loan will help her to expand her business by procuring goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy footwear in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Maye

texts.fr: Madame Maye F. est une commerçante à Bambey, une communauté rurale située à 100km de Dakar.  UIMCEC y a ouvrit une caisse en Juillet 2009 pour mieux servir les clients ruraux.  Elle a pratiqué le commerce grâce à ses amis qui faisaient aussi du commerce  Par rapport aux aspects les plus importants de son métier, Madame F. identifie surtout la connaissance humaine.  Elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter de boubous bazins et des chaussures.  Madame F. est mariée et mère d'enfants majeurs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maye F. is a merchant in Bambey, a rural community located 100 km from Dakar. UIMCEC (Kiva Field Partner) first opened its doors in July 2009 to better serve rural clients. She started as a merchant because her friends also were merchants. Mrs. F. indicates that the most important aspects of her business is by knowing human nature. She is requesting her first loan and she will use it to purchase boubous (loose flowing gowns) and shoes. Mrs. F. is married and is the mother of grown children.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Puca Puca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Puca Puca que significa Rojo Rojo, inicia su tercer ciclo con 18 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, cereales, abarrotes en general, ropa, leña, verduras, animales menores, cosméticos y carpintería.

Como es el caso D. la señora Epifania es casada, tiene 70 años y 4 hijos, Epifania se dedica a la venta D. comida por las tardes frente del puesto D. salud D. su barrio, además viaja a las ferias en donD. compra quesos y cereales que venD. a intermediarios.

Mientras que Jesusa es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Jesusa junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería y también alquilan sus maquinas a obras. Además Jesusa compra y venD. madera.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 450 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 14,050 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. cereales, quesos, ajo, madera, cosméticos, ropa, verduras, leña.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, mejorar su negocio y comprar otra maquina.
texts.en:
The Puca Puca(which means Red Red )Communal bank is starting its third cycle with 18 members. The members have different businesses like the selling food, grains, general groceries, clothing, firewood, vegetables, small animals, cosmetics and carpentry. Like the case of Ms. Epifania, who is married, is 70 years old and has 4 children. She sells food in the afternoons in front of her neighborhood’s health clinic. She also travels to markets to buy cheeses and grains that she sells to middlemen. While Jesusa has a live-in partner, is 39 years old and has 5 children. Jesusa along with her husband have a carpentry workshop and they also rent their machines to construction projects. In addition, Jesusa buys and sells wood. The members need different amounts for their loans like 450 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles which is a total amount of 14,050 soles in loans in the Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of grains, cheese, garlic, wood, cosmetics, clothing, vegetables and firewood. The dreams of the members are to build their houses, improve their businesses and buy other machines.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy grains, cheese, garlic, wood, cosmetics, clothing, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Maymouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maymouna T. habite a Yoff plus précisément dans le quartier de Mbenguenne.Elle est âgée de 64 ans et est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis mars 2001. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 3 prêts antérieurs. Elle est mariée sans enfant mais s’active dans la vente de pomme de terre frite, de jus, de crème et aussi dans la couture. Elle capitalise une expérience d’un peu plus de deux ans. Les coupures intempestives d’électricité sont la principale raison d’arrêt de son activité de couture. Ainsi elle oriente tous ses efforts dans la vente de jus et de frites. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour constituer un stock des éléments qu’elle utilise pour réaliser ses produits (pomme de terre, lait en poudre, sucre). Son objectif est de maximiser ses profits afin qu’elle puisse satisfaire ses besoins personnels et aussi initier des projets futurs ;tout ceci dans le but d’améliorer le cadre de vie familial.

Madame Maymouna a été pris en photo dans sa chambre ici.
texts.en:
Mrs Maimouna T. lives in Yoff, more specifically in the Mbenguenne neighborhood. She is 64 years old and has been a member of the Yoff credit union since March 2001. She already benefited from three previous loans. She is married without children but keeps busy selling French fries, fruit juice and custard. She also has a sewing activity. She counts a little over two years of experience. Untimely power cuts are the main reason for her discontinuing her sewing activity and redirecting all her efforts towards selling juice and fries. Therefore she is requesting a 200,000 francs loan to build up a stock of the ingredients she uses to make her products (potatoes, powdered milk, sugar). Her objective is to maximize profits to fulfill her personal needs and also to initiate future projects; this is all in order to improve her family's living conditions. Madame Malmouna is pictured here in her home.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 58-year-old woman, married, with 5 children. Her children are doing well in school and business. She sells household and gift items like cooking pots, plates and cups. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her experience to attract and retain more customers. She hopes to grow her business. Her greatest challenge in her business is funds and she hopes to overcome this challenge. She is a hard-working woman. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 170,000. She will use these funds to purchase more household and gift items. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more household and gift items to sell.

loans.name: Bugwere 2 Mimuna Nandala Group

texts.en: Kanyago Edith is a businesswoman, 33 years old, single and blessed with four children in school. She has a retail shop business selling charcoal, which she has been doing for over ten years so far. She is using the loan to purchase bags of charcoal from villages to sell at the market place. She is hardworking and her future hope is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
María Elizabeth tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el sector El Cardo del caserío Tongorrape, una zona agrícola del distrito de Motupe, ubicado a una hora y cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años al comercio de abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio nació de la necesidad de contar con una actividad que le genere ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia cuya economía depende de la agricultura, una actividad que no genera ingresos permanentes.

Ella ofrece en su pequeño negocio todo tipo de golosinas y bebidas a sus clientes, este negocio es de mucha utilidad para sus vecinos ya que la zona queda un poco alejada de la ciudad, ella prefiere comprar productos en pequeñas cantidades y siempre viaja a la ciudad de Chiclayo para surtir su negocio con productos frescos, el negocio tiene bastante acogida y ella desea ampliarlo con la compra de una mayor variedad de abarrotes, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Maria Elizabeth es una persona bastante confiable y entregada a su familia. Su anhelo es seguir apoyando a a sus padres en lo que la necesiten. Ella es muy estimada por las personas que la conocen y por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
María Elizabeth is 25 years old, single and lives with her parents in the area of El Cardo of the city of Tongorrape, an agricultural zone in the district of Motupe, located an hour and 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has made a living for the past four years selling groceries out of a small convenience store installed in her home. The business started out of the necessity to find an activity to generate income to solve personal expenses and support her family, whose finances depend on agriculture, which isn't permanent income. At her small business, she offers all kinds of snacks and drinks to her customer. This is very useful to her neighbors since the area is located a little ways outside of the city. She prefers to buy products in small quantities and always travels to the city of Chiclayo to stock her business with fresh products. The business has been well-received, and she wishes to expand it by purchasing a wider variety of groceries. For this, she has requested for the first time from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1500 soles to achieve her objective. María Elizabeth is a very reliable person who is devoted to her family. Her goal is to keep supporting her parents. She is very highly regarded by people who know her and her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school. She rents a one-room house where she stays with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Resty takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family. Resty owns a store where she sells charcoal and doesn’t pay rent because she sells from her home. She sells to all categories of people at retail only. She works seven days a week. Resty receives at least 25 customers a day. She has been in this business for 14 years and her business challenges include seasonality and the rainy season. She has been with MCDT for a few years servicing her 10th loan.  She wants to use this loan to increase her stock by buying more crates of beer and Jerry cans of local gin. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and own a fully stocked bar. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani C. is a 36-year-old woman from the village of Midsapinit, Gingoog City. Lani is married and has 3 school-age children. To earn a living, Lani owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. More specifically, her primary source of income is derived from planting and harvesting coconuts and bananas for sale. Lani has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Lani joined HSPFI to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she hopes to be able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living. Lani is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lani from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra G. V., tiene la edad de 45 años, es soltera y vive con sus dos hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos para ofrecer en su minisuper. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Mayra G. V. is 45 years old and single. She lives with her two children, ages 14 and 18. She wants the loan to buy inventory for her business. She wants to have more ample inventory and a variety of products to sell in her small super-market. She sells groceries. She started this business several years ago, and she has many good customers. She needs to offer them a greater variety of products in her business. She also needs greater income for her household. This is her first loan with Fudescosur, and she is very grateful for the ease of the loan. In the future she hopes to give her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. She also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
In the small town of Hoima in Uganda there lives a 41-year-old man named Zaki. He is the father of seven children. He is a proud poultry farmer while his wife deals in local brew so as to maximize avenues for family income.

Despite the challenges of substandard chicken feeds on the market, Zaki says he intends to enlarge his farm to a bigger one because the poultry business is so gainful for him.

Having visited some other poultry farmers across the district, Zaki has decided to access this loan to buy chicks and feeds of better quality to boost his farm.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feeds of better quality

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn S. is from the village of Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 34 years old, married, and has three school-aged children.

Babylyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling mongo in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Babylyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her monggo production. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her mongo production

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou  L. is a 39-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Prk. Kanipa-an, Brgy. Punao, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental.  

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP6,000. 

Marilou is borrowing PHP 20,000 for more inventory. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Marilou  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Clara Aurora

texts.es:
Nicaragua es un país con muchas bellezas naturales, con una población carismática y creativa. En 1990 Clara Auro M.  cosía a domicilio y con las ganancias empezó a comprar sus maquinarias y herramientas como tijeras, agujas, cintillo etc. 
En la actualidad M. de 54 años tiene un pequeño taller de costura clase B según la alcaldía de Managua e invertirá en un proyecto que consiste en la realización de ropa típica la cual comercializara fuera del país. 
Esta señora sueña con que su taller cerca y un día hacer una pasarela con sus diseños.
texts.en:
Nicaragua is a country with natural beauty and with a charismatic and creative population. In 1990, Clara began sewing at home and with the earnings, bought machines and supplies like scissors, needles, decorative ribbons, etc. Now, Clara is 54 years old and operates a small sewing workshop (Class B, according to the Managua mayor's office) and she wants to make additional investments in the project, which designs and makes traditional clothing to be sold outside the country. Clara dreams that someday her shop can be closer and her designs can be shown at a fashion show.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTH, THREAD, AND DECORATIVE MATERIALS FOR HER SEWING CREATIONS

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Actualmente, Oscar vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde la mayoría de sus vecinos y amigos se dedican al turismo.  Hace muchos años atrás vivía en la ciudad de Urubamba donde tenía una ferretería y tuvo que cerrar porque había mucha competencia y no había muchos clientes. 

Decidido a empezar una nueva vida, Oscar se mudo a Ollantaytambo, donde tenía algunos amigos y familiares lejanos quienes le motivaron para abrir una tienda. Utilizó el dinero de la liquidación  de la ferretería para abrir una nueva tienda en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo, donde vende pintura, cemento, clavos, chapas, lijas y muchas cosas más. Hace diez años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio y con los beneficios que obtiene saca adelante a sus tres hijos. 

Oscar en un padre responsable y trabajador que desprende una imagen de experiencia y profesionalidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su tienda pero por los meses de marzo las ventas estaban bajas debido a las lluvias que cayeron en la ciudad. Oscar pertenece al banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” y es uno de los fundadores, con su próximo préstamo, Oscar espera recibir $300 y le gustaría implementar su ferretería y desea comprar focos ahorradores, clavos y accesorios eléctricos. El sueño de Oscar es abrir otra ferretería en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo.
texts.en:
Oscar currently lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, where most of his neighbors and friends work in the field of tourism. Many years ago, he lived in the city of Urubamba, where he had a hardware store. He had to close it because there was a lot of competition and he did not have many customers. Determined to start a new life, Oscar moved to Ollantaytambo, where he had some friends and distant family members who encouraged him to open a store. He used the money from the liquidation of his hardware store to open a new store in the city of Ollantaytambo, where he sells paint, cement, nails, metal sheets, sandpaper, and much more. He has operated this business for ten years, and it is going very well for him, thanks to the dedication he puts into the business. With the benefits he obtains from his work, he has helped his three children get ahead. Oscar is a responsible and hard-working father who presents an image of experience and professionalism. A regular flow of customers visits his store, but his sales are low in the month of March, due to the rains that fall in the city. Oscar belongs to the communal bank called “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” ["The Friendship of Ollantaytambo"], and he is one of the founders. With his next loan, Oscar hopes to receive $300, and he would like to improve his hardware store. He wants to buy energy-saving lightbulbs, nails and electrical accessories. Oscar's dream is to open another hardware store in the city of Ollantaytambo.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying energy-saving lightbulbs, nails and electrical accessories

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es: El Bancomunal Santo Domingo inicia su ciclo 38 con 13 socias que pertenecen al departamento D. Huancavelica. Saturnina es una D. la socias del Bancomunal, es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos el mayor D. 23 años y el menor D. 12, todos están estudiando actualmente, Saturnina tiene una cevicheria que atienD. en un puesto en el mercado D. la localidad, se inicio en el negocio con poco capital, poco a poco lo está implementando, con los préstamos que recibe compra los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación, pero también invierte en la compra D. utensilios como platos, cubiertos, su negocio está creciendo es por ello que Saturnina quiere ahorrar para ampliar su local y comprar sus muebles e implementar su negocio con otros platillos a base D. pescado.
texts.en:
The Santo Domingo community bank begins it’s 38th cycle with 13 members that belong to the Huancavelica department. Saturnina is one of the members, has a partner and six children, her oldest is 23 years old and her youngest is 12, they are all studying. Saturnina owns and works at a ceviche (seafood dish) shop that is located in the local market. She started this business with little capital but has slowly grown it with the loans that she gets she buys the necessary ingredients but also invests it in utensils such as plates and cutlery. Her business is growing and Saturnina wants to save to expand the shop and buy furniture as well as to incorporate other fish based dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is married with a grown son. She is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye, where she sells footwear and clothing merchandise in one of the local markets. Moreover, Lidiya owns a second vending pavilion in the same neighborhood. She can be characterized as a determined and hard-working entrepreneur with a vision for consistent growth of her business. Lidiya has been in the trade for 13 years. Currently, she has invested 25,000 Grivnyas in this business. Her gross income is about 13,000 Grivnyas. 

Lidiya is requesting a loan of 6,900 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise for her vending locations. She loves her job and is hoping to grow both professionally and economically.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy joven Maribel incursiono en el negocio de los tejidos artesanales, trabajando para otras personas logro mantener a su familia, ahora ella se ha comprado sus propias maquinas de tejer y trabaja a pedido. Su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual cada vez tiene mas pedidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite estar junto a sus hijos mientras cumple con sus pedidos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todos los días sin descanso para alcanzar su meta. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más maquinas para poder incrementar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socias muy alegre, por lo cual es muy querida dentro del grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de tejidos que elabora.
texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Maribel is a simple, hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 3 dear children, to whom Maribel wishes to give a better quality of life. Since she was very young, Maribel worked at the business of craftwork weaving, working for others to support her family. Now she has purchased her own weaving machines and works to fill the requests she receives. Her work is very high quality; for this reason she always has more requests. She likes her work because she is able to stay with her children as she fills requests. She has done this work for 10 years and considers tha most difficult part of the work that she must work every day without rest to reach her goal. In time, she would like to buy more machines to increase production. This is her eighth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma (local lending institution), and she feels capable of making her payments on time. She is a very cheerful member of her village bank and is therefore well-liked within the group. With the 2000 nuevos soles ($725) requested, she will buy more wool to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool for use in weaving.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia B. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Lucrecia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lucrecia owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Lucrecia has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lucrecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucrecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lucrecia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erusmus

texts.en:
Erusmus is 63 years old, married and blessed with six adult-aged children. One of his children is currently attending school. He is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been farming for the last 30 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces milk, coffee, french beans and bananas, which are all sold locally. He also depends on his pension pay to provide for his family's basic needs.
Erusmus has requested a loan of 63,600 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this dairy cow will improve his family's income through the sale of milk and this will improve their livelihood. His biggest challenge has been the lack of a sustainable market and fluctuating milk prices. He hopes to improve his dairy farming by buying three quality dairy cows in future.
Erusmus comments that through Juhudi's projects, the farmers will be able to grow their businesses. With this trend, the creation of wealth will be a possibility and not a faraway dream.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: María Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. María A. es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, cuenta con varios lugares turísticos los que se encuentran a poco tiempo de la ciudad, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía. Cuenca es especial por su gente la que lleva su cultura y tradición.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a vender bisutería, inicia sus actividades desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.  Viaja a la ciudad de Machala para comprar la mercadería.

Doña María tiene 46 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando pero tiene una vida estable económicamente.

Es socia de la Fundación Espoir y de la banca comunal hace 10 años beneficiándose de los créditos en la ampliación de negocio,  el nuevo crédito que realiza lo va  a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como aretes, manillas, etc. Su meta es  crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María A. is a member of the María Reina de la Paz (Mary, Queen of Peace) communal bank.  She lives in Totoracocha, Cuenca.  This city is well known thanks to its beautiful city center.  It has several tourist attractions not too far away and quite a varied gastronomy.  Cuenca is made special by its people who preserve its culture and tradition.

She sells costume jewelry from 8am until 4pm.  She travels to the city of Machala to buy her merchandise.

María is 46 years old and has four children.  She doesn’t own a house so lives in a rented house.  However, her life is economically stable.

She has been an associate of Fundación Espoir and communal banking for ten years.  She has taken out loans to expand her business.  The new loan she’s negotiating will be used to buy more merchandise like: earrings, bracelets, etc.  Her goal is to grow greatly in her business.

loans.use: To buy earrings, rings, bracelets and costume jewelry in general.

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en: Leonilo B. is from the village of Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 43 years old. Leonilo is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Leonilo plants and harvests rice for sale. Leonilo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 22,000 Philippines peso (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Leonilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Leonilo is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Leonilo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 36 años, está casada con Víctor, de 43 años. Producto de su gran amor nació Erika, de 17 años de edad. En unión familiar los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Junto a su esposo Víctor, desde hace 13 años, se dedican a la agricultura. En todo este tiempo su principal cultivo consta de producción de café. Una vez al mes viaja a la ciudad de La Merced, para vender su producción a los principales acopiadores de la región. Pero no solo a eso se dedica Mercedes, ella también tiene un pequeño restaurante donde vende comida típica del lugar, su exquisita comida y buena sazón durante estos 6 años, garantizan su buena venta y ganancia. Por ello más adelante desea expandir su negocio. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo agradece los consejos de su banco comunal, que le apoyan en el logro de sus objetivos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra, de 40 sacos de abono orgánico, para sus más de 4 hectáreas de café.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 36 years old. She is married to Victor, who is 43 years old. Their daughter, Erika, is 17 years old. The three of them live together in their own house, which is located in the town of Sanchirio (in the central jungle of Peru). 

She and her husband, Victor, have been working in agriculture for 13 years. Their main crop during this time has been coffee. Once a month she goes to the city of La Merced to sell her production to the main buyers in the region. But this isn’t Mercedes’ only business; she also has a small restaurant where she sells foods typical of the area. The excellent, well made food she has been making for the past 6 years guarantees good sales and profits. She would like eventually to expand her business. 

This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is grateful for the advice that has been provided by her communal bank because it has helped her achieve her goals. She has decided to use the loan to buy 40 sacks of organic fertilizer for her more than 4 hectares of coffee.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer for her more than 4 hectares of coffee plants.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta R. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has 8 children. Her eldest child is 27 years old while the youngest is only 6 years old. Five of her children are still in school and Restituta works hard to sustain their education.

To make a living, Restituta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Restituta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Restituta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam has just an elementary school education but through KIEDF has learned to manage her business and price her jewelry so that it draws business and ensures her family a worthwhile profit. She has become a wise businesswoman. Miriam began her business buying pieces of jewelry and fixing them for resale. At first she worked in gold but the cost proved too high. She switched to buying silver and ever since has gained a large clientele and an excellent reputation. Miriam's business model is to create the products and bring them to her customers in their homes, businesses or at special events. This has proven effective in building her client base and ensuring a steady income. Now she sells silver pieces she has purchased and fixed, as well as some pieces she designs and creates on her own. 

Miriam is taking out this loan to purchase additional raw materials and jewelry to increase her stock and meet additional demand. Miriam wants to take a jewelry design course so she can begin to create more of her own pieces. She wants to create a jewelry line of her own to answer the needs of women in her area. Miriam is an extremely strong woman. She supports her family completely with her income. Before KIEDF, she did not think she could open a business, but now, she cannot imagine not having hers.

loans.use: To stock jewelry pieces

loans.name: Rosa Benilda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la Fundación Espoir. Tiene 62 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta  relación tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero dos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, legumbres en el mercado. Trabaja los días domingos  desde las 4am hasta las 14h00, trabaja sola pero en el mismo mercado también su marido trabaja vendiendo plátano, los productos los compran  a agricultores que llevan sus productos a entregar a los comerciantes al por mayor. Ella además de vender los domingos en el resto de la semana se dedica a lavar ropa ajena.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar legumbres y plátano para el negocio del esposo. Su sueño es tener una gran tienda en su casa y por sobre todo salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the '11 de Septiembre' (September 11th) community bank meets in the town of Carapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Rosa is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it for the benefits that Fundación Espoir provide.  Rosa is 62 years old.  She lives with her partner and has six children who are now grown up, although two still live with her.  Her husband is a salesman.

Rosa sells vegetables in the market.  She works on Sundays from 4.00am to 2.00pm.  She works alone but her husband also works in the same market selling bananas.  They buy their products from farmers who bring their products to deliver to salespeople wholesale.  As well as selling in the market on Sundays, during the rest of the week she washes other people's clothes.

Rosa will use this new loan to buy vegetables and also bananas for her husband's business.  Her dream is to have a large store in her home and, above all, to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and bananas

loans.name: Aida Sy

texts.fr: Madame Aida Sy S. vit   à Diack Sao, une des   localités environnantes de Bambilor. Elle a 45 ans. Depuis plus de 10 ans elle exerce l’achat et la vente de lait frais, lait caillé et œufs  frais. Elle  a démarré son activité depuis qu’elle a rejoint le domicile conjugal. L’objectif recherché était de parvenir à satisfaire ses  besoins  personnels. Madame S. est membre du guichet de Bambilor depuis juillet 2010. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour acheter des produits destinés  a renforcer son commerce. Son souhait est d’augmenter son épargne.
texts.en: Mrs. Aida Sy S. lives in Diack Sao, one of the surrounding districts of Bambilor. She is 45 years old. For the past 10 years she has been buying and selling fresh milk, cheese curds, and fresh eggs. She started out her business when she moved into her husband's home. Her objective was to provide for her personal needs. Mrs. S. has been a member of the communal bank Bambilor since 2010. She has never had a loan through this organization. She requests a loan of 100 000 FRS in other to purchase products to supplement her business. Her wish is to increase her savings.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Tekove Porâ Rekávo Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Blás de Rosado de la cuidad de Caacupé.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Rafaela C., vive con sus hijos, ella trabaja vendiendo tortas, helados y todo tipo de comestibles, por ello solicita el crédito para aumentar su negocio.
Ella y sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les están brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
Las señoras  están en el primer ciclo con sus 10 integrantes.
texts.en:
The women of this group all come from the San Blás de Rosado neighborhood in the city of Caacupé.

The group president is Ms. Rafaela C.. She lives with her two children and works selling sandwiches, ice cream, and all types of foodstuffs. She is requesting this loan in order to expand her business.

She and her fellow group members are very satisfied with the financial support that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva have given them.

These women are in the first loan cycle with 10 group members.

loans.use: Purchase ice cream, drinks, fruit, bread, vegetables, dairy products, and meat

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora V. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 65 years old. Leonora is widowed. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, detergent & bread in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: María es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “DIOS ES AMOR”  es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, trabaja como vendedora ambulante D. frutas,  gaseosas y confitería en la zona D. corcona hace mas D. 20 años, ella se inicio junto a sus hermanas con el afán D. obtener ganancias ya que el transitan viajeros al centro del país.  María invertirá en la compra D. frutas D. estación como duraznos. tunas, uvas y manzanas para vender a buen precio. Ella desea mejorar su vivienda y que su hijo menor culmine sus estudios. Si tuviera más capital invertiría en apertura una bodega en su casa. La Alcancía  Comunal “Dios es Amor”    tiene 12 integrantes que se dedican al comercio informal y denominaron su asociación así por ser creyentes D. Dios. Están entusiastas D. participar por primera vez en el programa y agradecen la oportunidad brindada. En la fotografía apreciamos a tres niños sus padres tuvieron que traerlos porque no cuentan con el apoyo D. familiares a fin D. cuidarlos
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Dios es Amor" ("God is Love") communal bank. She is a single mother with 5 children and works as street vendor. She has been selling fruits, soft drinks and sweets in the Corcona area for over 20 years. She started with her sisters in order to make a profit, as the area is in the route that travellers take to get to the centre of the country. 

Maria will invest in the purchsae of seasonal fruit such as peaches, pears, grapes and apples, which she will sell at a good price. She wants to improve her home and for her youngest son to finish school. If she had more capital she would invest it in opening a store in her house.

The "Dios es Amor" communal bank has 12 members who work in informal traD. and gave this name to the association because they believe in God. The are keen to participate in the program for the first time and are grateful for this opportunity. In the picture you can see three children whose parents had to bring them along on the day as they cannot be looked after by family members.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as peaches, pears, grapes and apples.

loans.name: Bermet's Group

texts.en:
Bermet A., 53, is the leader of this group. She and her husband, a pensioner, have a small dairy business. They have had to work hard their entire lives, mostly in low-skilled, physically exhausting jobs. They dreamed of having a dairy farm of their own and living peacefully, watching after the livestock and drinking fresh milk.

Ten years ago, the couple's dream showed the first signs of becoming a reality. They saved sizable funds and bought their first dairy cow. This purchase was very overwhelming and meaningful for Bermet’s belief and motivation. Now the business has several heads of cattle and generates a profit of 2,000 KGS monthly and up to 3-4 liters of milk daily, which is further sold for 11 KGS per liter. It’s been ten years since the start of the business, and the couple helped organize a nice wedding ceremony for their daughter. Bermet's short term goals include purchasing 2 sheep in order to diversify the household. Bermet believes in Kiva lenders’ assistance to reach this goal. Bermet's long-term goal and big wish is to build a big shed for her cattle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Naiyanoi Ene

texts.en:
Naiyanoi Ene M. K. is a 37-year-old married lady with six children. Three of her children are still attending school. For the past six years, Naiyanoi has been in the agriculture business.

Naiyanoi is applying for her first loan from KADET. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs. Naiyanoi hopes to generate an income with her loan that she will use to build a permanent house. In the future, Naiyanoi desires to improve her life and she hopes to see her children prosper.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Margarita Del Socorro

texts.es: Margarita del Socorro se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene 42 años, ella es una persona responsable que disfruta de tener un medio de vida. Inicio su actividad comercializando con pocos productos, tiene más de 9 años en este medio de vida. Es una persona muy trabajadora ella se levanta todos los días temprano pues sabe que tiene que alistarse con su bolso para salir a ofrecer cada uno de sus productos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de camisas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, trajes de baño, calzado, cosméticos y tratamientos.
texts.en: Margarita works selling general goods including clothes. She is 42 years old and she is a responsible person who enjoys earning a living. She started her business selling only a few products. She has been earning her living this way for 9 years. She is a very hardworking person and she gets up early everyday because she knows that she has to get ready with her bag to go out and sell every one of her products. The purpose of the loan is to buy shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, swim suits, shoes, cosmetics, and treatments.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, swim suits, shoes, cosmetics, and treatments.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a married man with two children, one of whom attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a video hall business. His potential customers are local neighbours and workers from Coast coconut farms. Hussein dreams of providing the best possible service to his clients in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase furniture, fans and chairs for his video hall. He decided to work with Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture, fans and chairs for his video hall.

texts.ar: فداء في عمر 39 سنة متزوجة وهي ام ل3 اولاد تعمل في بيع الالبسة والاحذية محل لها في عملها 10 سنوات تحب العمل وتعتمد على نفسها في تربية الاولاد والاهتمام بحاجاتهم ودفع مصاريف تعليمهم تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة موسمية للصيف البسة واحذية حتى تزيد من البضاعة في محلها خاصة انها تتعرض لمنافة قوية في محيطها العملي فهي تريد ان تساعد نفسها في تخطي هذه المصاعب المادية التي تقف دون تطور العمل فهي تتميز بالعمل الجيد وملاحقة التطور وتمتلك جميع انواع الالبسة الرجالية والنسائية والولادية
texts.en: Fidaa is 39 years old and married with 3 children. She works in a clothes and shoes store and has been doing this for 10 years. She loves her business and independently raises her children, fulfils their needs and pays for their education. With this loan she wants to purchase new seasonal stock for the summer season, both clothes and shoes, so that she can increase her stock size. This is especially because she suffers from a lot of competition in her local area and she wants to help herself overcome the financial difficulties that are holding back the development of her business. She is distinguished for her unique business which is constantly being developed, and she stocks all types of men's, women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Angelita has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of blouses & underwear. Angelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Angelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more blouses & underwear to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is an entrepreneur from Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. She lives in this predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine and sells seeds, fertilizers and polyethylene film to local farmers who run small farms with greenhouses. Olga and her husband started their small business 11 years ago. Since then they have already invested about 200,000 Grivnyas in the venture and have three vending locations. 

This business is the only source of income for Olga and her family. One of her long-term plans is to continue expanding and to add agricultural machinery to their inventory, e.g. mini-tractors and other equipment. Olga is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds and fertilizers for sale in the second farming season. She is going to use part of the income to pay for her son's college tuition.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for sale in the second farming season

loans.name: Reyna Marlene

texts.es: Reyna Marlene de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija la cual asiste a una escuela cercana de la localidad. Ella posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; Reyna es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando luchando por salir adelante. Para Reyna el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Reyna tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
Reyna Marlene is 36 years old.  She lives with her life’s companion and her daughter who goes to school nearby.  She sells clothes in assorted styles for everyone: women, men, boys and girls.  The clothes she sells are of very good quality and she sells them at affordable prices.  Because of this, she’s attained quite a few customers lately.

Reyna is very active and is always working to get ahead.  For Reyna, the purposefulness and courage she puts into her work is directed toward the business’ growth in order to attain a better future.  This is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy a variety of clothes like skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, suits, etc. so that she will always be able to meet customer demand.  Reyna hopes that she will be able to provide her family with economic security and a fulfilled life this way.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts and suits.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a determined 32-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been selling beauty products for the last four years to earn her living. She wants, in the next five years, to have a big clientele and open another outlet of her business. She had earlier taken a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings, which she has repaid. She is now requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy health and beauty products.

loans.use: To buy health and beauty products

loans.name: Meliton

texts.es: Melitón tiene 40 años, convive con sabina de 32, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos. Juntos residen en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sta. Rosa Alta del distrito de Sivia. Desde hace 15 años,  Melitón decidió incursionar en la actividad agrícola, específicamente en el  cultivo de café, con el fin de tener un sustento económico y ofrecer bienestar a su familia. Actualmente esta contento con el trabajo que realiza, ya que desde siempre le ha gustado la agricultura. Recuerda que empezó con una pequeña parcela de cultivo, hoy en día tiene buenas extensiones de terreno, y estos gracias al esfuerzo y tenacidad que lo caracteriza. Por otro lado su esposa e hijos siempre la apoyan, pero en tiempos de cosecha necesita de algunos peones que le puedan facilitar la extracción de sus frutos. Usualmente lo que cosecha los lleva al distrito de Sivia, para que los pueda vender a un precio competitivo. En el futuro piensa adquirir más terrenos con el propósito de aumentar su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, contratará peones para que le ayuden en limpiar su parcela de la maleza que crece y perjudica sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Meliton is 40 and lives with Sabina who is 32.  They have 2 children together. They reside in their own home located in the community of Santa Rosa Alta, District of Sivia. For 15 years, Meliton decided to enter farming, specifically the cultivation of coffee, to have a livelihood and provide for his family. He is happy with the work he has done, as he always liked farming. 

Meliton remembers when he began with a small plot of crops, and today he has large tracts of land, which he acquired through effort and tenacity.  His wife and children will always help him, but in harvest times he needs some laborers that can help in the process of extracting the fruit. Usually he takes the harvest to the Sivia district, so he can sell at a competitive price. In the future, Meliton plans to acquire more land in order to increase production. 

This is Meliton's second loan with MFP, and he agrees to be prompt in paying his dues. With the 3,000 soles requested, he will hire laborers to assist him in clearing his land of  growing weeds that damage his crops.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Aristides es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Callayuc que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Aristides es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra café, es un producto que se consume diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive  y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares.  También elabora aguardiente (bebida que se extrae de la caña de azúcar), luego la vende a los pobladores de la misma zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 700 nuevos soles para comprar media hectárea de terreno para seguir sembrando café, con la finalidad de tener una buena cantidad de café para comercializarlo a un buen precio y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Jaime es una persona que se preocupa por que su negocio crezca para que tenga algunas comodidades y seguir apoyando a sus padres en los gastos diarios.
texts.en:
Aristides is 23 and the head of the household.  He lives in his parent's house, which only has electricity, and is located in the rural area of Callayuc, in Cajamarca department.  This area is characterized by farming, livestock-raising and tourism. 

Aristides farms on his own land, where he grows coffee, a product that is consumed daily. Once he harvests his crop, he sells it at the different markets in the area where he lives. In this way he is able to cover his family's costs. He also makes aguardiente (an alcoholic drink extracted from sugar cane), and sells it to people living in the same area.  

He has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan through Capital Semilla of 700 nuevos soles. He will use it to buy a half hectare of land to continue growing coffee.  His aim is to have a good amount of coffee to sell, at a good price, and thereby improve his quality of life.

Aristides is a person who cares about making his business grow, so that he can have a few comforts in life, and continue supporting his parents with  their daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy a half hectare of land to continue  growing coffee.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: El Sr. Ernesto trabaja en una maquiladora de operador como auxiliar de supervisor, percibiendo un sueldo bajo, por lo que su esposa lo apoya vendiendo ropa usada y aparatos eléctricos para poder sobrevivir y darles un buena calidad de vida, tienen  dos hijos pequeños, y tiene la necesidad de poner una barda y así darle  mas seguridad a su familia , ya que desde que le otorgaron la vivienda no habían podido llevar a cabo su proyecto, en el futuro ellos esperan empezar a levantar la barda lateral ya que colinda con su vecino y no hay división alguna entre ambas casas.
texts.en: Ernesto works in a factory as a assistant supervisor machine operator. His salary is low and his wife helps him by selling used clothes and appliances in order to survive and have a good quality of life. He has two young children and he needs to put up a fence to afford his family better security. Since he was granted the house they weren't able to finish the project. In the future they hope to put up a side fence since it abuts the neighbor's property and there is no division between the two houses.

loans.use: to put a fence up at his house.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 45 years old and is married with six children aged between 4 and 25 years old. Her business is well-organized and is well known in the business of sewing sweaters. Her business hours are from 7am until 6pm every day except on Sunday. She has two years of experience. 

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying new machines for her sewing. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future. Jeanne hopes also to pay school fees for her children with her profits.

loans.use: To purchase new machines for her sewing business.

loans.name: Marvin Manuel

texts.es:
Marvin, de 50 años de edad, originario de Posoltega una comunidad localizada en el departamento de Chinandega, pero vive en Leo el esta casado, es padre de 3 hijos, el es comerciante, dueño de un molino. El aprendió a desarrollarse en el mundo del comercio desde muy joven cuando ayudaba a su padre a vender granos básicos. El adquirió el negocio del molino por medio de un tío que le dejo este negocio de herencia, lleva 25 años con su negocio de molinos.
El realizo el préstamo para comprar un motor estacionario para su molino. Ya que actualmente le están haciendo un molino de 3 maquinas pero necesita su motor y el préstamo le ayudaría a conseguirlo. A el le gustaría abrir mas puestos de molinos para poder expandirse mas y poder empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Marvin, 50, is originally from Posoltega, a community located in Chinandega Department, but he lives in Leo.  He’s married and the father of three children.  He’s a merchant; he owns a mill.  He learned how to develop in the world of commerce since he was very young and helped his father sell basic grains.  He acquired the milling business from an uncle who left him the business as an inheritance.  He’s been in the milling business for 25 years.

He took out the loan to buy a stationary motor for his mill.  He is having a three-machine mill made but it needs its motor and the loan will help him acquire it.  He’d like to open more milling stands to expand more and be able to employ more people.

loans.use: para comprar un motor estacionario para su molino to buy a stationary motor for his mill.

loans.name: Luis Orlando

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 45 años casado y tiene dos hijas de 17 y 11 años y un hijo de 15 años. Su esposa Zoila es una mujer de 47 años. Viven en un barrio central del cantón  "Atuntaqui".

Atuntaqui es una ciudad de 21 000 habitantes ubicada en la provincia de Imbabura, en la región norte de Ecuador, aunque el nombre propio del sector es Antonio Ante, quienes lo visitan o han escuchado hablar de él lo identifican más como Atuntaqui, nombre de varios significados a través de la historia. Atuntaqui ha sido catalogado como centro industrial de la moda. Las ferias industrial y artesanal que se realizan los viernes y domingos constituyen una vitrina de la producción textil, donde se expone al visitante variedad de artículos en diferente calidad y diseño. 

Luis junto a su esposa Zoila son agricultores, pero Luis también trabaja como chofer de un vehículo. Ambos quieren comprar un terreno para cultivar sus productos ya que es una actividad que lo han realizado desde que son niños. Han reunido dinero para comprar dicho terreno pero la parte que aún les falta la financiarán con un crédito.

Ellos creen que con esta inversión no solo cumplirán un sueño sino que además esto asegura de alguna manera su futuro y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis is 45 years old and married.  He has two daughters aged 17 and 11 and one son aged 15.  His wife, Zoila, is 47 years old.  The family live in a central neighborhood of 'Atuntaqui' canton.

Atuntaqui is a town of 21,000 inhabitants, located in Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador. Although the area's real name is Antonio Ante, those who visit the area or have heard of it refer to it most often as Atuntaqui, a name with several meanings throughout history.  Atuntaqui has been listed as an industrial center of the fashion industry.  The industrial markets and craft markets that take place on Fridays and Sundays are a showcase of textile production.  They display for the visitor a range of items of different qualities and designs.

Luis and his wife Zoila are farmers but Luis also works as the driver of a vehicle.  They would both like to buy a plot of land to grow crops on as this is an activity they have carried out since they were children.  They have put together some of the money they need to buy this plot of land and they will take out a loan to cover the part that they are still missing.

Luis and his wife believe that this investment will enable them not only to fulfil a dream but also to guarantee their own future and that of their children.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Corcona Group

texts.es:
L. Alcancía Comunal “Las Emprendedoras D. Corcona” es un Nuevo grupo conformado por 07 socios entusiastas que se comprometen desD. ahora  a trabajar bien con el Programa- Prosperidad.
Raquel tiene 21 años D. edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo. Anteriormente Raquel se dedicaba  a L. venta ambulatoria D. golosinas y confiterías, con el nacimiento D. su hijo tuvo que suspender sus actividades momentáneamente, pero con los deseos D. seguir trabajando y aportar con los gastos hogar empezó un nuevo negocio donD. lleva 8 meses dedicándose a L.  venta D.  productos D. belleza, L. cual trabaja sobre pedidos, negocio que le genera ganancias y le permite estar con su hijo. El deseo D. Raquel es D. instalar una tienda en su domicilio donD.  pueda trabajar sin descuidarse D. su pequeño. Con el crédito que solicito va a comprar algunos víveres para su hogar y  productos para su negocio como talco, colonias, cremas, entre otros y D. esta manera tener productos que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes. L. Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Las Emprendedoras D. Corcona” agradecen el crédito brindado. Sonia no pudo estar presente por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Emprendedoras D. Corcona" (The Entrepreneurs of Corcona) is a new group of seven enthusiastic members who promise henceforth to work well with the Prosperity Program.

Raquel is 21 years old and is in a common-law marriage, with one son. In the past Raquel worked as a walking vendor of candies and sweets. With the birth of her son, she had to suspend her activities briefly, but with a desire to continue working and contribute to the household expenses, she began a new business. For eight months she has worked in the sale of beauty products. She sells by taking orders, and the business generates earnings for her and allows her to be with her son. Raquel's wish is to set up a store in her house, where she can work without neglecting her little one. With the loan that she is applying for, she is going to buy some provisions for her home and products for her business, such as talcum, colognes, and creams, among other items, and in this way she will have products to offer her customers. 

The new communal bank "Las Emprendedoras do Corcona" is grateful for the credit being offered. Sonia could not be present for the picture because of work.

loans.use: to buy provisions and products such as talcum, colognes, and creams.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran is 59 years old with six children. She is a rice farmer and she is also a teacher. She has been farming on her farmland for 19 years. 

Saran has been with VisionFund since 2010. She requested a loan from VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yield to have more income for her family, so that she can have some savings and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is 45 years old and married.  He devotes himself full-time to taking care of his corn farm business. 

When the harvest comes, his hard work means that he can sell good quality products to increase his net profits. His monthly income is about PHP 30,000 every season (every five months).  He has 25 years of experience in this field.  

His wife manages their hog-raising business and earns additional income to help meet their daily needs. 

Gregorio is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farm business. 

He hopes to increase his crop production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farm business.

loans.name: Bros

texts.en:
Bros, 39, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. 

Bros is a blacksmith, and his wife produces brooms to sell. This couple works so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family expenses. 

Bros is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, he is able to save on transportation costs. 

In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Jamiyan

texts.en: Mr. Jamiyan, age 29, sells electronics in a supermarket called “Bumbugur,” and he lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been in this business since 2000 and has gained enough experience in his business field. He usually obtains his inventory from a certified Japanese electronics distributor. Lately, his business income has decreased notably due to a deficiency of inventory. During the last two months, he has sold almost 85-90% of his inventory. There will be a lack of inventory to sell next month. Therefore, he should increase his working capital immediately. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase a larger number of electronics to increase the inventory for more sales.

loans.use: to purchase a larger number of electronics to increase the inventory for more sales.

loans.name: Joyce Grace

texts.en:
Joyce Grace is 35 years old, married and has two children. She's from Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 

Joyce Grace owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products. She has been one year in this business and she earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Joyce Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Joyce Grace is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comite se formo por medio de la Sra Nelida, quien había integrado anteriormente otro grupo, el cual tuvo que dejar por problemas personales, la misma decidió formar un nuevo grupo e invito a sus vecinas y amigas para que por medio del grupo puedan salir adelante. De esta forma se inicia el comité La Primavera.
La Sra Nelida es comerciante, tiene 53años, esta casada con el sr Leonor quien es Contratista de Obras,  juntos tienen 5 hijos. La señora Comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien por que ya tiene una clientela bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la comprar prendas de verano, lo cual la ayudara a abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes. Su meta es poner un local de ventas de verduras y frutas en un lugar estrategico.
texts.en:
